title: City break with sunshine
review: We have recently returned from a lovely seven day break at the Hotel Maestranza. We can highly recommend staying at this city centre hotel- it’s position is brilliant and the facilities there are excellent. We had a really well positioned room on the 10th floor and loved our balcony view, overlooking the sea, the port and the city. The staff were friendly and helpful and made our stay a very pleasant one. There was a good range of food provided for breakfast although the hot food could have been kept warmer. The rooftop terrace was a highlight- it gives a beautiful view over the city and is a lovely place to relax after a busy day. We will certainly be returning to the hotel Maestranza when we next visit Malaga.

title: Great hotel
review: Dear Dollydaydreams053,     Thank you so much for such a wonderful feedback and for rating us with 5 stars!     We celebrate that you enjoyed so much the location and we are glad for the kind words about the hotel.     We will more than happy to welcoming you in your next visit to Málaga.     Kind regards,     Marketing&Com   MS HOTELES

title: Good location
review: Fantastic location for beach, food and sightseeing. Just a 10 minute walk along the front to the cathedral where you can get really into the little streets and shopping alleys.  Hotel staff are fantastic and the rooms are very comfortable. Best beds ever!! If you’re a light sleeper ask or a room away from the main road as it is quite busy. The rooms on the opposite side overlook the bullring. Amazing!

title: Great Hotel
review: Dear Robbypeugeot,     Thank you so much for such a wonderful feedback and for rating us with 5* stars!     We celebrate that you enjoyed so much the location and we are glad for the kind words about the hotel.   We will more than happy to welcoming you in your next visit to Málaga.     Kind regards,     Marketing&Com   MS HOTELES

title: Brilliant
review: Stayed 5 nights with an old friend for a ‘girls’ break. The hotel is extreme well situated, and as this was out first visit to Malaga, it made getting around very easy.  The room was adequate and very clean, although the bathroom was rather small. I think they’d put modern dimension fittings in an older space.  The room was at the back on the fourth floor, so it had a lovely hillside view, was quiet, but got no afternoon sun. The big mystery was, why were there no chairs or table on the balcony? It was a pity, as we could not sit outside and enjoy the view. Good air conditioning, to cool the room down. I see from other comment that some rooms had coffee making facilities, our room did not. don’t know why. Breakfast was a reasonable standard and the food was very fresh. Looking at other contributors comments, I think our room was not the best, probably because we booked through a British on line company. Still we had a good time and the location was great.…

title: Amazing 4 day break
review: Just got back from a lovely 4 day break in Malaga staying in the MS Maestranza Hotel. The hotel is in the most perfect location, with the beach at the end of the road, the port/harbour around the corner and the old town just a 10 minute walk away. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. We did have a problem with our safe but it was fixed within hours with no problem what so ever. You can hire beach towels for 10€ deposit and €1  to hire.... Great help when you are restricted on your luggage. THE BEACH.... Is fantastic just 10€ for 2 sunbeds and a parasol for the whole day and every 10 mins you are offered beers/cold drinks/cocktails starting at 1.5€ by the local vendors.. They are freezing cold and brought to your sunbeds. One nuisance is the amount of times you…

title: Only one night, wish we had more time, Sept. 11, 2019
review: Dear Bernadette L,     Thank you so much for such a wonderful feedback and for rating us with 4 stars!     We celebrate that you like the stay in our rooms. We are happy to know that you enjoyed so much the location and we are glad for the kind words about the staff.     We will more than happy to welcoming you in your next visit to Málaga.     Kind regards,     Marketing&Com   MS HOTELES

title: Perfect stat
review: We flew into Malaga from New Orleans, LA by way of Washington, DC and Frankfurt, Germany, starting out early the day before, and arrived at this hotel at about 12 pm Malaga time. The two young ladies at the front desk were very helpful and took our luggage in the back someplace, since our room was not ready, so we could spend the afternoon sightseeing.   They were both very accomodating and pointed out where to go for the things we wanted to see. And restaurants including the one we went to for lunch/dinner along the harbor  The Parque Malaga is practically right out the front door, see picture from the breakfast area windows. Only a few blocks to the ramp up to the Castillo, although it is fairly steep to get to the top.  This hotel is a short walk to La Playa, the Harbor, the…

title: Nice location and friendly staff
review: Dear raybyerley,     Thank you so much for such a wonderful feedback and for rating us with 5 points!!     We celebrate that you like the stay in our rooms. We are happy to know that you enjoyed so much the location and we are glad for the kind words about the staff.     We will more than happy to welcoming you in your next visit to Málaga.     Kind regards,     Marketing&Com   MS HOTELES

title: September Stay
review: Well run, spotlessly clean hotel. Wonderful location. 5 mins to beach, 10 mins from Malaga centre, 5 mins to marina. Beside taxi rank and bus stops. Night view from top sun area. Friendly staff, good varied breakfast.

title: Great location for beach, harbour and centre
review: We stayed here as 2 friends on a 5 night stay in August 2019.  The hotel is in a great location.  We caught the train from Malaga airport for a couple of euro each then it was 6 euro from the station in a taxi straight to the hotel. The room was spacious and clean with a mini bar, safe, tv and small balcony.  The bathroom had an excellent power shower and hairdryer. The buffet breakfast had everything you'd expect as well as a nespresso machine. The rooftop has a fantastic view of its surroundings including the bull ring.  There are several sunbeds up there so you can relax after a day out. We didn't use the jacuzzi or gym.  The taxi rank is right outside. There's a cafe/bakery over the road which is excellent. The harbour is a 5 min walk where there are plenty of…

title: Very Nice Stay in Great Location
review: Dear cherylw588,  Thank you so much for such a wonderful feedback and for rating us with 4 points!!  We celebrate that you like the stay in our rooms. We are happy to know that you enjoyed so much the location and we are glad for the kind words about the hotel services.   We will more than happy to welcoming you in your next visit to Málaga.  Kind regards,  Marketing&Com MS HOTELES

title: Hotel
review: We stopped here as a couple in June for a week and would recommend this hotel for a few reasons. Firstly there is the location of the hotel, well placed on the edge of the port and a nice promenade walk of approx 15 minutes to the main town shopping area.There were lots of little shops and supermarkets around the Hotel and the beach is very close and by turning left out of the Hotel it was literally 5 minutes walk down the road. Sunbeds and umbrella were already laid out and cost 5 euros for the day. We had a corner room on the 6th floor and overlooked the Bullring and Castle at the rear and the port at the front. We were booked in for Half Board  and ate in the Hotel every morning and night.  The Breakfast was buffet style and with all the expected usual food from a cooked…

title: Wedding anniversary trip
review: Dear Steve85036,  Thank you so much for such a wonderful feedback and for rating us with 4* stars!  It is a pride for us to know about the wonderful stay of our guest and know that they will come with us again.  Thank you for the lovely words about the location and the food.   We are looking forward too see you again.  Kind regards,  Marketing&Com MS HOTELES

title: Best customer service ever
review: Very good hotel. Everyone who worked there was very friendly (from the people at the desk to the cleaningladies!). Nice room, big enough. The wifi was great. There was a safe in the room and for once it was easy to use :)!  We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel because there are options outside of it.  On the top floor there is a solarium, a jacuzzi, a hamam, ...  You can also get massages, but you’ll have to pay for those.

title: Great location and good value
review: Stayed here for a work conference. Nice hotel very central, next to the bull ring and a short walk from the old town and the beach. Pros: staff were very helpful, breakfast good and the roof top terrace has excellent views, a hot tub and a small gym.  Not much to criticise- you get what you pay for and this was excellent value for money.   Would recommend for business trips or short city break.

title: Excellent budget hotel in Malaga
review: Dear William U,     Thank you very much for your 4* star rating for our MS Maestranza Hotel!     We are very happy to know that you enjoyed both the stay and the location, it is true that we are in a privileged place.  We hope to welcome you again soon in your new home in Malaga!     A cordial greeting,     Marketing & Communication   MS HOTELS

title: We really liked this hotel--great location.
review: Great location next to the port and walkable to the old town, bars, restaurants, Cervantes / Picasso, museums, art galleries, and other attractions. Nice spa at the top floor to relax, with a friendly bar. Decent breakfast and bedrooms, with friendly helpful staff all round.

title: Very good
review: Dear SimonGlobal,     Thank you very much for your 5* star rating for our MS Maestranza Hotel!     We are very happy to know that you enjoyed the stay!    We hope to welcome you again soon in your new home in Malaga!     A cordial greeting,     Marketing & Communication   MS HOTELS

title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
review: The hotel was very comfortable, the reception personnel were nice and very professional. We reserved a superior room with a small balcony and the view was very nice--sea on one side and the city on the other. Of course, we didn't stay in the room much because it had a fabulous location that was within walking distance of the beach, the cathedral, the old town. The tapas bars in the old town were fabulous and fun. The beach was beautiful and out of season, so not too crowded. There were coffee shops and ATMs literally next door--very convenient. It was a quiet nice room, and we really enjoyed staying there. Definitely would stay there again.

title: Great hotel choice, excellent location
review: We were delighted with this hotel, the rooms are nice, beautiful views, and the place is spotless.  It’s a 6 minute walk to the heart of everything without having to endure the crowds in the city centre which was good as we were visiting at the start of Holy Week.  We didn’t go for the breakfast option but the food in the restaurant looked beautiful. We prefer to eat out but I don’t think you’d be disappointed if you decided to dine in.  There were 2 beautiful cafes less than a minute from the front door and we loved them both .  Located very near the harbour, the Pompidou Centre is only moments away and the hotel is served by several buses which are regularl and easy to use.  There’s a taxi rank outside the door.  If you get lost just ask for the Bull Ring-it’s next door! …

title: Rooms feel like 3 stars
review: Roughly speaking, we can see two types of hotels with 4 stars: modern/new and classic/old hotels. The modern hotels, often belonging to hotel chains, tend to have standardized all important aspects of your hotel stay. As such, everything is pretty good: the beds, the decor, the sheets, the bathroom, etc. The classic hotels - and I'm specifically referring to the older hotels - may have risen to 4 stars years ago, and may have done some aspects of the room really good, but other aspects less so, or some things may have become outdated.  MS Maestranza in Màlaga feels like it belongs to the 2nd category. If we focus purely on the rooms, I would rate it as a 3 star hotel. The room has some problems, but by far the biggest problem is that it is not soundproof at all. At around 11 pm…

title: Great hotel
review: Just returned from a week’s holiday in Malaga. We stayed at the Maestranza which has a wonderful location convenient for both the old town and the seafront. The room was surprisingly spacious with a balcony overlooking the Alcazaba. The hotel staff were all excellent in every way but I must particularly mention Jaoquin and Soledad in the bar and restaurant. There are many excellent restaurants within walking distance so we only ate in the hotel on one occasion but the food was first class. Malaga is a really interesting city and we cannot wait to return.

title: GOOD POSITION NEAR HARBOUR AND OLD TOWN
review: Stayed 4 nights in April. Hotel is located on a very busy road with a small entrance.Traffic noise permeates rooms on the front of the hotel. Rooms are on the small side but reasonably well equipped. No coffeee or tea facility. Breakfast room was very crowded at peak times.  Staff are very helpfull.

title: Brilliant Hotel & Central
review: What a hotel bang in the middle of all the sites  Great position for all the amenities of the City  Also a great Restaurant over the road from the Hotel  The Hotel it self is lovely and clean and the breakfast has a grey choice Friendly staff lovely rooms Would come back any time

title: Holiday stay
review: Stayed here with a friend, great position with the sea to the left, marina opposite and old town to the right. Breakfast was good quality but would have liked tea and coffee in the room. The room was ok, poor quality toiletries. The bath/shower needed replacing. There is a small balcony but no chairs. The hotel is on a busy road but has excellent sound proofing. The staff are great. Air con is excellent. Beds are comfortable. The therapist upstairs on the roof is good and offers reasonably priced treatments. I would stay here again.

title: Wonderful stay
review: This Hotel is vary handy for the harbour, and a walk of about 15 mins to town. Buses and taxi are close by. The Hotel was very clean, art deco style furniture in the rooms, small balcony not able to sit out at night and watch the world go by. Spacious bathroom largest I seen for a long time. We had a room overlooking the bull ring, which is undergoing some work, but this does not disturb you as the room is  well protected from the noise. The only problem we had was a damp patch on the roof of the shower, it could be a build up of condensation. We ould return to this hotel again. All the staff are FANTASTIC.

title: Great location
review: We have just returned from a short break here, I was going to write a long review praising the Hotel but having read the reviews, mine would be a repeat of all the below ones. Positives staff, location, rooms, view. Negative no tea and coffee making facilities, just get a machine in the lobby maybe.

title: City Break
review: Not much else to ad to all the other positive reviews but the bar/restaurant area is great for a relaxing drink either abeforeor after your daily or evening walk. One thing I would like to mention is how easy it is to get to the hotel from the airport,as you leave the arrivals door just walk straight ahead to the bus stops and get on the lines A bus which stops at the roundabout about 100 yards from the hotel and costs 3euros ,you use the same service for the return journey. The taxi for the same journey costs anything from 20 to 25euros .

title: Great location
review: My wife and I spent a long weekend in this hotel. Got line A bus, from the airport the last stop is just across the road from the hotel. It runs every 30 minutes and was only 3 euro (at time of review). Nice warm welcome at the hotel, and very smooth check in. We were given a room on the 8th floor that overlooked the marina, up to the castle, and a view of the bull ring to the side excellent, it also had a nice balcony. It was very clean and was perfect for our needs. Perhaps tea/coffee making facilities would have been the icing on the cake, but no real issue. Breakfast was very good with a good selection and plenty of it. My wife needs Gluten free, and this was well catered for by simply mentioning it to the waiting staff.  The location was perfect just across from the marina …

title: Wonderful
review: Just returned from a week in this hotel we moved front a room on the 7th floor to room 1106 view was spectacular over the marina and alcazaba very clean room and great staff breakfast was great and the location was perfect for the beach town and marina. Only thing lacking was coffee and tea making facilities in room otherwise a great hotel would go back.

title: OK stay
review: Stayed one night at this property. Central location, clean and modern. a £5 cab ride from train station and £21 to airport (including airport surcharge). Great roof top outdoor patio and attached hot tub area. Fantastic restaurant just across the street.  I got a lower floor street facing room which was noisy. Should have read the room reviews!  Was not overwhelmed with restaurant/bar area and the menu prices were very high.

title: Comfortable hotel in great location
review: RIght at the end of the port, near the Centre Pompidou, this modern hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance of the historic center as well as the beaches in La Malagueta neighborhood right behind. Small rooftop terrace with spectacular view of the entire city. Jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. Nothing fancy but good to have.

title: Great hotel.
review: We spent 10 nights at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. Yes, the rooms are a little dated, but are kept in a very clean state. The massive positive for this hotel is its location. Very close to the beach on one side and the port on the other and a superb short walk through the park to reach the city centre. We found the staff to be most professional and friendly. Would heartily recommend! Great views from the terrace

title: stunning
review: Have just returned from spending 5 fantastic days in Malaga city, most of all in a comfortable well kept hotel Maestranza.  This hotel is so well placed for your every need,  a 5-10 minute walk will take you to the beach, the port and city center. We had a stunning room on the 8th floor with views over the bull ring the beach and across to the Alcazaba. Lovely cafe over the road with fantastic cake selection, well placed for places to eat. Lovely breakfast, spotless bedroom and lovely warm and welcoming staff.  We have stayed in some hotels and this ranks way up there.  A big thank you to all the great staff.

title: Another lovely stay
review: We returned for our third time for a week. Lovely welcome and a great room with views over the harbour and the alcazaba. The hotel is ideally placed with an easy walk to city centre and surrounded by numerous restaurants. Some buses stop just across the road and there is a taxi rank just outside. A few hundred meters to the east is the beach area where there are sun beds to hire but also some public benches. Breakfast is comprehensive, basically you have what you want and there is always ample. Dinner is not so good. It is available as a set menu for 18€.  Three courses and three choices of each.  Most dishes were good, portion size quite big but menu planning somewhat strange. As an example starter was local salad with potatoes, main course timbale of scrambled eggs with mixed…

title: Close to everything
review: Our first stay in Malaga. The hotel is situated in a convenient location and has all of Malaga’s amenities on the doorstep. We were on 6 th floor looking at The Alcazaba and the Bull Ring. I think this is important that people know this. I am highly offended by bull rings and what goes on there. I was horrified to wake up to the full sight of it. It is not in use thankfully and looks like it’s under long term repair. Either way I feel I should inform others because if a fight was going on when I stayed there I’d have moved hotels. That is only my opinion and others of you may not be so bothered. Live and let live.  Saying that.... we found the staff pleasant, the hotel very clean indeed. Room smelt divine on arrival with clean sheets and a super clean bathroom. A huge bed which…

title: Excellent location
review: We really enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Maestranza.  The location is outstanding - a 2 minute walk from the terminus of the airport bus (linea A, 3 euros), 5 minutes to the beach and Muelle Uno and about 10 minutes from the town centre. We had requested a quiet room on a high floor with good views and that is exactly what we got.  Our view over the bullring and Alcazaba was lovely and  there was no traffic noise at all. Staff were friendly and accommodating.  All in all, an excellent and well-priced option for Malaga.

title: Perfect location in Malaga
review: Loved this location.great service. Beautiful room with great view. Walkable to either center of tourist or beach. Great restaurants close by and great safe area to walk around. Great views of water or major attractions. Would return

title: New Year in Malaga
review: Susi and I arrived in Malaga for a weeks stay on December 26th. We had not previously stayed in the  MS Maestranza. The hotel is placed in a great location slightly east of the Main town centre but right beside the marina area of Muello Uno. We were given room 1106 which was a corner site overlooking the marina with great views of the Alcazaba. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with a huge double bed. Rooms were cleaned daily and the floors were mopped even on December 31st and January 1st. There is a nice bar on the first floor which is very comfortable and welcoming.

title: Lovely Short Break.
review: Have recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is very comfortable and all the staff were extremely friendly. The rooms were quite large and the bathroom had a very nice shower. Only criticism is traffic noise was very loud, but to be expected being in the middle of a city. The hotel is in a perfect location 10 mins to the beach and old town and 5 mins to harbour. Loved Malaga and especially the old town which was amazing, also stunning Christmas lights. Great short break, would definitely recommend ❤

title: Wonderful hotel in perfect location
review: My husband and I spent a wonderful 3 nights here a few weeks ago. The hotel has a fantastic location 5 minutes from the Malagueta beach and the marina and 10 minutes from the old town (pleasant seafront or garden walk). We had a great corner room on the 11th floor with absolutey stunning panoramic views across the marina,  gardens towards old town and alcazaba and gibalfaro (with a balcony to enjoy this). It was a pleasure to watch the ever chamging colours by day and night and witness some fantastic sunsets. The room itself was spacious, clean and well serviced. For our anniversary the hotel sent up a small bottle of Malagan wine and chocolate which was a lovely touch - thank you! Bed and pillows are very comfortable and plenty of toiletries, replenished every day. Some people…

title: Great long weekend
review: Hotel is in a great position very handy for everything. Fast and friendly check in, stayed on the 7th floor in a back room that overlooked the bull ring. The rooms are quite dated but have everything you need and are spotlessly clean. Room to leave your luggage after checking out and taxi rank just outside.

title: Great little hotel
review: Hotel is situated near the muelleuno harbour and gardens, which is about a 15 minute walk from Calle Larius the main shopping street. Bars, restaurants, bakery and beach all within 5 minutes. Room decent size and breakfast good. nice rooftop terrace. Recommend for city breaks or business.

title: Nice
review: The location is good and the hotel is ok.not over the top for fancy people but all in all is a good experience. Breakfast is ok,  repeating the same dishes but good. Room is ok, large and clean. Easy access to public transportation and 100m away from the beach and marina

title: Average
review: good - location, check in and out speed, friendly staff, hotel bar, room size and valet parking. Poor - Shower over bath it leaked. Breakfast buffet the quality wasnt great and the tea and coffee disgusting.  Overall happy with the location and did have a good nights sleep but not worth the money they are charging.

title: Good service and a great position
review: A slightly dated infrastructure (tiny and very slow lifts) did not detract from a great stay. The rooms are very large by modern standards and pretty well equipped (no kettle though). Everything worked properly in the room and bathroom and there was a large balcony. The breakfast selection was not huge but the food was very good  and fresh. The staff were a huge plus all being friendly and helpful and the whole place was spotless

title: Great hotel and location
review: We wanted to be close to beach and centre for our weekend and this hotel ticked the boxes. Friendly check in. Stayed on top floor 1209. Yes a busy road outside but nothing to annoy us. Nice room and good size. There was a gym, sauna and a spa pool on floor above us. Good views of town from the roof. We had breakfast on 2 mornings. 14euro each but worth it as good selection of nice food. Also had a couple of first class G&T’s watching Spain struggle against Bosnia. Easy walk to beach, marina and into the town via the park. Overall we thought good value and location

title: Not worth the price
review: Ok, situated central in the city. But not worth 4 stars. A lot of traffical noise. Problems with the sewage I think. A constant smell from the bathroom, you need to keep the door closed.They spray with strong detergents to conceal ut. Difficult to breathe if you have astmatic problems.  The breakfast is very nice though. And always taxies ready outside.

title: So laut! so noisy!
review: This hotel is located 3 minutes away from the beach and not so far away from the centre. But it is so noisy - even when you close the windows. And you are not directly in the pretty old town. The pictures on the website are very nice. I had a little view at the city- but from my room the directly view was on a sad looking house front. And really it was so noisy - for me always a cause not to stay in the room. I was stressed by the location and the noise. The hotel is situated directly on the main street from Malaga - you can hear it and feel it. And attention: even it is one of the expensive hotels - breakfast is not included.

title: Convenient location good hotel
review: Stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is 2 minutes from the harbour with it’s restaurant, 5 mins from beach, 10 mins from old town. Well maintained hotel, clean, friendly staff. We had one meal in the restaurant- surprisingly cheap for a hotel meal and high quality food. Comfy beds, quiet nights’ sleep. View from rooftop deck is stunning.

title: Fine Overnight
review: This was a good choice for us for an overnight, close to the sea, with lovely views from the rooftop and a dramatic look down into the bullring. A real plus is that the airport bus stops almost directly across the street. Hotel is modern and doesn't have a distinct personality. That being said, the rooms are quite large, very clean and super comfortable and the bathroom is spacious and extremely well equipped. The staff was friendly and helpful and pleased to assist us. The breakfast room is large and the buffet is terrific. It's only a fifteen minute walk to the Big Wheel, beyond which are a multitude of restaurants and cafes. It suited our needs perfectly.

title: Perfect for City and beach break
review: My husband and I stayed at the MS recently for 4 nights. The Hotel is well situated for City, Harbour area and beach all easily reached by foot. We received a warm welcome from the Reception Staff who enquired what type of view we would prefer and allocated us a room on the 12th floor with fabulous views of the sites of Malaga, the harbour and sea. I have stayed in Malaga often but the views at night were spectacular. The room was very comfortable and pleasant with a good mini bar and air con system. There is a roof top terrace with loungers and chairs with again excellent views. This is a city hotel and the traffic can be busy however the room was not noisy when the balcony door was closed. We had a lovely time here and hope to return soon.

title: Short break in Malaga
review: Well positioned hotel to visit most local attractions. Staff very friendly and breakfast and room good. Traffic noise is the main concern. We were on the third floor and in the middle of the week it was noisy late and early morning

title: Worst visit to a hotel in Malaga city
review: This was the worst hotel we have stopped in, in Malaga city. We wanted to stay at the Malagueta end of Malaga city to experience it. When we arrived at the hotel the security guard was aggresive and asked why we were there, the recptionist also had a "couldn't care less attitude and was most unhelpful. Later in the day when we rang for room service no one answered and we waited for over 5 minutes on the phone.Our room seeemed good but the air condotioning was either full on cold or nothing. so we switched it off. We have stayed in Malaga city many times at various hotels and we can honestly say this is a terriblke hotel, dont stay there !!!!

title: Great location and room.
review: The checkin was simple and fast. We where given a room on 12 floor with great view . The room had everything fridge, safe and comfortable bed. They had coffee maker without coffe supplies. The location was great in the middle of everything.

title: Great stay and good value
review: Great stay in Malaga. Right in the centre near the port and bull ring. It’s about 15/20 min walk to Picasso and the main restaurants. Staff very friendly and room was excellent with amazing views. The roof top terrace and spa was really good. Great views and it was great to relax! Definitely come again!

title: Second stay and no complaints
review: Another great stay - see my earlier review from last year.  Lovely room on tenth floor with great views.  Staff friendly, pleasant and very helpful. Breakfast even better than last year - we never had a problem getting a table.  Wifi works very well. Location is great - taxi rank at corner.  Line A bus straight from the airport stops nearby - the stop is on same side as the port  - it was the opposite side of the road last year.  Galopain Cafe, next to hotel, is nice for a drink - as is La Canasta across the road. The cakes and chocolates in La Canasta are gorgeous. We had dinner in nearby Delfines (fish) and Pala D'Oro (Italian) as well as eating in town - nice stroll in.  We enjoyed Mura Mura/Vineria De Cervantes/ Taberna de Monroy and Pampa Grill.  We did not have dinner in…

title: Good location
review: Had a three night stay in July with two friends. Room overlooked the bullring and The Alcazaba and castle. Our room had two single beds and a sofa bed, which in my opinion should have been another either single bed or double as the sofa bed was not the best and there was enough room for another proper bed. Beds and lovely bathroom were very clean but being a party of three ladies we did notice how dusty the floor in the bedroom was, it wasn't cleaned during our stay. Staff were very polite and very helpful, especially the reception staff and porter. Breakfast was good, although on our second day we did have to wait a few minutes for a table. The location was excellent, with approximately 5 minutes walk to the harbour and beach and 10 minutes to the beautiful old town. Bus stops…

title: Great location
review: This hotel is in the perfect location if you are spending time in Malaga. It was a few minute walk to the beach and under ten minutes to get to the central plaza.  Hotel is located right next to the bull fighting ring which was an interesting experience to see from our deck. You could also see the castle and alcazaba from the room. Request a higher floor for beautiful views. Only complaint was there was a coffee machine in the room, but no supplies for coffee including coffee itself which we found odd.

title: Close to everything in the city center
review: Nice clean hotel with big rooms. Breakfast OK. Fantastic view from the top floor. Close to everything in the city center with museums, cathedral, tropical park etc. as well as the beach. The bus to the airport stops on the other side of the junction.

title: Hotel MS Maestranza - well worth the visit
review: TripAdvisor members rated this hotel as a 4 and this is definitely right, this hotel is all about the excellent location and not about the facilities.  I recently stayed in the Avanti Hotel in Paphos, which was excellent and had everything you could ever wish for, but this hotel had very little to offer in terms of a swimming pool, traditional bar, entertainment, evening meals etc.  This hotel appealed to us for the location, and ease to get around and see things, the bullring was directly outside our window, the great beach was literally 2 minutes away, the harbour with all the bars, shops and boat trips all within a couple minutes walk.  The walkways to the Alcazaba of Málaga and Gibralfaro were just behind the hotel, an excellently priced bakery/cafe was directly opposite the…

title: Location
review: Great hotel, staff pleasant, fantastic location everything within easy access. Beach 2mins, Port 2mins and a short walk into central Malaga. I would highly recommend. Don’t let this put you off but it’s a bit Noisy with traffic at the weekend so take ear plugs (they help). We have been several times 😎

title: Location
review: Hotel is on a nice location. Close to the port, the beach and the city.  Can easily walk to the city but can also easily get there by car. And is relatively close drive to the airport.  Room was clean, bathroom clean. Bed a bit too hard for me. Nothing outstanding. Just good.

title: Nice but noisy
review: The hotel is well positioned for getting around in Malaga. It’s close to the beach, the harbour, the Castillo Gibralfaro, a very lovely park and The Alcazaba. It has beautiful views of all these, plus the Bull Ring too. The rooftop terrace with hot tub is lovely and scenic. Also, the breakfast is very nice and the hotel is very clean. Unfortunately, for us it was a bit noisy. This is because it is located next to very busy road where the drivers like to use there horns. We nicknamed this road the M25. After reading reviews we asked for a room on a high floor, however we were placed on the 3rd floor. It did affect our sleep and relaxation. I can only recommend this hotel if you can get on a high floor.

title: Hotel MS Maestranza Love this hotel.
review: Loved this hotel, great location, 5 minutes from the beach and the port and the lighthouse. The old town is 10-15 minutes along a beautiful park. You can't ask for a more central hotel. The rooms are lovely, beds really comfortable, lovely bathroom. The roof terrace is lovely with great views over the harbour and the bullring.. The staff are very friendly and very helpful, nothing is too much trouble, from showing us restaurants to go to , to finding wgere we had booked tours from near Constitution Square. Just a lovely place to stay.

title: post cruise
review: The hotel was clean. About 30 mins from airport. Taxi stand next to and around the corner from hotel. Drivers a little short on speaking English but you still can get by. The breakfast was good. About 10 to 15.mins from cruise port. A short walk 15-20 mins or so to where shopping  square and things to see, also nice big church in the area to see. The were very helpful there. We stayed here before and after the cruise. Flights in and out of Malaga do not run too certain places all the time.

title: Excellent hotel
review: Was really impressed with the hotel which is next to the bull ring and enjoyed our stay for the week and not too far to walk into town and only 5 mins to beach There is also a few supermarkets close by and a few cake shops The rooms were cleaned to a very high standard every day and clean towels every day We ate twice there and meals were very good and breakfast in the morning was top notch with a mixture of hot food and also a cold buffet as well Would definitely return to this hotel

title: Perfect week in Malaga
review: We recently spent a week at the hotel as we like the idea of visiting a city with a beach. This gives plenty of things to see and do but a beach to relax on later in the day. We were given a high floor room overlooking the bull ring and castle, the room was nice me big with the most comfy bed I have slept on in a hotel. Breakfast was included and as the breakfast room was open until 11every day (why don't more hotels offer this? We are on holiday) we made the most of it. Breakfast was standard fare and there was always fresh eggs available. The hotel position is perfect a five minute stroll to the beach and ten minutes to the city centre with all the action, we came back late every night and the area always seemed safe. Overall an excellent choice for the money and we would not…

title: Great location
review: Stayed here for 2nd time. Location great & staff very accommodating. Very near beach & harbour with 5/10 minute stroll to the city. Rooms are v clean & beds so comfortable! Will be returning next year!

title: Very nice stay
review: We had a great stay at the end of May. Located next to the airport shuttle bus stop and the modern harbour front, beach is just 3 mins walk away.  Room was well decorated, nice bathroom double sink and clean. Hotel staff were efficient and polite, wi fi worked well, breakfast was a good selection of hot and cold food. We also had a couples massage on the roof spa which was first class. A taxi to the train station 5euro..it is a city centre hotel so there was some noise from party people in the early hours but the room was well insulated, air con worked well so only a minor inconvenience. Walk into the centre is very nice by the harbour walkway or the gardens and takes 10 mins. Enjoy.

title: A great base for exploring Malaga
review: Good sized, comfortable room. We were on 8th floor above the main street, but also with balcony views of the harbour area. There was some traffic noise at night, but not enough to bother us. Air con worked very well. Spotless bathroom with a good shower. Wide selection of food at breakfast. Staff friendly and attentive - good suggestions on places to visit and directions to get there.  Location wise, the beach is a 5 minute stroll, the harbour and cultural centre is just across the road, and the city centre is a 20 minute walk or €5 taxi ride (& taxi rank is only 2 doors away). The main bus stops are less than a 5 minute walk, including the city sightseeing bus. Plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area.  Our room rate included a free bottle of water, but it wasn't there on…

title: Great location
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five nights.  We had a room on the third floor with pleasant views from the balcony and a bird’s eye view of the bull ring next door.  Fortunately, there was no bull fight on while we were there.  The location of the hotel is excellent; close to the beach, the marina and an easy 10-minute walk to the old town.  Reception staff were friendly and polite and we were provided with a city map upon arrival, but no information was provided about the city or places to visit which would have been helpful given it was our first time there. The room was comfortable as was the bed, but I couldn’t get comfortable with the pillows provided.  Lovely bathroom with a great shower.  Had all the basic toiletries but no body lotion provided.  We also had no…

title: I would not rate this 4 star, disappointing for what it cost....
review: We booked this hotel for a week away in Malaga and unfortunately were quite disappointed.   When we arrived we went up to our room and it was very dated, dusty, dull and had far too much furniture in it for a small room. There was something that looked like dried blood splatted on the wall and the room looked unclean. The bathroom was not very clean, especially around the bath. We were heading out for food as we hadn’t eaten all day so when we came back to the hotel later we asked nicely if there was any chance we could move rooms and explained why. The reception staff were not very understanding or friendly and just said “not possible, ask again tomorrow maybe”.  Luckily the next day there was another lady on the reception who was much more friendly and helpful and managed to…

title: Girls' Trip
review: The hotel is well situated with a friendly and helpful staff. The room was a nice size, as was the bathroom. The room also appeared to have been decorated recently so looked rather nice. We had a lovely view. The breakfast had a good variety to choose from and gave us a perfect start to the day. An easy stroll to the old town and right next to the harbour area. Quiet place so not disturbed by noise during the night. Personally the pillows were far too hard, but that is a matter of preference. There is a small roof terrace, which had a few sun loungers and parasols (would have been a nice touch if they did more with the terrace), and there is a jacuzzi there, too. We were unfortunate to have an unpleasant smell in the bathroom, but the staff did what they could to fix this, and…

title: Really good hotel!
review: The hotel itself is great. The road outside is busy and it takes ages to cross the road which is very noisy. The views are however superb.  Warm and friendly quick and efficient check in. Great concierge/security on duty which is reassuring. The rooms are spotless and well equipped with individually controlled efficient air conditioning.  Great balconies which unfortunately have no chairs or sun as the sun is always overhead.  The restaurant for dinner is superb. I can't fault it. Lovely staff who genuinely care about looking after you. They create a great atmosphere. The food is excellent. Well prepared and presented.  Short walk to the promenade. This hotel deserves all it's good reviews.  We made the right choice.

title: Lovely break in Malaga
review: Great hotel location couldn't be better. Staff very attentive and friendly.  Our room was a good size with balcony. Rooms cleaned daily . Breakfast good and nice dinning area. Added bonus of roof sun loungers and hot tub. Wonderful views of Malaga.

title: Good,well located hotel
review: Stayed here for a week in April 2018,my second visit. Requested a high floor with view of port and Alcazaba and got a wonderful view from the 12th floor. Airport bus stops only metres away and costs 3 euros each way. The location is excellent ,a lovely walk to the old part of the city through the gardens,beach and port area very close to the hotel. The hotel is very clean,breakfast is ok.The beds are extremely comfortable.There is a mini bar in the room. On the minus side,even from the 12th floor the traffic noise is horrendous as the hotel is beside a roundabout and a very busy road.There is no furniture on the balconies. The roof terrace has stunning views and a lot of potential but is rather run down with a few loungers and not much else. Would I stay here again?No,I think I…

title: Great hotel at a perfect location
review: Very friendly and helpful staff at the reception, the restaurant , the bar and the rooms. The hotel is very close to the park, the beach and 15 minutes walking from the city centre. We had a room on the 12th. floor. This was a big room with a bathroom including power shower,and power stream bath. The room has been very clean every day. Breakfast is extensive and the bread fresh. We had dinner in the hotel: this was great, well prepared and very tasty. Taxi to the airport takes approx. 15 minutes and costs 20-25 euro

title: Convenient location
review: So glad we added Malaga to our tour.  Thish otel was very convenient to all we wanted to do and the staff was friendly and helpful.  Amenities included a lovely breakfast buffet, roof top health center and spa.

title: Dave and Jean Newcastle upon Tyne
review: Great hotel in a great location. 15min from airport €22. Marina bars and restaurants nearby. Town centre 10 minute walk away. Sightseeing bus close by. The hotel amenities are good with health centre on roof top and great views. The Restaurant and Bar nicely laid out. Breakfast in the Restaurant has excellent choice of English or Continental. Staff friendly and helpful. A wonderful experience all round for our 5 day stay.

title: Great location
review: We travelled to Malaga for a weekend city break. This hotel is ideally located. 5 minuters to Beach, 5 minutes to Harbour and 5 minutes to the airport bus stop. The Hotel is clean, the rooms were large . The Power shower was amazing.  Breakfast was the usual buffet , sausages, bacon eggs , fruit plenty of cold meats etc.  Staff were fine and spoke decent english.

title: Almost a nice hotel
review: I was excited to be at a trip advisor 4 star rated hotel for a night, and to be honest I loved the location (minutes from the beach). I was initially put in a room for the disabled, which had a bathroom that didn’t separate the shower from the toilet and I’m glad they have them, but shouldn’t they be  reserved for those who need it? I notified the front desk and they were nice enough to move me to a different room, so no problem there...  I would have given it 3 stars given the chipping mirror and deteriorating bathroom door (still not a big deal). At 10pm When I showered, the water came out discolored just slightly enough that I could tell. So I plugged the drain and turned on the hot water to see if my eyes were deceiving me. The color of the water was indeed a rusty brown…

title: decent hotel - quite straight laced
review: first room had v,v  slippy bathroom - i slipped and fell badly. I advised reception but not interested and no investigation. I found a better room by chance and was moved. Aircon not effective despite attention by 3 guys. great location near beach, port and old town which is buzzing. 2 very good cafes within a minutes stroll so no need to try the rather overpriced breakfasts. all rooms have balconies but no chairs. Overall fell short of a 4 star hotel. Strangely the minibar had a number of spirit bottles that were part full. those that were full could be opened only with a penknife. The place could be so much better

title: Great Hotel
review: My husband and I stayed for a week in this hotel and loved it.  Superb location easy walking distance to all of Malagas sights.  Our room on the 11th floor was lovely the bed was very comfortable.  The hotel was very clean and the staff were great, friendly and helpful. Stayed bed and breakfast and there was lot's of choice. Would highly recommend a visit, we would go there again.

title: Busy location
review: Check in was quick but with no attempt made to explain the hotel services or anything about the local area.  Had booked a Superior Room. Allocated a tenth floor room which overlooked the very busy main road. The main problem was that the balcony door didn’t quite pull completely closed so the road noise remained quite intrusive as was the drunken shouting from the street below at about 3am.  The room itself was a decent size with a few inclusive extras such as a coffee machine, room safe and mini bar. Some fixtures such as the wall lights looked like they were last dusted some considerable time ago.   The bathroom contained a spa bath and separate shower cubicle (although the door to this was incredibly difficult to open & close probably just down to age). There was an old…

title: Short city break
review: We visited Malaga for a short break and wanted a hotel near the harbour. The MS Maestranza was perfect. A 5 minutes walk from the harbour and overlooking the bull ring . Our room on the 8th floor had a spectacular view of the castle which is light at night . The staff very friendly and no complaints about service. The restaurant was quite small but better for it. We enjoyed the choices for breakfast and the view over the road did not detract from the harbour, it is a city hotel after all . We chose to stay half board and there was a choice of daily inclusive meals which we found typically Spanish using local produce and recipes. The local rosada fish was fabulous. If our teenage children were here they may have been limited as they are not as adventurous. Rooms were cleaned…

title: Weekend break
review: Disappointed there were no tea/coffee facilities in room fora 4* hotel. Rooms were clean. Breakfast excellent but dinner was not good, poor service , over cooked chicken, and my husband ordered chicken soup with pasta and egg, it had no egg or pasta and it was basically a liquid with leftover chicken in it. Very central, book a high room for the lovely views

title: Excellant hotel in a great location
review: Stayed here for a week from 6th January 2018 The hotel was lovely and clean and the staff very professional and friendly. From arrival to departure we were looked after very well. I had asked the Tour Operator if I could have a high floor room as the road is very busy. As soon as we arrived the receptionist acknowledged this before I could even mention it. She gave us a room on the 13th floor with the most amazing views from the Balcony of the sea the harbour the wheel the gardens the castle and the cathedral! Just amazing! Breakfast was amazing and we even had Cava free flowing as well as all the Juices and hot drinks and a vast selection of hot and cold food. Walking to the Centre from the hotel took 10-15 minutes through some lovely gardens with views of the Harbour and…

title: Classy hotel in superb location
review: Our 3 night stay here allowed us to explore the harbour and the old quarter very easily on foot as the Maestranza is superbly located. We had a panoramic view of the bull ring, the castle and the Alcazaba from our room, and the breakfast/dining room and its large windows provide a visual spectacle of the Paseo Del Parque and its surrounding lush gardens. Our room was stylish and comfortable. There was a nice sense of calm at breakfast, which is by no means standard at Spanish hotels in the coast, and there was a reasonable choice of food. The team on Reception are personable, friendly, welcoming and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay in this elegant and interesting part of the city.

title: Fantastic
review: Great location to access all parts of the city, great room with the most fantastic views in a great hotel. Very clean throughout, good breakfast, not all hot, but very good selection. Very friendly staff. Would highly recommend this hotel for a visit to Malaga.

title: Outstanding
review: We returned again this year and found the hotel better than ever. Its position is ideal near the marina and beach but only a short walk from the city centre. (5 Euros by taxi from the station).  Staff are lovely, welcoming and helpful. We had half board with evening meal. Breakfast was whatever you wanted  including cooked. Dinner was a choice of 3 starters, mains and desserts. We aim to return next year.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Stayed for a week and enjoyed the hotel and Malaga very much. Very accessible. Bus stop five minutes from hotel. The room was spotless and had a beautiful view of the Bullring and the castle and even the sea if one stretched one’s neck from the balcony. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. A buffet which was very comprehensive. Would definitely recommend.

title: Malaga hotel
review: Stayed 1 night in transit prior to boarding a cruise ship. Don't know what we paid as part of cruise package, but can book today for £119 (2 people  B&B). Excellent English spoken by all staff who were very helpful. Room available at 11.00am, & we could stay until noon next day. English type breakfast buffet all you could want, room tidy & comfortable, other facilities (ie spa) not used. Good value, well located to see local sights within walking distance. Would certainly use this hotel again.

title: Very good hotel !
review: Very clean room, spacious,with good views.  The spa with jacuzzi and dry/wet sauna on the 13th floor is a must try. Staff was very helpful .Very close to city centre and the marina. Definitely would recommend!

title: Perfect stay in Malaga
review: Stayed in this hotel Jan 2018 ...weather good. Room clean . Nice bar. And it's close to the marina.and a walk along to the beach. Bus from airport took half hour at 3 euros fab, from the roof top you look into bull ring and see right across the port. It's a 10min walk into the old town, where there is lots of lovely restaurants and bars, shops, cathedral is a must . And also a lot of good museum s, the castle is a hike. Not good for those who cannot walk good. Also go to bus station and for 1 euro 70 a great day out or afternoon to torremolinos or belamedeana. Well worth a look. Altogether a good three days we had

title: Great Hotel in a great location
review: The view from the terrace is amazing (the port, the alcazaba, and the centre), especially at night time when everything is lit up. The hotel is close to the restuarants and shops near the marina and only a 5 minute walk from the main central area of Malaga. The restaurant in the hotel itself serves excellent food.

title: Happy With My Stay Here
review: I spent an enjoyable four nights at the Hotel MS Maestranza in October 2017. I had asked for a room with a view, and got one - from the balcony I could see the ocean, the pier, the castle and the park, and the views from the rooftop are even better. My room was nice and comfortable, not overly big but not too small either. The balcony was great. The rooftop area has a nice hot tub and gym, you can book massages, and there are plenty of lounge chairs always available. The front desk staff were very helpful and booked excursions for me to Gibraltar and Ronda.  There's a taxi stand around the corner, a nice bakery open early across the street, and the pier with all the shops and restaurants and the Pompidou is very close by. Downtown Malaga is about a 15-minute walk away, but it's…

title: city break
review: good hotel, good breakfast good staff clean and well maintained good location easily reached by public transport from airport. Plenty of cafe's and restaurants and supermarkets near by. Close to bus stops for trips to near by towns and resorts.

title: Perfect placed in Malaga
review: This hotel is perfect placed if you want to spend some days in Malaga. Its close to both shops and restaurants and to a great beach if that is your main objective.  We were a travelling party of 9 people that rented 5 rooms and everybody seemed to enjoy the stay in Maestranza. Me and my wife were lucky enough to get a big room in 12 floor with a fantastic wiev from a balcony overlooking the sea and the cathedral among other stuff.  The breakfast was good and the hotel was generally very clean and with friendly people. If I would point out one thing that was not that great it was the spa area. We used it once but did not go back there again.  I could surely stay at Maestranza again on another visit to Malaga. (By the way, Malaga is a really great city that you should visit!)

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed here as part of a holiday package with Jet2.  I have to say it was lovely, the room was very clean with a small balcony, mini bar and great view down to the port.  There is also a great spa and roof terrace which was too cold in January but would be great in the summer.  The hotel is in a fantastic position right by the new port which has some great bars and restaurants.  The staff here were fantastic, very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast is perfectly adequate,there is something for everyone.  We also ate in the hotel one evening and that was really very nice.  The only small thing I would have liked would be tea/coffee facilities in the room.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: I has been in  this hotel from 12/22 to 01/02/2017. The Hotel has excellent location, close to the beach and all tourist attractions. The neighborhood is full of restaurants and bars, next to hotel there are a Taxi . The room is very comfortable with balcony and excellent views. The staff is very friendly. I strongly recommend this Hotel to visit Malaga.

title: Good Location
review: The location is very good, walking distance to downtown and lots of cafes and restaurants in the area.  Room was comfortable and clean but a bit hot.  Breakfast buffet was OK, a bit expensive.  Service was friendly.  There's a parking garage nearby that offer a discount for hotel guests.

title: MALAGA - WELL LOCATED HOTEL
review: This was our first trip to Malaga. The hotel and the general area could not be called pretty, but the hotel is very comfortable and very well located. We stayed room only so could not comment on the facilities. There is an excellent café right next door however which does good breakfasts. It is a pleasant walk into town and the port. The location could not be bettered as everywhere can be reached on foot. Highly recommended, we would stay here again without hesitation.

title: Excellent hotel
review: This is a great hotel positioned very close to the port with very clean comfy rooms.  We were upgraded to a superior room without request.  The only things that let the place down are broken sun loungers on the roof terrace and the hot breakfast is warm at its best but the continental choice is great and the dinning area very nice  Staff are great

title: Great Location
review: My wife and I recently spent a long weekend at this hotel.  It is in an envious position, being easy to get to from the airport (route A bus - 3 Euro - takes you almost to the hotel) and close to the bullring, the old part of Malaga (Alcazaba, Gibralfaro etc), the port/marina area, and the Malageta beaches.  At checking in, the friendly and welcoming receptionist told us that she had given us a 'very nice' room and she was right.  The views from our 8th floor, corner aspect, room were breathtaking.  Although some of the room décor was slightly dated and in need of refreshing, all the amenities we expected were present and correct and the room was spacious and comfortable.  The bed was a huge king.  Sleep quality was good as the hotel was quiet apart from some slight traffic…

title: Jacuzzi!
review: We really enjoyed our stay here. First impressions weren't great as the small entrance and reception wasn't the norm for a 4 star hotel. However, our room (although the decor was a little dated) was a decent size with a nice large bathroom and it had a lovely view of the bull arena and castle. We were on the 12th floor in room 1. The hotel was in a great location being really close to the beach, the park and old town. There is a taxi rank right next to the hotel and the bus to the airport is a couple of minutes away. It's €3 one way and the stand at the airport is just outside the arrivals hall. Find the stand that is labelled Ligne A. Taxi is about €20 / 25. Breakfast was decent enough with bacon and eggs as well as cereal, cold meats, fruit and pastries. There are also a…

title: Perfect location
review: Lovely hotel in excellent location, near beach, marina and short walk to main shopping centre. We booked room only but had a lovely breakfast in cafe a just outside. Staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend to friends and family as a lovely place to stay. We were very lucky with the weather too and got to spend an afternoon on the beach even though we went late  November

title: A perfectly located 4  star hotel with excellent transport links. Recommended!
review: We have stayed in Malaga on several previous occasions, but this was our first time at the 4 star MS Maestranza and we have already decided to book it again in 2018. The hotel's great advantage is it's location only a few minutes walk from the new harbour development (inc. the Centre Pompidou), the historic Old Town and the delightful Moorish Alcazaba. Transpot links are excellent, with the Port nearby, a taxi rank a few steps away and the Airport Express bus stop 5 minutes away in Paseo del Parque (fares to/from AGP are only 3 euros).   The hotel itself is modern and rather unprepossessing at first sight, but has adequate facilities including a bar, restaurant and spa. Our room and bathroom were reasonably large and well-equipped with a room-safe, a balcony, a reasonably priced…

title: Very nice place to stay in Malaga
review: As I first entered the lobby I was not impressed as it is quite small and dark, we were allocated room 305.  We wrere pleasently surprised by the light and airy room with a large window and a balcony with sea views. Clean spacious comfortable room is tastefully furnished with moderm furniture. E- suit is very modern clean functional comfortable and spacious.   Hotel is located on a busy road and 20 minutes walk to the city centre makes it convenient.  Cafes and restaurents scattered all around making it very convenient to eat out.  Port and the esplanade just across the road gives plenty of places to visit. Rooms in higher floors x05 and x06 would be even better with better views and less road noise.

title: Stayed 2 night. Back for Xmas lights
review: We had a 2 night stay having flown in. The staff were excellent. Let us keep our bikes in reception. They gave us a lovely room stunning view overlooking the park and marina.  Nice touch with glass of cava on arrival (booking.com perk).back on 24th for 1 night for the Xmas lights turn on. Can't wait.

title: Nice hotel, very central.
review: Enjoyed our stay, hotel close to cruise area, bullring & other siteseeing areas. Nice comfortable room, breakfast very good. Biggest problem, on arrival we find our room unavailable until 2.00pm. Not good when arriving there at 12.00pm, feeling tired after a long journey from GB.

title: Great location  Lots of street noise
review: We where offered a room on the 8 floor  we Asked for and where given a room on the third floor Advise you accept  rooms higer up AS street noise is disturbing to say the least The roof for sunbathing is very good Very close to everything fantastic location Tired rooms and fittings

title: Great location at a very good price
review: My wife and I needed a hotel in Malaga for one night prior to joining a cruise ship the following day. The travel agency suggested MS Maestranza and we booked it based on how close it was to the port and also the reasonable price. We were not disappointed.  The location was not only great for getting to the port in the morning, but also great for going into the old part of the city in the afternoon and the bars and restaurants around the port in the evening.   The roof area has sun loungers, a hot tub, a small gymnasium and a sauna and offers good views across the city. I have attached photos of each of these.  Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were adequate for our needs, with a comfortable bed.   I would definitely stay here again if visiting Malaga.

title: Perfect Location
review: My wife and I spent a long weekend in Malaga and all I can say is we were so lucky to be staying in The fabulous Hotel MS Maestranza.Centrally located,a short walk from the beach on one side and the pier on the other.There is even a taxi rank 20 m from the hotel front door. Close to the old town and with plenty of restaurant's close by we were spoiled for choice. The hotel itself was spotless, the room was very comfortable and the staff were pleasant and very helpful.we had breakfast in the hotel each morning that set us up for the day.we also enjoyed a relaxing massage and facial in the rooftop spa.a 5 min taxi ride took us to the train station, so we traveled to Fuengirola and took the bus to the beautiful Mijas in the mountains on Saturday then we took the train to…

title: Lovely hotel close to beach, restaurants and old town
review: We had a large double room on the eighth floor which had a lovely view of the old walls and Alhambra.  The balcony was an added plus so we could sit out  with a drink.   The hotel is a couple of minutes walk to the beach and harbour were there are many restaurants and shops.   Spotless bedroom and bathroom.   Foyer polished to perfection.  Receptionist very efficient booking us in.  Nice breakfast selection.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Tourist visit
review: A great hotel for business or travel pleasure. Well located near the city, marina, castle and tourist areas. Clean, well kept rooms and a friendly helpful staff. Really enjoyed this hotel and Malaga.   A fantastic bread cafe over the road but the hotel breakfasts are excellent in themselves.

title: Friendly, convenient and extremely comfortable hotel
review: I have stayed in this hotel on three separate occasions in the past year , each time it got better and more personal. The staff are professional,kind, and efficient. They kindly upgraded our room to a suite with wonderful views with complimentary drinks included.on the last two visits. Breakfast was good and fresh, there are many nearby cafes if you prefer,.There is a taxi rank in the same street as the hotel if you need to go to the bus or train station The bus stop terminus to and from the airport stops opposite the hotel every 30 mins  ( 3 euros p.p.). this bus also stops at the bus and train station. The port, restaurants and the beach are 2 mins walk away , and the city centre is a pleasant 5 min walk through the park and gardens. .

title: Convenient to Beach and Alcazaba
review: This hotel was a short distance from Playa Malagueta. It was also close to the Alcazaba and Plaza del Parque which had bus stops to get around the city. The bullring was right outside my balcony.  The room was clean and comfortable.  I really enjoyed having a balcony and being able to enjoy the atmosphere of the city from there. There is a safe in the room which was one big reason I chose this hotel.

title: Holiday
review: Stayed here for 3 nights in September, we found it difficult to park car whilst we unloaded, not helped by un friendly taxi drivers. The hotel is dated although clean, and our room had a balcony and great view of the marina, but I think some rooms over looked a side street. On the plus side there was a good sun deck with great views at the top of the hotel. Good location, near to beach,10 mins walk to the old town.

title: Nice hotel, great location.
review: Just spent 3 nights with 3 friends in this hotel. Great location. 5 minutes from the beach, 5 minutes from the marina, 15 minute stroll through lovely park area to the city. Really helpful hotel staff, attentive and always smiling.

title: Short but enjoyable stay
review: We had one night in the MS Maestranza  in Malaga. The location is very good as it is an easy walk to the old town. Finding the nearest car park was a bit tricky and it was only by luck that we made it.  We had a room upgrade and had a great view over the bullring as well as a dressing area and a large bathroom. Hotel is very comfortable and clean. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but there is a cafe right next door so it isn't necessary  Would recommend and would stay again

title: Super Stay and great location
review: About 20 mins by taxi from airport.  Hotel is between old town and beach area.  Immaculately clean.  No frills but fantastic for weekend stay.  Roof top spa with sunbeds.  Views of sea and bull ring.  Staff were excellent - very helpful and service with a smile.  Good aircon in rooms.  Rooms are quiet. There are small balconies with morning sun on side of bull ring. There is a gym.  Take advantage of the massages.... excellent value.  Would book again should we return to Malaga.

title: Another great stay
review: This was our 3rd stay. The location is excellent - close to harbour and beach, and 5 minutes from old town. Nice restaurants nearby - pizza pino down the road, toro at the harbour, as well as chopp at the harbour for drinks and snacks. There is also a lovely rooftop bar at the harbour - fab for people watching. Breakfast at the hotel isn't a huge selection but the food is lovely - all served up with glasses of cava and tasty coffee. Staff - so nice. Miss the hotel so much already!

title: Good location for harbour and short walk to town.. Not a lot going on.
review: On arrival from Calahonda in a hire car as we thought there was hotel parking, after eventually finding the hotel had gone past it before we realised as it is on a very busy town centre road, so had to go down some side streets to guess where we were and parked up and then had to walk to find it again. On arrival at the reception, a very small hotel entrance easy missed, a bellboy did come with us back to the car and then he took the car into an underground car park at the back of the hotel about 100 yards away and parked it. Then had to take luggage back to hotel with bellboy. After that we were given a room on the 9th floor, after indicating we wanted a low room, so to their credit they gave us a 2nd floor room and upgraded us. Nice and clean and modern, but plenty of noise…

title: Great value for such a fantastic location!"
review: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel and enjoyed it just as much as the first.  In a really great location considering the relatively budget/mid range price paid.    A room at the front of the hotel (offers a view of the sea, the marina, big wheel, Cityscape and Alcazabar castle.  The view from the roof terrace gives even more stunning views, especially at night when everything is lit up, and of the bull ring to the rear.  Very warm welcome at the front desk by English speaking staff.  Very helpful.    Room is perhaps a little dated but was clean and comfortable.  Aircon worked ok, if a little loud, and the shower is BRILLIANT!  Oh, and no kettle in the room which is weird for us Brits i guess - we took out own lol  Breakfast is perfectly adequate with mostly…

title: Fabulous location
review: This was our second visit to the Maestranza and we were not disappointed. Previously on the 8th floor overlooking the Bull ring, this time we had a room on the 12th floor with fabulous all round views.  The hotel is in an ideal location for the beech, the marina, the old town and more. Great restaurants nearby or venture into the old town or to the marina. Hotel staff always cheerful and happy to help. Rooms and sunbathing terrace clean and well kept.

title: Great Stay
review: Just back from a 10 night stay in the Hotel MS Maestranza and we were very happy with our stay.  Staff were extremely helpful from the outset - in dealing with any booking/email queries.  We arrived at 11am and were delighted that our room was ready at that time.  Check in was quick and efficient and stafff welcoming and friendly.  We took the airport Line A bus which stops close to the hotel - 3 euro each way - about 1/2 hour journey.  We took the lift to our room on the 8th floor - lifts are small but we had no long waits during our stay.  Our room was spacious with lovely views from balcony (no balcony furniture).  Great shower, toiletries (shampoo, shower gel) replaced daily, fridge, tv, safe, comfortable double bed.  No tea/coffee making facilities so bring your own travel…

title: Malaga 2017
review: Perfect location for beach marina and pleasant walk to town. Hotel staff were friendly from reception staff who had one room early despite our early arrival to bar and restaurant staff. We made good use of rooftop terrace as temperature was high and it had a nice breeze. Also a view of the bull ring which I opted out of viewing on fight night. Though my sister and husband went to view!!

title: Twice in one year!
review: I stayed for 4 nights in June with my husband. We loved the hotel's location so easy to get to all the main points of interest. Good breakfast and La Canasta over the  road for lovely and reasonably priced food through the day. Room was adequate ( 904) with excellent views to the Alcazaba. The Marina and port area has been very tastefully developed and is excellent for evening strolling. Rooms were cleaned daily. with fresh towels. All in all a good choice. I returned yesterday from another 4 night stay this time with 3 friends and  they were delighted with the accomodation, food and location. It was my birthday on Saturday and the management sent up a bottle of wine to celebrate..a very nice touch. The staff were all friendly and helpful but I must single out Regina who was…

title: Good hotel and location
review: Good hotel standard of service could not be faulted  Breakfast was more than adequate. Rooms are OK no noise at night  We were HB menu was limited but food was very good Planning to return there next year

title: great stay
review: we stayed here for 3night on a city break could not fault this hotel its in an ideal position we were on the 12th floor fabulous view although its on a mail road we never had any problem sleeping , rooms are  great spolless , the breakfast can be a bit chaotic at times as its only small but the staff were very efficient only had to wait 5 mins or so for a table if it was very busy so not a problem  the reception was very helpful nothing was to much trouble in our opinion you will be hard pushed to find a hotel as good for the money we will come back

title: Silver wedding holiday
review: One never knows quite what to expect when you book a holiday but this hotel and the area in which it is located exceeded our expectation. Lovely clean rooms, attentive and courteous staff.   Beautiful surroundings. Only a five minute walk from the marina,  five minute walk from the beach and a 10 minute walk to the town centre. I cannot recommend this hotel or Malaga too much.

title: Fantastic
review: We stayed here for a week 30th August - 6th September 2017. Was a lovely clean place, friendly and helpful staff,great spa facilities with fantastic views over Malaga. Would recommend this hotel to anybody.

title: city break
review: Great hotel. Our room was 12 floors up fantastic view over port on to gardens and the bull ring. Don't book half board dinner disgusting  (set menu) breakfast okay. Staff okay didn't have much dealings with apart from dinning room. Hotel very well situated.

title: Mediocre hotel, perfect location!
review: A lovely few days spent in the centre of Malaga, the hotel in perfect distance from the beach, city centre and port. The staff were friendly and helpful at reception, however i would not recommend the breakfast to anyone, it was terrible! Most days went hungry as the only thing edible was the fruit! If wanting breakfast i would definitely recommend the cafe opposite, although it is pricey. Apart from this it was a clean hotel with a nice rooftop view of the city

title: 1 night stay to see aeound
review: Loves the location of the hotel, we got a room with a lovely view of bullring & monuments, better than other side of road. Location is excellent, as long as you are able to walk, wouldn't suit my older parents but we loved it. 5mins to marina which is fantastic for food & shops, 10-15 mins on flat to town & cathedral etc. Room small but nice balcony. Wasn't overly happy with man on reception who made checking in & out a bit stressful. Overall very nice & wud recommend to family.

title: Very nice hotel, great hospitality, and very close to the beach.
review: This is a very nice hotel. The biggest assets of the hotel are the proximity to the beach, since you need 1 or 2 minutes to reach the closest and beautiful beach - Malagueta, the kindness of people that work there, always ready to help and are very kind, and the kitchen. The breakfast is good, all you need is there, but the dinners are amazing. You have a 3 course dinner, you can choose out of 3 options of either course, and there is always fish - at our 10 day stay we tried everything and all was exceptional. WiFi was mostly good, but sometimes got bad (not unusual in hotels with lots of guests), they have a sauna on the top of the building, nice view, next to the fitness room that is... sufficient.  And the city is amazing, too. That helps :) The outer rooms have a view of the…

title: Central hotel
review: Nice hotel on busy road , we didn't hear traffic with windows closed. Large rooms with good sized bathrooms. Good breakfast would recommend . Downside no ice facility in fridges in rooms or outside rooms . No pool but can sunbathe on roof top. also a jacuzzi and sauna but these can only be used in the afternoon.

title: Home from home
review: We stayed in this hotel as a Sports Team representing South Africa at the World Transplant Games. From arrival to departure it was a pleasure to deal with the Management and Staff of the hotel. They were attentive to needs and very responsive to requests. The hotel is ideally placed close to the activities in and around the harbour and across the street from the Bullring and greenbelt area in town. The elevators are very slow but if on holiday that shouldn't worry you. We had a lovely corner room looking out over the harbour and the castle on the hill and a balcony - although the traffic noise made it unpleasant being out there. Their breakfasts were excellent.

title: Seriously recommend this hotel
review: We have stayed in another hotel in Malaga and know that most city hotels are fairly impersonal. The helpfulness of the staff at the Maestranza was superb. They were sensitive to our requirements and took great care of us, from the Waiters and Waitresses to the Reception and Porters. We will certainly return.Location was great for us as we would choose to be on that side of the city.

title: Great base for exploring the area
review: Very good hotel and great value. Lovely location - pleasant walk to the beach, marina or city centre via the beautiful gardens. Breakfast and facilities very good for the price and we found the staff very helpful and friendly. Fantastic view from our room too.

title: Hotel
review: Excellent friendly hotel in a brilliant position in lovely Malaga. Dining room and bar very modern serving a really good choice breakfast. Rooms were clean and spacious with good wi fi connection. Recommend this hotel.

title: Good hotel in great location for exploring Malaga
review: We have stayed in this hotel several times now, and choose it because of its location and good standard of accommodation.  The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the beach or the Port, and a very nice 10 minute stroll into the centre of Malaga. Although on a busy road, the rooms have good soundproofing and the rooms overlooking the Bullring have little or no traffic noise. On this occasion our room was on the 6th floor at the front of the hotel overlooking the Port and the Alcazaba (see photos) and we were very pleased with it.  The room was well equipped and decorated and the bathroom was stylish and very clean.  The hotel has a pleasant bar and restaurant, although on this occasion we didn't eat at the hotel as we stayed on a room only basis. We had breakfast in a café directly…

title: Spacious room close to beach
review: The location is really good, few minutes from the beach and a nice stroll to old town.
