Our corner room facing the main street was very spacious and clean enough, but as other have mentioned the hotel is a litte bit dated. Bathroom could have been cleaner and the largest towels have seen better days. The rooftop terrace with an indoor whirl pool was not a place to spend time at, terrrible dated and humid.

title: Pleasant hotel
review: The room was very spacious clean and nicely decorated.  Immediately below is French cafe restaurant where one can enjoy an American breakfast with eggs bacon toast and orange juice for a very inexpensive amount. A variety of coffees is available in that cafe with croissant and pastries breads are delicious and backed daily on the premises. The hotel is well located close to the historic districs.

title: Malaga holiday hitel
review: Nice hotel well situated at the end of the park near the beach. Stake croissant at breakfast otherwise good. Galaxy overlooks the bull ring. Plenty of good on a as to eat nearby and easy walk thro park to the town centre.

title: a basic hotel, I would rate it as a 2 star.
review: in a noisy high traffic density part of Malaga, close the Beach.  Hotel is dated and expensive for what they provide.  Bullring right behind the Hotel so if you like blood and gore then this is the place to be!  Clean and functional but I wont be going back any time soon.

title: 21st World Transplant Games
review: Enjoyed the Hotel - food was very good - in general could not fault anything - however they could have been a bit more flexible and allow our group to have breakfast before 07:30 - we were almost 90 guests

title: Not a 4****
review: Pros: Good service, staff helpful and good atmosphere, plentiful breakfast. Good location, few minutes away from seaside.  Cons: well...the room furniture is so out dated. Tried to get access to mini fridge, had to fight wooden squeaky, blocked doors. Plenty of splints on everything. I had a room facing the street and it was noisy. The balcony door locks  but does not  create a seal so if pull a bit more there is a great soundproof, however you cannot really sleep like that.  Bathroom clean but seals missing , shower support cap...well...none. it has no impact on your shower but is aesthetically unpleasant. It is just a personal opinion but, this is not a 4 star hotel as advertised.  Top floor gym: for enthusiasts , you will be disappointed. Spa and such...is more like a bathtub…

title: Lovely short break
review: Stayed 3 nights. Superb location near harbour, old town.  Superb views of bull ring from roof top. Nice roof top terrace for chill time.  Bar not overly priced.  Rooms cleaned everyday with fresh towels.    Breakfast plentiful and fresh although limited seating so had to wait on one morning.   I think the reception staff both day and night could have been far more accommodating and friendly.  They did not offer any additional information on bookin in and wre quite distant. It was quiet in the evenings so sleep not a problem.

title: Nice hotel
review: We spent few nights in this hotel just next to the La Malagueta beach. For us the location was good. Also city center was in the walking distance.  Our room was big and fine and clean. The service in the hotel was good too.

title: Convenient & good view
review: Having read other people's reviews we asked for a high room with a good view and were not disappointed. Our room was on the 12th floor and faced towards the old town and the sea. The only downside was that it also faced onto the roundabout so there was quite a lot of road noise. Easy to get to from the airport by bus with a stop just outside. Breakfast was excellent. Nice roof top terrace with views and you could look into the bullring. Nice walk into town or to the cafes etc facing the marina

title: Great position
review: This was a new hotel for me and my partner in Málaga..Is time stopping on the port . I st of all the hotel from the outside looks a bit dated..but don't let that put you off.Very helpful staff..opted for a room on the 11th floor. Great views of the marina and the castle.Do not usually bother with breakfast. but this was included, very nice surprise.Typical buffet style..but hot and fresh . There is no pool, but a good rooftop sun bathing area.Even though the hotel is on a busy road ( a bit worried about noise) room was very quiet.It is not a large hotel, but has all you need.Will stop here again..

title: Superb location and wonderful staff
review: We were in room 1209. Nice size room, clean and small balcony with great views.Hotel bar is certainly worth a visit - great service - also nice views of busy Malaga.Reception was efficient and all lobby staff were pleasant, helpful and most welcoming. Check out the roof terrace, gym and jacuzzi . We took a day trip with Malaga Trips to El Cominito in the Chorro valley - what an incredible experience. Our guide Jose really made the area come to life and the suspended walkways added some excitement. Absolutely spectacular views wherever you looked. Hotel location great - port, beach and old town just short and pleasant walks away. I really recommend this hotel - on our trip we stayed at 5 hotels and this one stood out by far.

title: Excellent location!
review: With an outstanding position in city, near the harbor, easy to access old town, close to the beach, I think it is a very good choice for staying in Malaga - Spain. Choose a high floor for a beautiful view.

title: Very good location but the Hotel is a little tired. Below average for a "4 Star" hotel
review: I guess I may have picked the most expensive week for Hotels in Malaga because most of the Hotels we usually stay at were much pricier than usual. We wanted to be just out of the city so the Maestranza was well located close to a taxi rank with a couple of coffee bars right on the doorstep, loads of restaurants nearby and a very short walk to the beach. The hotel is a 4 star but has relatively small rooms, a very cramped reception and small, slow lifts. Our room was by the lift on the 7th floor with a great view from the balcony. The room was generally clean but let down badly by a grubby bath (tub for American friends) and quite a lot of mould on the bath surrounds. Ok for a shower, but you wouldn't want to sit in the bath! I did point this out to reception who simply said they…

title: Excellent location
review: Never been to Malaga before. Chose this hotel as it was a few minutes walk to an excellent beach, the recently developed port and a 10-15 minute walk through the tree lined boulevard to the old town. We chose right! It was easy to get to the hotel via the route "A" bus from the airport, 3 Euros each. The bus stopped on the opposite side of the roundabout from the hotel. They run every 30 mins in the day. We chose room 910 a superior double room. Spacious and clean with (from the veranda)  views to the beach the tree lined boulevard and the alcazaba fort on the nearby hillside. 9 floors up (12 in total) was fine to keep traffic noise below to a minimum. It never bothered us. The air conditioning worked well, wasn't too noisy and had an easy to use control on the wall. The room…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Stayed recently for 4 nights in superior room.  Had a great stay. Lovely hotel in excellent location 2 minutes from marina and 10 minutes walk through beautiful gardens to old town.  Hotel very clean and staff very friendly.

title: Excellent hotel
review: We stayed to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and from arrival to departure it was wonderful. We were given a bottle of Cava on our anniversary which was very thoughtful. The staff were most helpful and the staff on reception looked after a mix up with our car transfer and actually told us to go off and enjoy our day and they would sort everything and call us later to confirm. The city is beautiful and everything is with walking distance - even if you are awaiting a hip replacement like my husband!

title: Great 5 nights spent at the hotel
review: Excellent hotel. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are clean. Very good spread of food for breakfast which is available until 11.00. Loved the range of fresh fruit. Convenient for beach and harbour. Short walk to shops, or easy to catch no. 16 bus. Would recommend to anyone.

title: Excellent value for money
review: Still here on our last day of a 5 night stay  half board,   staff are so nice and friendly  ask for an upper floor if possible ,  views are stunning,   10min walk through trees/park  straight into old town quarter , 24 degrees every day,     little free spa and sunbathing area on roof top fantastic again stunning views , priced Marriet hotel and others before we came  which were much more expensive,    you can use the cafe across the street  but we wouldn't,   just have it included in your price here and sit in the lovely dining room over looking the busy junction and marina , Wi Fi in room is first class , 2 lifts pretty quick in my opinion, Air con in room superb, Needs to have English TV main channels  BBC1, ITV, Channel 4  for the next time we come , not just bbc world news…

title: Great Place
review: We stayed here on our first night in Spain. Clean, bright and cool with helpful staff and a great location. We could walk to the old town and breakfast was just downstairs. The hotel was easy to drive to from the airport; though it fronts a busy street. Take advantage of the valet parking.

title: Lovely views and comfy beds
review: We had a three night stay here. The room was with a balcony was nice enough and the beds were very comfortable, mini bar and tv although only one english channel. The bathroom probably in need of a refurb but did the job. The breakfast was very good with lots to choose from. A little out of the way if you dont like walking probably a fifteen minute walk to the centre. There were some restaurants nearby too.We went to a flamenco evening in the centre which was great.

title: Birthday Weekend away
review: Stayed here for my dads birthday.  Great views from our bedroom window and we had dual aspect windows one overlooking the harbour the other a view of Giibralfaro castle. The hotel is looking a little tired and the gym is ancient the roof top could be great but it's a little sad looking with no table and chairs which is a pity, great views though.  To summarise we had a comfortable stay and all the staff were smiling and professional but the hotel needs to invest some money back in to it. We would stay again at the right price but will properly book a different hotel next time in Malaga that has a functional roof top ie bar tables and chairs etc.

title: Great location
review: Visited Malaga for our wedding anniversary and we had a great stay at this hotel. It has a fabulous location. The bus from the airport terminates less than 5 mins walk away from the hotel and costs 3€ each.  It's close to the beach, the port and about a 10 minute walk to the old town. Great views from the roof top. Although our room was facing a busy road and right next to the lift, it was surprisingly quiet. The breakfast was good with lots of choice. The waterfront which is literally just round the corner has lots of lovely bars and restaurants!

title: Great location and price
review: We booked this place while on holiday in Malaga as the hostel we booked was rough.  We got a nice big air conditioned  room, it's clean and easy. A nice 20 minute walk to the busy old town with restaurants and a 5 minute walk to the beach. Very reasonable and safe. Would go back.

title: Very good location
review: Just back from a three night stay, this hotel is in a perfect location for a city break, we were given a room on the 11th floor the room was facing the port area but was quite noisy from the road below when the balcony door was open, but the room was quite spacious and was ok for our break.There is a good sunbathing area on the rooftop which we used and has fantastic views of the city. We had some good  evening meals down by the port, and also went into the old town in the evening which was good. Would like to visit again as there was lots we didn't see. The only disappointment was the breakfast, on a couple of occasions we had a short wait for a table and we thought the quality of the food could be improved, and the coffee wasn't very good.

title: Very good
review: Good location, clean room, well equipped bath. Nice staff. Excellent restaurant. Close to port and beach. One-step from arena, close to other points of interest. It is exactly what you can expect from 4stars in Spain. Will come here again.

title: Get away trip
review: A comfortable hotel quite friendly staff, could benefit from decor upgrade and more professional staff the outdoor swimming pool was freezing, the bar lost business with the lack of dedicated bar staff.

title: Great location
review: Had a great anniversary break in Malaga. Hotel Maestranza is in a great location. Close to harbour, beach and town. Had great weather so got to sunbathe on the roof terrace. Staff were very helpful and friendly and gave us a free upgrade to a suite as it was our wedding anniversary. Will definitely be returning.

title: People, service, location
review: The service from the moment of arrival to the very last day was superb.  The room is waiting for you upon arrival with fresh fruit and water. The accessability to every part of the city was so easy. The beach was less than 2 blocks. A great breakfast place is just across the hotel

title: Not the best looking building but very good staff on the front desk.
review: All rather  average. Close to the beach. All round not bad for one night but I wouldn't want a whole week there. Far better locations for more than a few days and at an equivalent price. Decent breakfast across the road in the patisserie.

title: Central.
review: A very good hotel on an excellent location. Next door to bull ring, the beach and Pompidou Center, a short walk away from the old town. Higher floors are better. All rooms have terraces. The side street side is quieter. Taxi stand next door. Valet parking. Excellent pastry and light food place across the street.

title: Second stay at this lovely hotel
review: Just returned from this lovely hotel in the beautiful city of Malaga. Excellent choice at breakfast, friendly staff. Room was very comfortable again, 901 this time overlooking the bull ring and great view of the majestic Alcazabar high on the hill. The hotel is in a great location, near to the marina and about a five minute walk into the old town. We will be back again. Almost forgot to mention the rooftop area where sun beds are provided and we heard excellent comments from fellow guests about the spa treatments.

title: Good Hotel, Good Location
review: The hotel was a 23 Euro cab ride from the airport at 11 at night.   The front desk team was friendly and efficient.  The room was clean and spacious, with hardwood floors.  The WiFi was very fast and had nice view of the Castle from my third floor room.  Because I was on a lower floor with a busy intersection below, it was a little noisy, so you might want to ask for an upper floor room if traffic noise is of concern.  The location is excellent, just a few minutes walk to the Old Town and to the Castle.  Breakfast was also very good.  There is a sauna, Jacuzzi and small exercise room on the roof.  The views of the castle, the sea and the bull ring from the rooftop sundeck are outstanding and well worth a few minutes.  This is a good choice when visiting Malaga.

title: Mrs
review: Great location very close to bar and restaurants , easy access to all attractions. Easy access to and from airport. I was in 12th floor a room with sea view and street view , although street was noisy , I enjoyed staying there .  5 minutes walk to port and sea side promenade .Breakfast was good but could be better. If I want to stay in Malaga definitely stay in this hotel again .

title: Fantastic Hotel & Location
review: Excellent hotel in an excellent location. Very efficient check in/out. No problem leaving bags in hold on the day of check out. Lovely breakfast, especially the pastries (I have a sweet tooth). 2 mins walk from the Marina which has loads going on. 10 mins walk to city centre which is a lovely, clean city with very reasonable prices for food, drink etc. 10 mins walk to bus stops at the end of the Marina to get buses to where ever you want to go for a day trip. Great views from the roof top which also has a sauna. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Good!
review: Perfect location according to me. 10 minutes walk to Main Street and 2 minutes to the ocean and beach. Very fresh and clean room. Taxi stop right outside where they were available 24 hours a day. Very nice view on the roof and a jacuzzi on top floor. There were also a gym which was ok. The staff was nice and helpful, good knowledge of English. Would stay here again!

title: Very good hotel
review: We stayed 5 days in March.Exellent location, close to the sea - to the pier, and also to the beach Malagueta. Nice rooftop terrace with spa. Our room was on the 10th floor with balcony, it was nice and clean. I asked a waterfront room, and the water was the smallest part of the view, but I I accepted because the other parts was not bad.I expected a bit more from breakfast, it was not bad, but It was one kind of vegetable /only tomato/, and a lot of baked goods, but I can not eat it, so I missed the veggies. But only that was a - , and a lot of +. Recommend it.

title: Easy accessible hotel
review: This hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to the town, museums and galleries.  Opposite the harbour side where there are lovely bars and cafés.  The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean and comfortable with good views from the balconies.  The road is busy but the double glazing works.  The restaurant is OK perfectly acceptable meals but La Canasta across the road is really fantastic, surprisingly good quality food at very good prices, a much better option for breakfast I think.

title: GREAT STAY AT MAESTRANZA
review: We stayed at this hotel from Sunday 5 March to Thursday 9 March 2017 as we decided to have a city break to Malaga, always just passing through Malaga when going for our summer break to Nerja along the coast a bit.  We knew this hotel only because we stayed in it in 2013 after getting caught up with the French ATC strikes and were delayed by 2 nights then in getting home, and always said we'd use it again if doing a city break to Malaga - so we did.  We were given a choice of rooms, and the receptionist suggested room 705 as it was one of the rooms at the end of the Hotel and had good views of the Cathedral and the city, so we agreed to that and really enjoyed the views in the morning and at night when all the main buildings in the city were lit up.  Our break consisted of 4…

title: City centre: great service
review: Big hotel in the city centre. parking is available: 11 Euros per day. Single room was: 76 Euros, breakfast included.  Staff is friendly and helpful. Tea and coffee facilities available. Room with comfortable big double bed

title: Kettle and cups
review: Arrived at hotel very tired. Was met by a very lovely man who ran out to taxi and collected all our luggage. Foyer of hotel lovely and welcoming, luggage was taken to our room and we were booked in by a very nice member of staff. Room was lovely and clean, beds comfortable, linen and towels changed daily. All staff were so helpful and very very friendly, nothing was too much trouble. Food in the resturant was excellant both breakfast and evening meal, so much choice, could not fault it. Upon leaving we were again given excellant service, we did not touch our luggage once. All staff were excellent,to us all, especially as we had a walking stick. Please could we have a kettle next time though, we will be back. Thank you for looking after us .

title: Long weekend
review: Malaga is buzzing. weather fantastic. Maestranza very good value. Great staff. Central location. Breakfast was great. Take your own tea/coffee as none in room. Get a high floor say ten upwards for view. Has a fab roof terrace.  Will be back

title: Boutique Oriental Art Deco stay in a fab location.
review: I had not planned to stop 4 days in Malaga, but a mistake in my return flight  to London, required an urgent decision. Do I fork out £380 to fly back on the day I thought I was supposed to fly back; or fly back on the day stated on the ticket four days later? A clear week ahead made the decision easy; book a hotel. After consideration, I decided to book into the hotel MS Maestranza. Great choice, because the location was perfect. Right by the Bull Ring, with fabulous views of it. I was given the card key to room 901, at the back. The room has great tropical views up to the Castle; and below, the fountain. The front of the hotel has views over the sea and beautiful harbour with its wonderful esplanades, shops and restaurants. Beyond you have the chapel Picasso worshiped and…

title: February getaway
review: We spent four nights on a return visit to the MS Maestranza. The quality of service, comfort of the room and attentive efficient staff were just as we remembered. We really appreciated the ability to regulate the thermostat in the room. Sounds like a small thing but we've stayed in four and five star hotels where the climate control is difficult to figure out and/or unresponsive. The room was clean and very comfortable with a balcony overlooking the bullring. The location is great with the center of town  a 10/15 minute walk down the lovely portside promenade. The only complaint we had is that breakfast is not of the quality you would expect. Although the choices are varied, the hot dishes were often lukewarm or cold, and the juices seemed watered down. Having said that, we…

title: February holiday
review: Stayed here on our recent trip to Malaga as it was recommended to us by a friend. It is in a perfect location, 10 min walk from the centre and it is right beside the beach and port. Our rooms were on the 9th floor and and a beautiful view of the port. The rooms were spacious and very clean and had a small balcony. Our rooms were cleaned daily. We didn't eat in the restaurant but we had a few cocktails in the bar which were very nice. There are 2 nice cafes near (one to the right of the main door of the hotel and one across the road) which so lovely coffee and cakes.  I would highly recommend this hotel as it is in the perfect location, staff are very friendly and the rooms are spacious and clean.

title: February break for two
review: This hotel has a great location and is literally 10/15 minutes walk from the main shopping & eating area of Malaga. Situated right beside the marina and the botanical gardens so ideally located for wherever you want to go. Also, the shuttle bus from the Airport (Bus A) leaves you in the square which is only 5 mins walk away.   Rooms were lovely and spacious and we had a safe for our money and passports. We had a lovely view of the marina from our balcony. We were on the 6th Floor so we could hear the traffic occasionally but wasn't too bad. The other side of the hotel overlooks the bull arena which we could see from the rooftop. No bull fights on the weekend we were there. We didn't use the gym equipment and the 2 times I went to use the Jacuzzi there were people already in it…

title: Brilliant
review: Stayed a week on half board and had a superb time. Lovely welcome from all staff and excellent service. We had a room on the 11th floor with views over the harbour and the palace-amazing sunsets and the night view as good. Room immaculate and serviced daily.  Breakfast was what anyone wanted and served 7.30 to 11. Dinner menu was a choice of 3 starters, mains and puddings. Menu in English, Spanish, French and German. Menu translations were not always too accurate but waiters always knew what it was. Food was lovely and we are convinced that it got even better as our week progressed. Ideal position for discovering Malaga.

title: Amazing and location fab!
review: Absolutely fantastic hotel right in the heart of everything you could want. A great base for getting around.  My daughter and I visited surrounding areas and loved the simplicity of it all.  We went to fuengirola for the day and visited bioparc zoo which was excellent.  On the way back we stopped off at benalmadina and had a few drinks in and around the harbour area.  Then stopped off at plaza manor and did some shopping before heading back to Malaga.  It was an excellent day.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

title: Great location ideal for a city break
review: We had a room on the 11th floor it was ideal, despite being on a busy road it was quiet. The hotel is approx 10 mins walk to the city centre through some pretty gardens. We felt totally safe walking around even after midnight. It is 2 mins walk to the new Muelle uno port area - modern, glass restaurants in total contrast to the cost, traditional restaurants found in the city centre. The hotel is also 2 mins from the beach. Really near the bus stops, go to the stop with an A on it to get a bus to the airport for 3 Euro every 30 mins taking 30 mins. Taxi rank right outside. We loved the whirlpool bath after a long day on your feet as well as the sauna and steam room. Breakfast was excellent - cereal, fruit, yoghurt,pastries, breads, cheeses, ham as well as bacon, eggs etc.

title: Post Christmas
review: Had a great weeks stay at Maestranza. Was allocated a room on the 10th floor, which had a balcony with a side street view of the sea, and a view to the castle walls . Room was very comfortable, good size bed and room , with mini bar and a room safe,and loads of storage space. Staff very friendly, and weather was excellent. Hotel is very close to the bull ring, and beach , and a reasonable walk to the shopping centre in Malaga, although you can catch a bus if needed. Great places to eat authentic tapas very close by. Will certainly consider for my next visit to Malaga.

title: Good location but..
review: The hotel is in an excellent location, just 2 mins walk to the sea, port, start of steps to Gibralfaro and 10 mins to the shopping centre, 25 mins to the station.  It is across the roundabout from the last stop on the Line A bus from the airport (3 Euros) so very easy to access.  Reception is small, with disabled access and two extremely small, slow lifts.  Checkin was quick and efficient.  Our room was on the 10th floor with a balcony and views of the sea, port and Alcazaba.  The room was a good size with a double bed which was extremely squeaky.  The bedding was not changed during our stay.  There were several remnants of squashed mosquitos on the wall.  The bathroom was large, but tired.  The bath was extremely narrow with a shower over.  A basket of toiletries was provided…

title: Great location for waterfront and city
review: I stayed for a week in December 2016 with two friends: they had 2nd floor rooms and I was on the 11th floor with great views into the bullring and of the Alcazabar.  The hotel is clean, breakfast was good, staff are friendly.  There's a roof top terrace for sun bathing, and a spa.  The taxi stand is just round the corner from the hotel entrance, but it is easy to walk into the city or to the beachfront from the hotel.  There are many restaurants on the marina front, just five minutes' walk from the hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: great location
review: Great location for marina and old town. Pleasant and prompt check in and good clean room with good sized shower. free use of spa and rooftop jacuzzi an added bonus making this hotel excellent value for money. Didnt eat here but had breakfast at small cafes nearby

title: Good hotel near Muelle Uno and waterfront
review: We stayed here for 4 nights in December 2016.  We arrived very early in the morning and were quickly checked in and given room 1208 which is on the top floor therefore very quiet from traffic noise.  The staff is nice and friendly.  The room was quite spacious and very clean and had toiletries included: liquid soap and shampoo, soap bars, paper handkerchiefs, shower cap, etc.  It is located near Malagueta Beach, Muelle Uno (restaurants and bars by the water), Pompidou's museum and we had a great view of the fortress The Alcazaba, the waterfront and the Cathedral's tower.   You have two nearby coffee places and you can walk to the centre of town in just 10 minutes.

title: Wonderful bright hotel in a great location
review: This is a lovely hotel located just a short stroll through a park from the city centre. Staff were very friendly and helpful. My 9th floor room and balcony had amazing views of the port and the city. The room and bathroom were super clean. There is a hot tub on the 13th floor with fabulous views over beautiful Malaga.

title: Malaga Weekend
review: Can't really fault this Hotel, stayed for my partner's birthday.  Everything at the Hotel was as near to perfect as we could imagine.  Staff that we came into contact with were helpful.  Didn't eat at the Hotel so cannot comment on the restaurant food.  Nice little cocktail bar to unwind in at night.  We would certainly recommend this Hotel

title: Great hotel, service a bit quirky and prices not aligned
review: Stayed at the Maestranza for a 4 night period in november 2016.   The hotel itself is located in the very centre of Malaga, next to the marina and the historic castle. The room was very nice, enough amenities as you would expect from this type of hotel, very decent wifi, nice and large bathroom and best of all, the double bed was actually a double bed and not two singles pushed together ;)   Mini bar is well stocked and complementary pad coffee machine. As we were staying on the 6th floor, we had a nice terrace and a beautiful view over the marina, the castle and the bull arena.  Noisewise very acceptable except for roadworks where (if the window stayed open) you could hear the noise and clatter as of 6 AM (help ;)  Breakfast was not included (at 28€/person/day we found this a…

title: Handy hotel for city break.
review: Just a 4 day Malaga visit, the hotel very well positioned for exploring the city. Okay it doesn't look very classy from the outside but you don't see that from the inside. Breakfast had plenty of choices and good staff all very pleasant. We had dinner on one night, it was a little expensive and could have been better. The only down side for us was the beds were a little hard and not made up properly which meant we had to do it ourselves before we could retire each evening.

title: Weekend break
review: Great hotel, excellent location,  MS Maestranza, Malaga city Pictures of hotel rooms and views where exactly what The web site and brochure said and showed. We shall definitely be using this hotel again.

title: I like it
review: Hotel was good, reception was kind, But hotel was small, the rooms were clean and had balcony, you can see Malaga from your room. Beach is near and you can walk to go there. Hotel locations is excellent.

title: Winter break weekend
review: Very good location for a long weekend stay, easy to get from airport to hotel on bus route A, cost 3€ , approx every 20 minutes. We were on the 12th floor, 2 small lifts which were  very slow. Gym & spa are accessed by stairs from 12th. We used the gym twice, and were able to have a good workout. We also used the jacuzzi, steam and sauna after returning from a long day shopping, perfect. Breakfast is on 1st floor, in bar/restaurant and was adequate for our needs. I would think that the room would maybe be small in the high season. Overall a good choice hotel for a off season break.

title: Weekend trip to Malaga
review: Great hotel, 400 yards from the old centre of Malaga. Lovely room overlooking the bull room (703) beds comfy, bar staff great and bar prices really good. Would stay there again. We booked the whole trip via travel republic including flights, taxi transfer and hotel accommodation. Perfect. We stayed December 3rd-December 6th. We wanted somewhere central as we went to see the Christmas lights which were superb ad well worth going to see. The hotel has a small gym and Jacuzzi.

title: City Trip
review: The hotel is okd fashion. Decent rooms with laminate. The breakfast is fine and has a nice variaty, unfortunately the coffee is dark (too) roasted, most likely with robusta. Only drinkable with sugar. The fitness hasn' t been updated and has old equipment.  A huge problem is the mold (fungi) in the bathroom. The helpfull employees tried to fix it with silicones in stead of adequate chemicals. Mold is very unhealhtly and a sign of lack of knowledge how to maintain a bathroom.

title: A Good Choice
review: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel, I emailed ahead notifying the hotel of expected early arrival and room requests. The hotel replied promptly and when we did arrive all our requests had been met, a good start. Our room was a good size, well furnished with everything in good condition and very clean, the bathroom was the same. We had breakfast included in our booking and enjoyed it every day, there was a very wide choice of hot and cold items. We used the bar and lounge but not the restaurant and found the staff to be very friendly as were the reception staff. The hotel is on a major road junction with several "Pelican Crossings" to use, but we knew this so no problem. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would return. Food tip, Try the bakery across the…

title: Good hotel near everything in Malaga
review: Nice hotel.  Clean and tidy. Very well situated in Malaga.   Breakfast is around the corner if you do not fancy hotel breakfast.   Beds are good and bigger than usual for Spain.   Nice staff and good at English.

title: Long weekend
review: Great hotel stayed here on three separate occasions & has been brilliant every time. Very quite on a night no banging of doors. Very nice restaurant /bar  very clean rooms and close to marina shops and numerous bars lots of places to eat nearby

title: Excellent hotel in a great area.
review: Perfect Hotel to explore Malaga, adjacent to the beaches and Marina, rooms are spotless and the staff are terrific. There is parkng if you reserve it prior to your visit, the staff park it for you off street. The one complaint was that even though we were first in for breakfast the scrambled eggs were cold.

title: No faults. Nice hotel
review: This hotel is very well situated for everything in Malaga. Rooms are nice and comfortable, perfectly clean. The view from the balcony is good,and there is no noise. Really can't be faulted, although it'd be nice to have tea and coffee in the room and a double bed rather than two singles, but that seems the norm on Spain.

title: Awesome hotel
review: Lovely hotel, great location with a 5 minute walk to the beach and promenade. Lovely rooms with amazing views of Gibralfaro Castle, Alcazabar, the bull fighting ring and the beautiful promenade, Paseo de Muelle Dos. We could see all of this from our top floor balcony and was such an amazing view every morning. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a rooftop jacuzzi that is just what you need after a long day of walking and exploring. And the bedroom always smells of a lovely citrus scent. Would totally come back here.

title: City break
review: Lovely hotel, stayed here before and wasn't disappointed this time. Lovely hotel in a great situation for the main town, beach and the marina, they are all within minutes walk. Very clean and comfortable. Our room over looked the bullring( no fighting seen) and was very quiet. There's a lovely roof terrace too. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but went daily to Bar El Gallo Rojo which is down by the beach and we loved it as it was very Spanish and the service and staff were great,they knew our order within a couple of days and we felt like locals, 2 x breakfasts less than €8

title: Ok hotel with excellent location in Malaga
review: The hotel Maestranza has a very good location close to the harbour in Malaga. Close to shopping streets, restaurants, and sightings. The room was clean, has a good standard and size, but the beds are pretty hard also the pillows, and no coffee/tea machine available in the room. Good wifi connection, and OK breakfast, could have some more variety in food.. A plus is that the room had a nice balcony with view over the famous bullfighting arena in Malaga, but we did not SEE any bulls there..

title: Great lovation
review: The hotel was perfectly located... 2 mins to port, 5 mins to beach and 10 mins to old town. It was clean, comfortable, great beds. Beds made every day and clean towels. Roof top spa was great for  a sunbathe and you ring down for drinks, which the bar staff bring up with a small pot of nuts. Traffic outside is very busy and quite noisy .  if you are in the top few floors the view of the bull ring, Alaczaba and port are good. We were room 903 and overlooked both bullring and Alacazaba. ( bit of building work going on while we were there... renovationing a lower building next to the hotel) . Fabulous cafe / Canasta across the road, where we had breakfast, fresh squeezed juices and sandwiches throughout our stay. Very reasonable. We enjoyed our few days in Malaga, particularly the…

title: Brilliant location
review: The location of this hotel is brilliant. Right next to the harbour side and a 10 minute walk from the old town. Plenty of good places to eat nearby . 3 euros on the bus from the airport to the hotel. Staff at the hotel were helpful and friendly . If you have a room at the front of the hotel there are some wonderful views . Breakfast was good and lots of choice . Malaga is a beautiful city and well worth a visit.

title: Warning: Builders at work - too close for comfort!
review: We came here after a recommendation and, prior to our visit, we were advised to book a room on a high floor, with a view, which is what we requested through our travel agent - epic failure.  We ended up on the 4th floor (of 12), right next to the lift, with a view of a builders yard!  The noise (and dust) from the building work wasn’t great but our balcony, which was almost toe-to-toe with the building they were working on, never got any sun at all so we were never tempted to sit on it.   The builders started early but we are early risers so we didn’t let it spoil our holiday.  We liked the room, we liked the staff, but we thought the breakfast was just average.  It never differed by one iota, to what was on offer for the full 7 days we stayed there and it was always just barely…

title: 2 night stay autumn 2016
review: This hotel is in an excellent location, close to city centre , the fantastic new port area and the city beach . this is a tall building with a small  lobby area and main dining area on the first floor. rooms are adequate and good modern bathroom all clean and well serviced. Breakfast is too expensive and a very adequate one can be had in cafe under(separate business).Malaga is a great city to visit and lots of options for eating and shopping near this hotel.  The Pompidou Centre Malage is 5 mins walk from hotel.

title: malaga visit
review: Lovely hotel great room excellent view of pier one. Friendly curteous staff loved the hot tub on the roof and sauna all included in the price,  welcome glass of cava as we had booked a genius deal also late check out,  would definitely recommend and stay here again.

title: Friendly, clean, central, just right
review: Spent three nights here on a trip with girlfriends. We had a good room on the 9th floor which directly overlooked the historic bull-ring.  Thankfully bullfights had ceased for the season when we were there!  The rooms were all good with comfy beds, nice bathroom (once or twice at peak times the shower temperature wobbled a bit but it was a good powerful shower) and a balcony. Breakfast was not cheap, but had everything you might want including free-flowing cava... and the cafe/bakery directly opposite also did an excellent, cheaper, breakfast. I think the soundproofing must have been very good because we weren't troubled by noise and I hope that means our noisiness wasn't too much for the other guests! On the roof is a spa and a little jacuzzi with a friendly woman dispensing…

title: Nice (but basic) hotel, Good location between beach and central area of Malaga, Friendly staff
review: I frequently stay in hotels around the world for business and vacation and had the opportunity to stay in this hotel recently. A friend who I was travelling with booked the room, so didn't know what to expect until I arrived.   The hotel is ideally situated between the Central Area of Malaga and the Beach (Malagueta). The beach is about a 5 minute walk and the Central Area of Malaga (Cathedral Area) is about 15 minute walk from the hotel. You will find all the restaurants and activity in the streets around the Cathedral Area.   The bus for the Airport (Line A) stops on the street across the way from the hotel, so it is easy to travel to from the airport and back. The tickets cost 3 euro per person, each way.   The hotel is nice but basic.   Rooms are spacious, albeit basic and…

title: Location Location Location
review: This hotel is perfectly placed for seeing Malaga approx 10 minute walk to the old town, 5 minutes to the beach, 5 minutes to the port for us this was its main selling point. We had a room overlooking the bull ring and looking out at the castle fantastic view. The hotel is clean and comfortable with an adequate breakfast. We used the bar once but found it had no atmosphere better places nearby. The staff were friendly and helpful. We used the bus from the airport to reach the hotel very easy and it was well situated to use local transport. Would return love Malaga and the situation of this hotel.

title: Lovely view!!
review: My husband and I spent 4 nights at your lovely hotel, 11th floor with a lovely view over the harbour. Nice breakfast and god beds. Right in the middle of everything: 5 minutes strok to a nice sandy beach, 5 minutes stroll to the lovely harbour aeria, with shops a viet nam nail-shop where I in 20 minutes fixed my nails..

title: Wonderful short break
review: Just returned from a 3 night break at this hotel. Perfect location for us 100 yards from the beach and less to the wonderful new marina with shops and great restaurants. Lovely to eat here at night watching the boats bobbing about with the twinkling lights of the city in the distance. We were on the 7th floor (of 12) and I would recommend a high floor as the road at the front is very, very busy. We were glad the taxi driver pointed out the entrance as its amongst shop fronts with the rest of the building being the hotel. Excellent check in (earlier than the proper time). Friendly porter took our luggage up to our room. It's a 4star hotel and very elegant and charming. Bed linen and towels changed daily. Comfortable beds, a small table and 2chairs and a desk and chair. We booked…

title: Value for money friendly hotel
review: Booked this hotel for a change rather than staying in the centre of Malaga. Very pleasant staff and check in was quick and cases taken straight to our room. We had a room at front of hotel (607) overlooking port and sea view to left. Room was average size but fine for what we needed. It was quite nice to sit on balcony (if we took chair from room) and watch the world go by. Bathroom was good size, plenty of wardrobe space and free in-room safe. Breakfast was very good with a selection of hot and cold food. Even the coffee was ok. Hotel staff very helpful and quickly fixed air condition problem and also very good giving us directions and recommendations of places to visit. On 12th floor there is a lovely sun deck but no bar open for refreshments and hot tub does not open until…

title: Great location
review: We stayed in room 606 and had a lovely view of both the port and the fort - all lit up at night and lovely to watch the sunrise.  Noisy road underneath the hotel but the windows blocked the sound out - balconies for every room and not too noisy at night.  Good breakfast and roof terrace with gym and jaccuzi which were free.  Lovely restaurants around the port area -not too expensive.  The tree lined avenue leading up to the town was a lovely start to the day and took only about 15 mins to reach the town.  Great cafe underneath the hotel for coffee and snacks.  Taxi rank also just outside for return trip to airport.  Would go again.

title: Simply wonderful Hotel
review: This is the third time we have stayed here, its a fabulous hotel. Very convenient to the Harbour, beach and city centre.  The staff are friendly and courteous. The room was spotless and cleaned every day with fresh towels.

title: Beautiful city with lots to see 🌞
review: We had hoped for a twin room but got a double, but the reception staff were very accommodating and we only had one night in the double and they swapped us to a twin room which was lovely.  The housekeeping service was very efficient and very prompt.  We had a brilliant view of the bullring.  The hotel has a fantastic location in the centre with marvellous views from the rooftop terrace.  Sun beds are provided but you'll need a towel.  Ten minutes one way takes you to the beautiful beach with a few very reasonably priced fish restaurants where we watched the Spanish children play as the sun went down, eating sardines from the barbecue.  Ten minutes in the other directions takes you to the centre of town with the bustle of the shops and eating places.  The walk there is beautiful,…

title: Perfect location if you don't want to be in the centre of town
review: The hotel is situated between the bullring and the marina. It has a small entrance between a mens formal hire shop and a cafe, the reception area is mall too but the staff are very helpful. There are two lifts which can get very busy for although his looks a small hotel from the frontage there are 12 floors.  Our room was 204 just on the second floor so handy if the lifts were busy. There is a minibar in room which is handy if you have bought anything from the supermarket nearby. (2 blocks down and across the road). There are no tea/coffee making facilities in room so a travel kettle is a good idea if you like an early morning cuppa!  For the number of guests the restaurant/bar/lounge did get very busy for breakfast. We did see people queueing for tables by 9.30am. There was a…

title: Second stay
review: We stayed here last year and just recently returned from our second stay - already planning our third stay! The hotel is in an excellent location for the beach, the old town, the port - we walked everywhere. It is also ideally located for not getting lost coming on the bus from the airport!! Get off at the last stop, turn around and look up and you'll see it! For getting back to the airport, get on at the same stop you got off at. Breakfast was great - good selection to choose from...lovely churros, fruit, pastries, tortilla +the usual cooked items plus good coffee, fruit juices, cava, wine. Rooms are a good size +bathrooms are huge. I love Malaga and I wouldn't stay at any other hotel!

title: Nice hotel with sundeck
review: We had a nice stay at this hotel. We had a balcony that was headed towards the bull ring which was a bit cool. We aldo could see the sea, but it wasn't much. Nice breakfast, much to choose from. My husband thought that the oil they had cooked everything on tasted weird. They also had some kind of a serrano ham that tasted and looked a bit mouldy. When I told them they didn't seem to understand and said it's suppose to be like that. The first day it wasn't like that though. They had a little gym on the roof witj saunas, jacuzzi and a sundeck. This was, unfortunately, only opened from 4:30pm to 9:30pm. We would have liked to get up there earlier during the say especially to the gym in the mornings. The rooms were nice and cleaned.

title: Best location
review: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. To manage people's expectations, don't expect anything fancy; where this hotel shines is location, location, location, customer service, clean rooms and a delicious, varied breakfast. If you want everything in Málaga at your finger tips, stay here! It's a 5-7 minute walk to the beach. A 2 minute walk to the Puerto de Málaga (the port) and Centre Pomidou Málaga (outdoor shopping center) and then a 13-15 minute walk to the city center where all the top restaurants, bars and sites are. Additionally the hotel is very close to the bullring and the entrances of Alcazaba and Castillo de Gibralfaro.   The rooms are relatively ok size for a European hotel and the housekeeping is good (they actually mopped the floors!). Everyday breakfast…

title: Perfect location to explore the city
review: Wonderful 5 night stay. Staff is welcoming & friendly. Helpful with any questions we had about the city. We stayed in a superior double with breakfast included.Excellent breakfast with great variety. Nice size room, well laid out with a desk as well as siting area & large bed, Nice size balcony. There are no chairs but easy enough to take the chairs from the  room. We had a fantastic view of the bullring & castle. Room was in the back of the hotel which is very quiet. Furniture is a bit worn but did not distract from the charm of the room with Picasso type paintings.    A line bus from airport is 3 euros , 30 min ride to last stop which is 100 meters from hotel. 2 min walk to port & beach. 10 min walk thru a beautiful park promenade to the old town. Many restaurants right by the…

title: As good as before...
review: We have stayed at this hotel every time that we have visited Malaga and never been disappointed.   As before, check in was prompt, professional and friendly.  The room, a standard double, was a good size with a desk, chair and plenty of power points for the business visitor. There was enough storage space for our three day stay. A balcony was available that would be quite useable though traffic noise might be off putting.  The bed was large and comfortable and side tables were provided. The lighting might best be described as discreet. Some would want more in that regard. A seating area next to the bed with a reasonable view of the mid size TV screen was a plus. Air conditioning is available and effective though the controls take some getting used to.  The bathroom was a good…

title: Malaga hotel by the port
review: Nice clean hotel right next to the bullfight arena You can very well see bullfights right from the roof terrace and hear the crowd cheering at no cost  They have a spa but no pool  Rooms are very clean and comfortable You are only 3-4 min walk to the beach and port  Host at reception are very helpful and knowledgable  You can enjoy a good massage at the spa and train at their workout facilities  Would definitely recommend

title: Just right
review: Great location, clean rooms, cleaner can come in every day if required, would stay here again. 5-10 min walk from both the beach/port & town centre. We booked breakfast on our stay and I was good with plenty of choice. Will definitely book to stay here again on another visit

title: Family holiday
review: All staff friendly and very helpful  We stayed here as a family of four nothing too much trouble for the kids   The roof top terrace overlooks the bullring. We seen two fights   The food in the hotel was good the restaurant never seem to be busy.   The beach is a 2 minute walk away.

title: Great location
review: Great location,  near port with lots to do.  Short walk to beach and city centre.  Room v. Spacious,  we stayed in 401 which overlooked the road but had side view of sea and alcazar fortress.  Amazing view from rooftop,  jacuzzi not working?  Room was dusty on walls above lights and curtains.  Breakfast was great,  quiet with lots of choice.  Most of all we had great sleep as so quiet!!

title: Nearly New Year
review: Excellent Food, Bar Expensive, Rooms more than Adequate and excellently placed.  Locale is really the thing here but the food....wow, loved it here with my whole family and cannot wait to return in the near future.  Views from the roof and rooftop spa are amazing too

title: Great location
review: Just stayed for 3 nights in room 701  facing the bullring. Great hotel, lovely room with seating area. Jacuzzi bath with ample space in the bathroom. Very clean. Breakfast, good selection to eat. Coffee was very good. On my husband's birthday itself the management left an ice bucket with a bottle of sparkling wine in - very thought full.  My only complaint was the spa - nice area but only the jacuzzi working. A bit of a disappointment. The hotel is close to the beach - about 5 mins walk. Down the side of the bullring.  10 mins walk to the old town  where there are some great tapas bars. Much nicer than the bars and restaurants in the marina.  We would certainly recommend the hotel.

title: Excellent location and value for the money
review: We stayed 12 days in this hotel in July 2016. This hotel has the most ideal location in Malaga. Just 200 m walk to the beach and 400 m to the Placa de la Merced via the tunnel or 700 m via the sea side promenade. There is also plenty of restaurants just 100 meters outside of the hotel in the harbour. But if you want to have good Tapas you need to go to the old town. Just a hint that if you want to go to the famous Taüas places like El Pimpi or Cervantes them you need to go relatively early meaning 8 pm or else you have long waiting time. But there are plenty other nice Tapas places in Malaga so dont stress too much.   If you need to take a taxi there is a taxi stand outside of the hotel and with 4-5 EUR you can get to big shopping  centre or center of the old town. Taxi is very…

title: Great Hotel; Great Location
review: We stayed in room 1201 that gave us great views of the adjacent bullring and the City. A concert with Pablo Lopez was on whilst there - we had a grandstand view.  The Hotel is clean, well situated and the staff are very friendly. There is a roof top terrace with beds/umbrellas and a Spa.  The Hotel is about 200 metres from the beach and 400 metres from the City through a beautiful wide park.  There si a great choice of retsuarants in teh City and on the Marina.  The only downside was the beach - it is dirty and gritty, if you wear white it will last 1 day.

title: Great Location and Value
review: Located a very short walk from the Beach and the Port with its shops, restaurants and cafes and 10 mins walk into the to old town.  Roof Terrace has sun loungers and parasols and spectacular views.  Beds were so comfy, room was clean, air conditioning was very effective but didn't have a thermostat so it had to be on or off.  Shower pressure was great, and an endless supply of hot water.   Our room faced the port and overlooked a main road, the traffic noise didn't bother us but it might some people. There are rooms on the other side of the hotel that would have been quieter but less of a view. We had a very small triangular balcony, no chairs but we took one from the room outside but it was tight for space and not somewhere you'd want to spend a lot of time, but nice enough to…

title: Great hotel, very helpful staff
review: I liked the location of the hotel - not in the thick of the tourist part of time, and very close to the beach. All the tourist attractions were a short walk away. It was very clean and the staff were super helpful, so I'd definitely stay there again.

title: Pleasant (but basic) in a great location
review: We would return if in Malaga again mainly because of the central location and well kept rooms.  pros: - Great location 400 m walk along a street to the beach and proximity to the marina, old town and castle; - Modern, functional ambiance (4*); - Good restaurants a few steps away (we liked El Refectorium); - Grocery shops 300m away; - Small fridge available in room; - Safe-box in room; - Breakfast buffet was optional at 15 Euro extra (eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, cheeses, pastry); - Other breakfast cafes around (my preference); - Stable Wifi at 6-8 Mbit/s;  cons: - Very small elevator (only 4 slim people fit in) such that this causes a noticeable delay as it is a ~7 story building; - No parking directly at the hotel. A valet will park your car at 15 Euro/24h + tip. It takes up to…

title: Second visit this year - great location
review: Having visited the MS Maestranza in March, I knew where I wanted to stay when I returned to Malaga recently!  This hotel is in a fantastic spot - easy walking access to the revamped port area and the old centre, with a taxi rank and bus stops nearby and the Malagueta beach a hop, skip and a jump away.  From our room we had amazing views across to the alcazaba, the city and the port.    As per my previous visit the room cleanliness was exceptional and bedroom comfort was great (large, comfortable bed and fantastic black out curtains!).  From the Maestranza we enjoyed a lovely 40 - 45 minute stroll along the seafront to the beaches of Pedregalejo and caught the no. 3 bus back (just Euro 2 each - the Paseo del Reding stop is closest to the hotel, just by the bullring).  We also…

title: Will definitely stay here again !!
review: Great location.  Clean and modern rooms.  We also had a view of the Bull Ring.  Very happy and have recommended to friends and family.  Hope to visit again very soon.  Malaga is a great City, so much to see and do.

title: Short City Break
review: Wow!! What a fantastic hotel! I visited alone for a short city break and found the hotel to be clean, with friendly staff and all the facilities to make your stay a good one. The restaurant is excellent with great food and prices as well as a friendly waiting team.  In my room I found it clean, very posh bathroom and a safe box in the wardrobe to which you can easily set the code made leaving items locked and secure.   The spa on the 13th floor is just icing on the cake. What better way to relax than in a jacuzzi looking out over the city and harbour!! Sun loungers on the roof too which is a nice feature. All I can say though is the lifts up and down are essentials otherwise it'd be a long walk!!   The only tiny little thing that would make it better is is there was a swimming…

title: Location
review: fantastic hotel. Great location. Near to everything. Staff friendly. Cleanliness excellent always a clean bleach smell. Room 1202 overlooking the bullring has excellent views. Glad bull fighting was not on when we were there. Rooftop great for sunbathing after strolling round city. Would go to this hotel again

title: Long weekend
review: Great location, clean and spacious room, comfy beds, great bathroom/shower Reception team very helpful. Beach 5 mins walk, town 10-15 mins walk. Harbour area beautiful with great restaurants. We were room only, didn't eat in the hotel.  We had an early evening flight and the day we checked out we used the spa facilities to shower etc and the hotel were very accommodating. Super sun trap on the roof with plenty of sunbeds.  Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: This hotel needs a refurbishment
review: Located close to the road the sound proofing needs upgrading because although we were on the eighth floor we could still here the traffic from the busy road. This should be down graded to a three star. Hotel is tired and with an array of mixed styles. The spa is a joke. You could say a jacuzzi with a selection of towels. The roof top was in need of some new sun beds and was basically an oven. Yes great views of the bullring. Near to the beach and the marina. We had breakfast at the small cafe on the corner. I would never stay here again and would be utterly depressed if I thought this was my holiday hotel. We stayed here due to our flight being cancelled and a very last minute booking. The room at 140 euros was  over priced. It was a superior double supposedly but the bed was…

title: Value for money
review: Hi, hotel is located at about 300m from the beach and 500m from the city centre.  Taxi stops right at the doorstep, so getting around the city is easy.  If you can, try for a room high up so you won't get any noise from the busy road down.  Rooms are clean, bathroom is well and pretty big, breakfast is good. Net special, but everything I think of needed for breakfast is there.  People at the desk don't really well english, but it's ok. They're friendly, that's the most important thing.

title: Difficult for people with limited mobility
review: We booked this Hotel in November 2015 for a trip in June 2016, through our local Travel Agent. We requested an adapted room for a person with limited mobility.   When we arrived we discovered that our room was a standard room on the 6th floor, no bathroom facilities for a disabled person.  When I contacted reception to tell them that this room was unsuitable and unsafe for us , the receptionist was totally disinterested and bordering on rude.  It was difficult to access the breakfast area as it was one floor up from reception and didn't have a lift.  We were celebrating a special Wedding Anniversary, so we were particularly disappointed that this didn't go to plan.  I think Management at Amaragua should not take bookings from people who have special needs with regard to…

title: Great position
review: Great position to explore Malaga. Looking onto the Bull Ring, view of the Alcazaba, close to the beach, the old town etc, etc. We have stayed here several times and its always clean and comfortable. Underground parking is close by...pure convenience.

title: Great location but few niggles
review: City break recommended by friends. Good points: central, clean and on whole welcoming hotel. However could so easily be a very good hotel. From our experience areas not so happy with: we arrived late Saturday allocated to room 404 (after having emailed a couple of times to say special occasion, staying whole week so could we be allocated a room at back so quieter and high room so better views). Room 404 overlooking brick wall of building opposite which was having building work!! Did not unpack first night. Told no other room available til following day. Room itself also too small. I probably would have flown home the following day had I had to have stayed in it any longer!  We were moved to room 1005 the following afternoon and for also a standard room it could not have been…

title: Close to the Marina. Great location for beach and nightlife
review: We stayed for 7 nights and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a superior room on arrival. The room was a good size with a coffee table, writing desk and 3 chairs. Bathroom was nice with a jacussi bath, a separate shower, toilet, bidet and two sinks. Furniture was all in good condition and decor was all ok. Air conditioning was good. The 2 lifts were always available and working so no problem being on the 12th floor. The Hotel reception staff were helpful and friendly. They recommended and booked restaurants for us. I recommend El Pimpi near the cathedral or Miguel Restaurant is just behind the hotel both good food at a good price. The Maestranza is located about 100m from a long sandy beach. 10 minutes pleasant walk brings you to the corner of the Cathedral where the night life…

title: Clean hotel in a great location near the beach, city centre, and bus stop
review: Positives:  -Overall very clean and tidy  -friendly and welcoming staff  -nice view of the bull ring and Alcazaba from our room (801 on 8th floor). You can also see a bit of the sea.  -has a decent cafe right outside the hotel  -few minutes walk from the beach  -right next to Line A bus stop (from airport)  -very close to the Alcazaba   -the area is beautiful with lost of well kept flowers and trees  - rooms are definitely 3 to 4 stars.  Great size with great bathroom and additional chairs.  - lovely bathroom   -good lifts to the rooms (two small lifts)  Negatives:  -our bed didn't have a duvet. Instead it had two bed sheets put together to form a 'duvet'.  -no bathroom slippers  -the jacuzzi bath pumped out lots of dirt and hair   -no iron in the room   -no kosher or halal…

title: Location Location Location
review: Stayed here on a city break and the location could not have been better. We were close to the Marina and Beaches where you will find some very good restaurants located on the beach or along the Marina. It's a 10 minute walk into the Old Town through a lovely park. We traveled from the Airport by bus for 3 Euro's each and the bus stops just yards from the hotel and its probably the quickest way to and from the airport. Our room on the 8th floor had views of the Marina and Castle above the Old Town and there's a small cafe just outside for breakfast or drinks.

title: Great hotel and location
review: A 2 night stay at MS Maestranza turned out to be great fun and it would have been nice to have stayed longer. The reception staff were particularly helpful in allocating us the location and type of room we’d asked in advance – we find this a rarity!  Getting There  A 100 metres or so from the airport bus stop (A route) and the hotel doesn’t have its own car park. There are several nearby but it is a bit awkward to arrive first and drop your luggage off as there isn’t a loading area and the street is very busy.   Location  Really good.  About a 10 minute walk into the old town and two minutes down to Malaguita beach.  There are several convenience stores in the area.  Rooms  Pretty standard stuff for Spanish hotels.   The rooms are not massive but big enough to be comfortable.…

title: Basic but pleasant
review: I stayed here with my boyfriend on a quick trip down to the south of Spain from Barcelona. I chose it because of the location and the price. Whilst not being the cheapest it looked the nicest for my price range and was very close to the marina and the centre.   We were able to check in at about half 1 and the checkout time was 12. Sounds great, but probably explains the abundance of stray hairs on the bathroom floor (that were not mine).   I'd booked a double room, but as ever booking as two males were given two singles (made as singles and put together), we were only staying 1 night so didn't want to create hassle with changing rooms.   The actual room was nice, a great size and a view of the bull ring and castle. I'm always disappointed when there are no coffee and tea making…

title: Expensive for the service - GOING DOWN THE DRAIN STEADILY
review: Friends, Family and I have all stayed in this hotel many times... but we have all noticed how it is slowly becoming worse than it used to be. Not so much for the hotel / rooms but the STAFF. We have noticed a huge change in staff attitude over the years and does not offer the same customer service they did 6 years ago. It hurts to say it as we really loved this hotel, but prices have steadily risen and no cheerful deals can be found at any time of the year... and with the staff being less polite and curious, well, it has dropped considerably.  Further example of this: I would like to add that we went out for a drink one Friday night and noticed 3 of the Maestranza staff drinking in the same bar as us, (2 had their uniform still on). Some drinks later we saw them arguing with…

title: An excellent hotel
review: It's our 2nd last night at this hotel and we cannot find fault with it. It's great position 5 minutes walk from either the beach or marina and about 10 minutes to the old town. The hotel is on a busy road but don't let that put you off or you will miss the chance of staying at this lovely hotel. We had a triple room which was 2 single beds plus a bed settee which was like a 3|4 bed. The standard of cleanliness was great, room cleaned each day. The staff all seem very helpful, the barman finding my phone which I thought was lost. I'm returning to Malaga in September and will definitely be booking the hotel again.

title: 3* Hotel
review: Chose this hotel due to its good reviews and its 4* rating.  Whilst the hotel is centrally located, being very close to the marina, and only a short walk from the city centre, I was a little disappointed with a few things. The hotel has two very small lifts; only big enough for two people and their luggage each, and I found them quite claustrophobic. The ensuite bathroom was cramped with the toilet and bidet behind the door, and only a shower over the tiny bath. The breakfasts were not what I would class as 4*; I've had better breakfasts in 3* B&B. That aside, the staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was kept exceptionally clean and tidy. I would class this as a good 3*, but not 4* based on other experiences.

title: Great service but small rooms
review: Was booked there for UN interagency games.The staff were great my room and bathroom was however very small-especially the bathroom,must be the smallest bathtub I've ever seen.On the bright side it was close to a lot of places...shops,train,restaurants and a great dry cleaning service.Also free wifi and great decor .Breakfast was a buffet with a chef on hand to customize your omelette.

title: Perfect!
review: Great hotel! big , clean rooms, lovely staff and perfect location. 5 min walk to city centre, great view of either the port or bull ring. Absolutely fantastic value for money. Lovely bar inside the hotel and everything is spotless. Very close to lots of nice bars and restaurants. Perfect!

title: great location -  Comfy and close to all things
review: Just spend a few nights in Malaga prior to going on a cruise, and it was awesome. I wish I had stayed a few more nights and had more time to explore. The MS Maestranza is a nice little hotel just a short walk from most of the sites. It is directly across from the Marina area which is excellent if you want to be next to the water and more "common" shops like LaCoste etc. It is also just a block away from the beach and some really amazing ocean front restaurants. In order to get to all the sites that most people come to Malaga for...the little town with all the cool architecture, tapas, Picasso museum, Alcazaba, etc you are just a short walk through the park (not even half a mile). So if you want to be close to it all for a great price, this is the place. The Hotel: Very helpful…

title: Room with a View!
review: This was a very nice hotel. We had a comfortable king sized bed and the room was very spacious. We also had a Jacuzzi bathtub and a balcony that overlooked the Plaza de Torros. The Alcazaba and beach could also been seen from our balcony. The top floor spa and sun lounging area was an excellent bonus. The room was clean and the staff were very friendly.

title: Very good value/price
review: Stayed there for 2 nights, 1 when arriving and 1 when leaving Malaga, different type of rooms, smaller on the right hand side of elevators, larger on the left hand side of elevators. Facilities for smokers inside the rooms, all with balcony. Plus the Corrida arena that you can admire from the upper floors. Both type of rooms are reasonable, quality materials, 90's finishes. Pleasant personnel, generous breakfast with local Spanish food for 14€/adult. Small SPA on the 12th floor where you can also get a tan on the terrace.

title: Great
review: Stayed 21/04/2016 for 3 nights. Great little hotel right next to the marina. Very clean and tidy with excellent staff. Only a ten minute walk to the beutiful Malaga town.  Well worth staying and reasonably cheap. Thank you for making us Welcome :)

title: Excellent location
review: The best thing about this hotel is its location - perfectly situated between the port and the old town, and just a few metres from the airport bus stop. Taxi rank just outside the hotel.  The rooms are not spacious but adequate. Yet here is free wifi in the rooms with no password necessary. Breakfast is average although  the fresh fruit was delicious.  A good choice if location is important to you.

title: Great place for introduction to Spain
review: I was immediately impressed by the friendliness of the staff who spoke English rather well. A porter was waiting by the front door to help with my bags and after I checked in, he took me to my room where he demonstrated all of the features including the heat control. The hotel provides valet parking which is helpful since the parking area is a couple of blocks from the hotel. The room was clean and a comfortable size with a large flat screen TV. The decor  was very attractive with interesting painted borders between the walls and ceiling. Spa services are available and a nice little bar and restaurant. Heavy curtains quiet any noises and the location near the beach is ideal.

title: Fantastic location
review: Just back from a 4 night break at the MS Maestranza. Location is fantastic, near the beach and the port with it's restaurants and shops and the Pompidou Centre.It is a lovely ten minute walk to the centre through lovely gardens or a shorter walk though a nearby tunnel. The hotel was very clean, breakfast was fine and the staff were friendly and helpful.We had a room on the 9th floor with stunning views of the port, bullring and Alcazaba.The hotel is on a busy road junction and there is traffic noise but this wasn't a problem and couldn't be heard at night with the doors closed. There is a rooftop area with hot tub and spa.There were insufficient sunbeds and I felt this area could be made much more attractive . Otherwise a fantastic stay.

title: Short stay, just one night
review: The room was quiet and comfortable. The location is perfect if you like to go jogging in the park nearby or if you like to stroll along the yacht harbour. Getting there is easy, from the Airport take bus A until the end of the line. You can see the hotel from the bus stop.  You can take the same bus from the bus station or the railway station. The hotel is a 10' walk from the city centre.  I didn't have breakfast or dinner here so I can't judge that. The only remark I can give is the slow and un unreliable WIFI. I was only there for a couple of hours so it could have been just temporarily. The Dunkin coffee at Marina has good WIFI. You could go there if you really need it.

title: Great Location, Good Hotel
review: Recently spent four nights at the Maestranza. Had a lovely room on the third floor overlooking the bullring.  Good size bathroom with very efficient shower.  The hotel is a great location for reaching the centre of town and a very short walk to the nearby beach.  Also the Pedregalejo beach can be easily reached on the No. 3 bus which is just a five minute walk away, all fares on the buses are 1.30 euro standard fare.  We only had breakfast one day in the hotel, this is 14 euros, for which there is everything you could want from cereals, fried eggs, bacon, etc. pastries, fruit and even a glass of cava should you wish.  Good efficient wifi. Staff were helpful and rooms were clean with fresh towels every day.  Nice sunbathing area in the roof with great views.  A good choice for a…

title: Holidays in Malaga
review: Hotel on 5+, Location just perfect. As for us as for family with baby it was perfect. Puerto,Malagueta,Park,Alcazaba all just in 5-10 min. Great. Our room was on 12 floor,and the view was amazing. Breakfast was good,staff very friendly.

title: Good clean hotel centrally located
review: If you need to overnight in this area of Malaga, the hotel offers good clean basic accommodation in a reasonably quiet location with great views of the bullring and Alcazaba. The bar and dining area offer comfort, although we did not use the restaurant.  Opposite there is an excellent multi story car park and an extensive array of good restaurants within a very easy walk. The town centre is 10 minutes walk through a magnificent park area.

title: Old style hotel, but great staff, great location
review: Mistake with the room selected. Couldn't be sorted on our late arrival. But as promised we had a room as requested the next morning.  On a junction of busy streets, so lower floors are noisy. As I choose not to use air con, but open the windows so are the upper floors, but I expect that.  The desk staff could not be more pleasant & helpful.  Central Malaga is a short walk through a traffic/pedestrian tunnel. Not the most enticing walk, but it is short.  Right next to the Plaza del Toros, buses run straight to Pedragalejo for beach lunches. Recommended.  Taxi rank outside the hotel, by the Plaza.   Malaga is such an accessible town that taxis shouldn't be necessary though.  All in all a good stay, the final room was extremely comfy.

title: Location, location, location
review: Staying here for Easter weekend. The main selling point of this hotel is its location. It is next to the new port development and Pompidou Centre and 5 minutes walk to the beach/seafront and 10 minutes walk to the heart of the old city. Rooms are clean and modern if a bit small. The rooms at the rear literally back onto the Malagueta bullring, and the upper floor rooms like ours have a grandstand view of proceedings - if you're into that sort of thing - which we're not. There is no outdoor pool, but there is a sunroof/terrace and a spa, jacuzzi, sauna and gym. The bar on first floor is ok if a little soulless. We haven't eaten in hotel, so can't comment. Didn't take breakfast option as it seemed overpriced to me when there are so many places to have breakfast for half the price…

title: Superb location
review: Very nice hotel, only 10 minutes walk from the center and near the water and a waterfront mall with shops and restaurants. Stayed two nights and would recommend this hotel. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Rooms very clean, the only thing I was surprised that a 4 star hotel didn't have was lotion in the bathroom. The spa on the top floor was also nice...the small hammam could use a little bit of upgrading but the whirpool and sauna were nice. There is a also a decent gym (however with some dust bunnies floating around).

title: clean and comfortable  ,recomended
review: Booked through expedia the hotel is about 10min walk from the city center ,but just across the road from the bus stop which goes to and from the airport which is ideal .The hotel is very clean comfortable and has lifts to all floors,the breakfast buffet is very good and there is a gym/sauna/massage rooms at the very top,out on the roof you can get great views of the surrounding area ,the bullring/the castle/the alcazaba and the port and beach areas,the rooms are spacious with mini bar/tv/ good showers ,and balconies,friendly staff at reception are helpful on local knowledge ,great place to stay and well worth the price

title: Great value, fantastic location
review: We booked the MS Maestranza through Expedia.  It's location is fantastic for a Malaga city break - set a hop, skip and jump away from the newly developed port area/Pompidou Centre yet an easy stroll to the older quarter/Cathedral district, packed with history, character, charm and tradition.  From the MS Maestranza you can also access the beach and promenade at La Malagueta quickly and easily.  Upon arrival, the hotel entrance may not inspire confidence, but stick with it. Our room (1207) was located on the 12th Floor with wonderful views across the port and over to the old town. It was spacious and the beds were perfectly comfortable.  Despite the wonderfully central location, the room was blissfully quiet at night time.  The inclusion of spa facilities is a welcome extra -…

title: Excellent location, very good hotel
