review: This is a very good Hotel option in downtown Malaga. Do not judge from the small and modest lobby, the hotel is much better. Located near the new tourist port, just in front of the Pompidou Museum, a 15 min walk to the city center. Very good rooms (quiet in the higher floors), nice bathroom.  Public parking available. Efficient and nice personnel everywhere. Wifi can be improved. We did not use breakfast this time, but I have used it in the past in work trips and it was very good.

title: Very good value for money
review: Very nice rooms and service, suitable for a four star hotel, great views and really central. The staff were very friendly and the spa was lovely. The mini bar was also very reasonably priced. Thank you!

title: Ideal location
review: I stayed with my daughter for 3 nights in a lovely room overlooking the bullring, it was a beautiful view.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  The only downside was that the mini-bar had been locked.  We enjoyed the buffet breakfast, it was all fresh and plentiful.  The hotel was easy to get to from the airport (the last stop on the A bus) and was situated next to the harbour, which was lovely to walk along in the evening.  There are some great shops and restaurants next to the harbour and they are open until late in the evening.  It is only a 10 minute walk into the main parts of Malaga. I recommend this Hotel for comfort and location.

title: Exceeded expectations
review: This hotel looks modest from the outside, but inside you'll find friendly staff, and spacious and clean rooms. We were particularly impressed by the size of the bathroom. It's within walking distance of all the major sights in Malaga. No password needed for free WiFi.

title: Great spot for the port restaurants
review: I stayed for 4 nights in October. Nice hotel, friendly staff. I hate seeing mould around the bath tub but other than that the room was clean, tidy and plenty of room.   Two minute walk to the port shops and restaurants and ten minutes in to the city centre.   Would stay again if the price was right. Going back to Malaga in a few weeks but staying in another hotel as the price this time was more than I wanted to pay for the Maestranza.

title: Great first night in Malaga
review: The hotel is well situated between the bullring and a couple of minutes walk to the new harbour development (Muelle Uno). Great reception staff and was grateful to have help getting bags up to the room after travelling all day. Double room immaculate and very spacious. Little bit of traffic noise as the room was at the front. Didn't eat at the hotel but had the breakfast, very wide choice (self service) and was pleased to find healthy fruit option. Simple checkout and they looked after my bags all day (no charge) until I needed to catch the train to Ronda, my next destination.

title: Great Location
review: Hotel is in a fantastic location right by the port with plenty of bars & restaurants to go to around there. The little coffee shop on the corner of the hotel is a great place to grab a drink & a bite to eat for breakfast at the start of the day also.  Staff are friendly & always able to advise on best ways to get around the city, always a place I'd recommend to stay if looking for a good location to get yourself around Malaga.

title: Warning restaurant but good hotel
review: The hotel is ok , old but good . Its not a 4* more like 3*+ . Do not eat at the restaurant , the food is so disgusting and if u have to eat , just order frensh Fries so u dont get sick !!! My husband got pink chicken and I got a really bad lasagna which i sent back and ordered frensh Fries instead, had to eat.. They use very strong cleaning things, smell a lot and you have to open your door to stay alive ;) , not good haha , the beds are okey , just old and a little too hard . First we got a room who smelled from the toilet and then changed it to a better one .

title: lovely, definitely recommend
review: Currently staying here, two nights left.  It's in a fantastic location, very close to the  new port with plenty of restaurants and some shopping, bull ring behind,  easy and pleasant stroll into centre, passing two tourist info centres on the way. Wall up to castle just across the road. We were on the 12th floor facing the port so fantastic views and facing sun. Lovely roof terrace tho a litle windy at present to fully enjoy. A free jacuzzi, sauna and steam room on the top floor. Barely had to share even tho its a good size hotel.  Room very nice with everything we require. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Good location, courteous staff,  not a true 4 star quality hotel
review: We stayed 20 days at this hotel. The location is great - 10 min walk to the historic center in one direction and to the marina walkway in the other. Comfortable bed, furnishings are a bit outdated which makes the room a bit drab, no drawers. Nice terrace but no outdoor chairs which would be nicer than dragging the bedroom chairs outside... I suggest staying on the upper floors for the view and for the noise from the traffic below. Not enough lighting in the room; very weak, especially if you need to work on the desk. Not enough electrical sockets especially now since we travel with cell phones, pc, tablet, etc. I bought a multiple socket from the supermarket around the corner, which by the way is very convenient. There's a desk, but no real work space. You have to unplug the…

title: Fab hotel in a great location, will hopefully return!
review: I emailed the hotel to request a high floor room at the back as I like peace and quiet when away. We had a lovely room overlooking the bullring and the castle. Perfect start! It's a couple of minutes from the marina area which is lovely, and about 10 mins to the start of a long beach, which is great to wander along. In the other direction, you can walk a couple of different routes, one along the marina, one along a lovely park with parrots in the palm trees, or via the town hall and in 10 minutes or so you're at the start of the old town and main shopping street. We enjoyed the hot tub, watching the sun set but because Malaga had so much going for it, we only managed to fit in one during our 3 night stay. We were room only but there's a café underneath if you need a breakfast.…

title: Good hotel, good location
review: Fairly good hotel in a good location across from the new port and next to the bullring. Reasonable size room with balcony (no seats or table on balcony). Comfortable bed. Bath and shower in a good sized bathroom. Great view from room including a bit of a sea view. Mini bar but no kettle. TV. Good WiFi.  Steam room, sauna and Jacuzzi. Jacuzzi was OK, the steam room severely lacked steam and was fairly useless. If I had enough time, the sauna may have eventually heated up! Breakfast was plentiful and very good with lots of choice and excellent coffee. Great views from rooftop, where you can also find some chairs and sun loungers. Particularly good views of bullring. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would return but not bother with sauna or steam room.

title: Quality hotel
review: Great hotel for the price , clean ,smells clean , nice spa to relax and look at the view over malaga , the receptionist was helpful , the room was comfortable and felt like home albeit for 2 nights , terrace with a view over the old town and towards the port , really really convenient if you want to be close to the city centre , we will definitely return

title: Easy Wifi
review: Easy no hassle Wifi. Friendly staff. Comfortable enough room on 8th floor away from noise outside but corridor noise can be heard. Basic toiletries in room. Shower brilliant. Spa hot tub isn't much, kids were splashing in it so never got the chance to go in. Had massage instead €25 for 30 mins was really good but basic and no faffing. Gym looked ok. Hotel right next to bull ring. Bus stop A nearby takes you straight to airport for €6 which was better than taxi of €25.

title: Good location short walk to old town
review: Just by the new port " Muelle 1"  the hotel is also close enough to the old town to be a comfortable 10 minute walk. So great location. Small, quite cramped reception area but very cheerful, welcoming staff, check-in quick and without any problems. Rooms are spacious with a good.sized ensuite bathroom and plenty of wardrobe room. Big new HD TV. Comfortable enough for an overnight stay. All a bit tired around the edges but excellent value. We had booked two rooms and our son got a room with an excellent view towards the castle, should have asked for one for ourselves.  We had breakfast in the café just outside next to the hotel and that was excellent. Fresh open toasted croissants and coffee and juice.

title: 4 stars is too much for this hotel
review: Great location: near a pretty beach and close to some very nice restaurants (indian, italian, local..) but the size of the room was a bit disappointing for a 4 star hotel. Quite small, and boring. Good points: nice shower, reliable wifi connection and a big tv with many channels. Our room had a view over an old bull ring. Parking is difficult (and expensive), they have some complex system with a discount, but we could not figure it out. Close to the harbour and a ten minute walk from the historic center, so that was ok. My advice to the hotel: with 12 floors it is time to think about a second coffee machine for breakfast.

title: The best room I ever stayed in my life.
review: I stayed there in March 2015 for my first holidays. I had asked a room with a view and the receptionist allocated us on a high floor. On the way to the room and considering the price, which was very low, I had thought our room would be tiny, when I opened the door I was surprised and delighted that the room was huge, with a lovely and large balcony, I just couldn't believe. The staff were very friendly and the location was convenient, 5 minutes to the beach and 20 min to city center. On the top floor there is a jacuzzi, sauna and a huge are where you can see everything. Since then, when I hear someone says they are going to Malaga, I always recommend this hotel. Sorry for taking too long to review you, but I had completely forgotten to do it, but you deserved it and I always…

title: Good
review: The Good -   Excellent location. So close to the new Port development with cafes, restaurants, shops and tented stalls. Less than 10 mins walk to the area that includes Alcazaba, Roman Theatre, Cathedral, shops etc. The €3 airport shuttle bus leaves you just across the road (wait for the final stop). Also there is a taxi rank outside which we used to go back to airport (€21). Large Twin room with new shower fitted. Nice rooftop area with amazing views, sun loungers and spa area. Beautiful French patisserie on the ground floor (separate business) with bacon, toast and eggs for €4.50 and lovely French lady owner. I would consider staying at this hotel again.  The Bad -  Cleanliness and general upkeep needs to be improved. Some cob webs on lampshades and the bathroom was a bit…

title: Goood!!!
review: Staff, position, comfort! We got a room for two nights. The room was big with a living room!!! Beatiful view on Plaza de toros and Alcazaba. The hotel is located near the port and the paseo Parque. All was perfect. Sure will book again coming back to Malaga.

title: Bad experience
review: We arrived at the hotel only to be told they didn't have our booking .we booked on the  Internet last February with a company called getaroom.com.I showed them all our booking references but the receptionist was totally unhelpful .Her only comment was that they had plenty of rooms but we would have to pay up front .our daughter in England managed to contact getaroom.com who faxed our payment details to the hotel to confirm we had paid. The receptionist said,yes we have been paid. This had been very stressfull and took over two hours to resolve.no apology was given.this is not a 4 star hotel.

title: Location, location,location !
review: We have just returned from staying here for a week. The location was perfect for us, close to the port, city centre & beach. The bus (A line)from the airport, cost 3 euros and dropped us off a couple of minutes walk from the hotel...perfect ! On arrival,about lunchtime, we were welcomed by the receptionist & an extremely happy, friendly, personable porter / bellman. We were allocated a room on the 8th floor, looking towards the port to the right, & seafront to the left, from our balcony. We were on a room only basis, as we do not eat much for breakfast in the heat, we decided it would not be worthwhile paying the extra price.  There is a SuperSol supermarket very nearby, beside the bullring, which is at the rear of the hotel. Water, drinks & nibbles were very reasonable here.…

title: Great location, pleasant stay
review: The hotel is perfectly located between the beach area and the old town, next to the bullring. We had a room with a balcony facing the old town which had a great view to the fortification and to the harbour. The room in pretty basic but the bathroom was nice and modern. All in all the hotel served as a great home base during our exploration of Malaga and its surroundings. The hotel also had a roof terrace for sum bathing with a jacuzzi.

title: Holiday
review: My friend and I have just returned from 4 days holiday in Malaga, staying at the Hotel MS Maestranza. The hotel is spotless and bright, location fantastic. Near the beach and the marina, a ten minute walk through a beautiful park, takes you to Malaga city center. A fabulous vibrant welcoming city full of fantastic restaurants and bars. I would like to thank the reception staff who were warm and friendly. We were in room 704 a lovely room looking towards the bullring. We will be returning to the hotel in the spring and this time would like to overlook the bullring. Perhaps the ninth floor. The spa is very small there is also a gym I would much rather be exploring Malaga than spending time in a spa. I almost forgot extremely comfortable beds and a great shower, plenty toiletries…

title: close to everything
review: Location is perfect. Short walk from everything:old town, shopping area, parks, port and beach. Amazing view from the room: you have the bull arena, castle, fountain, park. Good sized rooms nice and clean.

title: Great location, great staff.
review: location was perfect. Short walk to old town, sopping district, port and beach, staff were really helpful. Only negative was the cycle hire company they promote. Awful experience due to terrible bikes.

title: well located hotel
review: good average hotel , located across from the beach and restaurants ,nice views at night from the room , but balcony was a bit small it was cut off at an angle,good breakfast, efficient staff,easy to find

title: Another super stay
review: This was our second visit to this hotel which is a recommendation in itself. We arrived at the airport and chose to take a taxi ( we hit green lights all the way so it was 19 Euros but if you hit a lot of red lights expect to pay c.26 Euros ) . You can take a bus ( think it's Bus A ) from the airport and the hotel is by the last stop ( cost is 3 Euros ) . The entrance to the hotel is small but taxi drivers know where it is and if on foot from the bus stop look for the name of the hotel at the top of the building ( just head in the direction of the bull ring ) . The hotel is very convenient for the beach , the old town , the port plus Alcazabar and Gibralfaro . The port has a lovely marina area with good shops and restaurants . Do go to the end of the port where the cruise ships…

title: Fantastic break
review: We stayed here for 2 nights with our friends, we booked through booking.com. We can not rate the hotel and staff enough, nothing was too much trouble, we arrived early 12 o'clock asked if we could leave our bags, and we're checked in no problem at all, had a fab view, 1107 overlooking the Port, Castle and Cathedral. Perfect position, albeit a bit noisy with traffic, when on balcony but great double glazing and  slept very well. Perfect for fantastic restaurants, bars and shopping at the port.  We will definitely return and too be honest could easily have stayed on

title: Good location only
review: If you travel on business ,pls fdo not choose this hotel Very small room ,including the bathroom. It's very old and not very confortable. You have to step a stair just with the luggage before to reach the front desk. At the time of my stay the wify was unusefukl,connecting ,but not operatingat all. Very old forniture inside the room the only good thing is the location ,at walking distance to the ciry centre.

title: Good location and super value
review: Just spent Friday night in the vibrant city of Malaga. This hotel is well located, good value and the staff is more than helpful.  It's next to the bull ring, 2 minutes from the buzzing port area and maybe a 15 walk through the trees to the shops at Calle Larios. 10 more minutes walk and you'll be at El Corte Ingles. For what we wanted, it was spot on.

title: Excellent Value
review: I booked this hotel following extensive research of all the possible choices in and around the old town area and, having just completed a five night stay, I can confidently say that, for the price, MS Maestranza simply cannot be beaten. The majority of reviewers tend to focus their compliments on the hotel's location, which is excellent - close to Gibralfaro, Alcazabar, the harbour, the beach and the old town. We also found the staff to be most helpful, friendly and courteous. Our room on floor 9 at the front of the hotel had magnificent views and the breakfast also exceeded our expectations. We would have no hesitation in recommending a stay here.

title: can't knock it
review: Good hotel in a great location a short walk from everything,the old town,the harbour the beach cracking restaurants within a stones throw,good views at the front with the sea to the left and harbour straight on and old town and castle to the right,out the back you have the bullring,good sized rooms nice and clean lovely bar pleasant staff.

title: All round Excellent
review: Really cannot fault this hotel, good central location,staff really friendly, good food. Very clean. A little bit of traffic noise but with closed double glazed windows, no problem, we slept well.Attractive roof top terrce.

title: Clean and great location ....will use this hotel in the future
review: Easy access to the beaches, old town and the refurbished sea front area. The hotel was reasonably priced, clean  and comfortable. There is 24hr public parking very close by (24 hours approx. 23 euro). Will be coming back here!

title: Average Hotel but a great location
review: A nice thing is that the hotel has a balcony for each room. Rooms are average however location is fantastic with easy walking distance to City Centre as well as the new harbour area. One should not choose the hotel for the spa or roof terrace because its not great. I can recommend this hotel for anybody looking for a great Malaga City trip

title: Ideal hotel for a city break in a great city
review: We had a 4 night break stay for our first visit to Malaga. Malaga is a lovely city and I would highly recommend it for a city break by the sea. As a general rule, we like modern hotels, and whilst this wasn't very modern, it was great. The location is perfect, next to the new marina development and beach, with a pretty walk into the historic centre. Having a little balcony was ideal. The roof terrace offers nice views. We took the airport bus number A from and back to the airport in about 40 mins each way, the last stop is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel as plenty of options locally. Really good price to quality ratio here, we'll stay here again next time.

title: Excellent stay at Hotel Maestranza
review: For ease of access to Malaga Old Town and transport from and to the airport Hotel Maestranza could not be better. Room was kept beautifully clean and being at rear of hotel had great view to the Plaza del Torros. On B&B stay and couldn't fault it. Book now!

title: Malaga Break
review: Nice Hotel, spotlessly clean with helpful staff. Room was good sized and well laid out, balcony was quite small but more than adequate. We elected to take room at back overlooking bullring which was nice and quiet, I would imagine rooms to the front would be noisy. Did not eat at the hotel as there are so many nice places nearby. The harbour development is superb and there are lovely walks to the town centre. We took a cab from the airport which cost 20 euros. There are 2 Sol supermarkets nearby for juice and milk, we took our own kettle etc as they are not provided in the room which is a shame. Wi Fi can be hit and miss but when connected we got a good connection.

title: Great location
review: We visited this hotel in October for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a bit dated, however the location is perfect for exploring Malaga. We stayed room only and enjoyed breakfast at the cafe to the right of the hotel entrance for 12€ for two people.  If you are lucky you will get a room overlooking the bullring, which we had.   I would definitely recommend.

title: Short malaga break
review: Lovely hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were a good size and had everything you could want. The bed was massive, I personally felt it was a bit too firm for me. Our room over looked the bullring which looks quit awesome. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard daily with fresh bedding and towels. There is a safety deposit box in the room too which is good. There is a lovely roof top terrace with sun beds and parasols, the only down side of the sun beds is that they have metal arms which become very hot in the sun !! The hotel is ideally situated minutes away from the marina with many bars and restaurants and minutes away from the beach, the old town is a short pleasant walk away taking about 5-10 minutes only. I would definitely return to this hotel

title: Fabulous hotel, great location
review: Lovely hotel, we had a superior room which overlooked the bullring, even saw then practising in the early evening.  Room was spacious , as was the bathroom. Had everything we needed, TV, aircon , mini bar, large bed, perfect. Breakfast was ok, nothing fantastic. The location was brilliant, nearby bus stop for the tour bus, and walking distance to most things.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: This Hotel is close to everything
review: The Hotel is close to everything talk about perfect location. It is not a 5 stars Hotel but the service is like it was. They help with the luggage and even parked my car for me and brought back when I left. The girl at the front desk Regina Pena was a doll what a breath of fresh air and gracious in top. I recommend this hotel no flares just a great quality hotel in a very good location even close to the beach.

title: Location
review: We had a spacious room with a balcony which had views of the port and the citadel. The breakfast was good but after a few days we deserted it to eat at La Galopain. We had orange juice, coffee and enormous almond pastries for €11 for 2. We loved the location of this hotel. It is very close to the beach and only 10 minutes walk to the centre. We could walk in next to the harbour, or through a shady park, or through a scented rose garden.

title: Out of Season Perfect
review: This functional hotel is well situated in the Old Town just behind the bull ring and close to the beach.  A short bus ride to the city centre makes it an excellent venue out of season.  Breakfast slightly expensive but a very good cafe next door as an alternative I have no complaints.  I would certainly go back.

title: value for money hotel in a fantastic location.
review: Staff really friendly and helpful. Our family room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was a little tired though and could do with a refurbishment.  Breakfast was varied and plentiful. The location was fantastic. Just minutes from the beach and the beautiful harbour area and only 5 minute walk through the tropical gardens to reach the beating heart of this fantastic city. We have all fallen in love with Malaga and will definitely return. So much to see and do with numerous excellent bars, restaurants and fantastic shops. Grab an ice cream from Conico (either in town or on the harbour promenade .....you won't regret it. In summary the hotel gets a 7/10 for great location and value for money. Don't expect luxury. It is functional tourist hotel. The icing on the cake is the sun…

title: We loved this hotel!
review: We loved this hotel, great staff, Perfect location! Pizza Pino a pizzarestaurant Down the road has the best pizza ;) You can walk to the city, not far. The area around is so pretty, with small private bars, pretty parks and so on. Cool that you can see the bullfighting area (no show while we weere there,luckily!) Recomend to sunbathe on the roof, take a bubble bath and relax...

title: Friendly and helpful staff in a perfect location.
review: Stayed 4 nights in this hotel in September. Requested a room on a high floor and got a room on the top floor which was perfect. The hotel room was clean and comfortable with an amazing view of the port and a small balcony. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was situated a few minutes walk from the beach and the port and took about 10 min to walk into the city centre. Will stay in this hotel again for my next visit and highly recommend this to other travellers staying in Malaga.

title: get a superior room
review: Very good hotel in a great location . Although the road in front of hotel is very busy the soundproofing is good. Request a higher floor if you dont want road view then rooms at back of hotel look on or into the bull ring . Hotel has rooms on 12 floors and on 13th floor / rooftop there is a Jacuzzi and sunbeds . We were only on rooftop once and good area if not too busy. We had a room that had been described as a suite but I would say its a superior/ larger room. .If you turn left when you leave hotel and walk down this road you will reach the beach 8 euros for 2 sunbeds for the day , toilets , bars , drinks etc all available.  If you cross the road in front of hotel and walk to the right you will be at the port/marina area which has a lot of cafes/ restaurants/ bars and shops .…

title: excellent location
review: 3 days in central Malaga are not enough! It is a lovely city with so much to do. The hotel was very comfortable with very good service. If arriving by car it's a bit difficult to find but valet parking on arrival was very useful. We shall return.

title: Good location and friendly staff
review: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a week at the end of August. I chose the hotel for its location, its close proximity to bus stop to and from the airport, and the fact that it has sunbathing facilities on the roof (13th floor). We did not select the breakfast option as it was too expensive and the tripadvisor reviews related to breakfast were poor. We did not use the bar or restaurant facilities as there is an ample supply of these in Malaga with much more buzz. There is an excellent coffee shop on the ground floor run by French people that does good coffee and wide range of croissants, danish pasteries, and cooked food. The coffee shop is not related to the hotel. We had an good balcony with a great view of the Alcazaba and the Castle but had to move the room 'furniture'…

title: Nice hotel, good location, crappy spa
review: Nice hotel. Great location. However we booked this particular hotel because of the spa and all I can say is they were being generous by saying they have a spa. There is a jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. The jacuzzi is fine... cold water, which was nice as it was so hot when we were there.. cant imagine it being nice in winter though! The steam room ceiling was a yellow plastic that had cracks and even some holes in it. I couldnt stay in there. The sauna was tiny, maybe 1 metres by 2 metres if that. As I said, the hotel is fine but don't choose it for the spa!

title: very good hotel
review: Very handy for everything so central. Good breakfast.Great views. This is third stay never disappointed.very handy for airport bus and only 3 euro to airport.You can walk to so many places for hotel. Rooms very clean and room 505 had a huge very comfortable bed. Air conditioning very essential in August. Can't comment on roof top pool as did not use it.Staff very helpful and check in very easy. Did tour bus and got on at bull ring

title: MS MAESTRANZA
review: Excellent location Extremely helpful and friendly staff High level of cleanliness Breakfast good Would highly recommend this hotel-we are return visitors and are already planning our next trip to this hotel

title: OK for a very short stay only
review: Albeit the location is good if you want to be close to Malagueta beach, this hotel does not live up to grand expectations. Beds are hard, small lobby area, toilets are clean, warm water showers and industrial machine coffees. When we visited in early June, the rooftop pool was only open and accessible from 4:30 pm to 8:30 pm. That seemed odd. The walk to get to the historic center was around 15-20 minutes. Overall, it was good for a quick weekend get away since I live in Spain and the staff is friendly.

title: A base in Malaga in the Alcazaba's shadow
review: The Maestranza is conveniently located on the Malaga waterfront, a short bus ride from the coach and train stations and in easy walking range of the Alcazaba, Cathedral area and Picasso Museum. The roof-deck of the hotel offers great views directly into the bull-ring, an impressive arena, whatever your opinions on bullfighting might be.  We asked for a quiet room, and the windows and balcony door are thick and insulated against the traffic noise from the busy streets below. Not so great is that the uncarpeted wooden floorboards in the rooms convey every sound of furniture being moved or shoes walking to the occupants below. We were unfortunate enough to be located underneath people who moved their furniture and walk around until late at night.  Wi-fi is free but not always…

title: good hotel with wheelchair accessibility problem
review: We stayed 5 nights in this conveniently located hotel.  The staff was very helpful. Rooms clean. However, it is advertised as handicapped accessible which it is not.  There is access to the loby but the elevator very small with is extremely narrow narrow door.  An average size wheelchair cannot fit into it.  There is no alternative and no rooms on the ground floor.

title: Excellent in so many ways!
review: My daughter and I booked this hotel for only 4 nights and about an hour ago I extended it for 2 more nights. Hopefully we'll be in the same room.    As we walked in the hotel on July 18th, a very pleasant gentleman took care of us by name Perdo. Thank you for the excellent costumer service and understanding you provided to us!  We are also pleased with Maria's patience and care, thank you for having her on your team as well!   Our room is on the 9th floor and we love how clean the room is, the size of it, the view, the balcony, after we brought out the chairs and the small table, it's nice to sit there once we turn the room's air conditioning off. We don't like the alarms going off without any problems, in the middle of the night, mornings and day time.  When we need alarms,  we…

title: Lovely Room
review: My review is based mainly on the room I had as I didn't use any other facilities in the hotel. There is no grand entrance to the hotel but it is conveniently located near the beach and main promenade. The room was great and what I would expect from a four star. Very spacious, clean and well equipped with a nice big en suite. There was also a balcony which was nice to step outside as we were on a high floor.

title: Top hotel, Great location
review: Just back from screen night's in Malaga. Great city. This is a good hotel, we had a room on 12th floor overlooking the Bull ring. There is some street noise but nothing that's unexpected for a city hotel. Hotel is in a perfect location for exploring the old city and visiting the beach. If we return to Malaga I will be using this hotel again.

title: Great base for a city break - with beach thrown in!
review: 4 night break at this hotel was excellent.  Airport bus dropped us right outside - no taxi required.  Very central and such an easy walk to both town centre and beach - which is a good as any beach along this coast.   Room was exactly what we asked for - high floor with evening sun on balcony. Room 1101. We had a building in front but a side view of the mountains and cathedral and the balcony was just big enough to sit on. Clean and comfortable, bathrobes and slippers. ( superior room) Breakfast fine, the Serrano ham was sliced a little too thickly for me.  Service was good.  Did not dine at the hotel and the bar was deserted when we called for a drink on arrival.  Lots of places to eat and drink close by. Views from the rooftop terrace are spectacular - and into the bullring…

title: Lovely Hotel in a Perfect Location
review: I have just returned from 5 nights at the MS Maestranza in Malaga and thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. The room was very clean and quite spacious, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom facilities good.   I had a room at the back overlooking the bull ring and as a result the room was constantly in the shade which was nice during the current high temperatures in southern Spain (I asked for a mountain view).   Previous reviews have commented on the lack of service found at breakfast, this is not something I experienced, I went to breakfast at different times each day and each time found a table to sit at and plenty of choice in the food on offer.   The location of the hotel is excellent, it is close to both the beach and the city, its about a 10 minute walk to the city which…

title: Super Location
review: Two night stay at this hotel.  We were on level 9 at the front of the hotel and heard very little road noise.  Big, comfortable bed with nice bedding.  The whole hotel was spotlessly clean.  Rooftop terrace could be spruced up a little to make it more inviting but the views from up there were amazing.  The beauty of this hotel is its location - an easy walk to the beach, bars and restaurants.  Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food.

title: Fab location
review: This hotel is the best for location just 10 minutes walk to beach and 15 minutes walk to to the centre and shops loads of good restaurants on the beach at the port and in the centre  Breakfast is good rooms good standard.  Staff friendly

title: Disappointed
review: My husband and I stayed here for a week. Although a good location the hotel was disappointing. The room was clean and quite spacious however compared to other 4 star hotels it failed to impress. 1. No balcony furniture . 2. After taking indoor chairs out onto balcony we had to endure sitting next to air con unit which blew hot air . 3. Toiletries were pretty poor. 4. No tea and coffee making facilities in room. We persuaded reception to give us a kettle ( small deposit charged to room) suggested we got cups from the dining room, two days later the maid took the cups away and didn't replace them. 5. Roof top terrace very small with no bar. 6. Although booked double room, in good Spanish fashion we had twin beds pushed together, not a problem, however the bedding was also for twin…

title: Disappointing
review: Having read the reviews for this hotel we were expecting better. The room was on the 9th floor overlooking the bull ring at the back of the hotel so was quiet as we heard no noise from the busy road. The room was quite small and the decor was a bit tired and the bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom was compact but clean although there was an unpleasant smell which lingered in it. We were only staying for 1 night so we put up with it. The restaurant in which breakfast was served was pleasant with nice decor and breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The location was great as it was within walking distance of the beach, marina and alcazar. There's plenty to see in Malaga and we'll visit again but we'll not be staying at this hotel

title: Thanks for the memories
review: Pleasantly surprised for a hotel close to a busy road. Some traffic noise to be expected but that apart enjoyed wonderful food - especially dinner- good service, comfortable room ( top floor), gym and roof top terrace ( shame part of it closed off for refurb). Ideal location and plenty to see in the area.

title: Great location
review: Excellent location, about 10 min walk Ito old town via tree lined park , 2 mins to beach and port.  Lovely big room on 10th floor overlooking bull ring.  Very comfortable big bed.  Probably needs sprucing up in terms of decoration but still very nice.  Not much going on in the bar/restaurant area.  Would suggest having breakfast out at nearby cafe/bars at very cheap prices .  Overall I would thoroughly recommend this hotel

title: It's all about location
review: Lovely clean hotel equi-distant between beach and city centre. I was on 12th floor facing the busy road and at times could hear the traffic but if you are thinking about booking this hotel don't let this fact stop you. Across the road was the marina and behind was the bull ring and alcazar. Short walk into town to loads of shops, restaurants etc. booked a package deal for 11 nights and got Half board for £20 over and above the b&b price. Choice of three meals each night and I would describe cooking as an Andalusian interpretation of familiar  recipes, there was usually a fish, chicken/pork or oxtail main course and the food was tasty and well cooked. We ate out a couple of times but didn't get anything anymore impressive. That of course may mean that we did not choose the…

title: MS Maestranza
review: I found this hotel in an excellent location close to the Marina, Beach and Centro. What I didn't like was the rooms were very small but I must say it was comfortable and clean. Anyone staying should avoid the breakfast whilst it was very nice I think 28 euro for 2 people was very expensive as I only had cheese and coffee it was still 14euro per person.

title: City and beach
review: This pleasant hotel lies close to the city of Málaga and is not far from the beach. Food is good. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Walks into the city are very pleasant, through huge palmtree-parks. The view on the harbour is very nice. Beach is at apr. 300 mtrs. from hotel. Málaga is a great city to visit !

title: Excellent location!!
review: Great hotel, great location, short walk to centre of the city en only 5 minute walk to the beach. We didn't take the breakfast in the hotel but went to the place under the hotel, very friendly people!

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed for the weekend for a friend's wedding.  The hotel was perfectly placed, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the whole place was spotless.  We had a fantastic room on the top floor with a view round from the port via the castle to the bullring.  We would definitely stay here again next time we visit Malaga centre.

title: Fantastic hotel in Malaga
review: I read all reviews on hotels in central Malaga and the maestranza hotel came out top  It has the best location for the old town,beach ,port ,castle &shops it is situated in Plaza de Toro  A truly lovely area with Palm trees and fountains. The hotel it self is lovely we stayed on the sixth floor with great views and after a day of walking round the old town we relaxed in the rooftop jacuzzi  which was open from 4pm-8pm.  We  finish after a nite out in the bar at the hotel. Where Manuel (the friendly bar man)served our  Liqueurs&coffees.  Also perfect for bus routes as they stop over the road from the hotel even the airport bus

title: fab location and hotel, but was building work outside my balcony!
review: Fab location,  nice room and balcony (unable to use balcony as much as liked due to building work outside my balcony) reported debris left on balcony ,!  BUT on a positive I WOULD return to this hotel (hopefully the building work will be finished!) Location is excellent,  the cafe next door did a lovely breakfast spoke good English,  The marina is excellent to have a bite to eat for any budget only a few minutes walk away .

title: Good location in Malaga
review: We have stayed in Malaga on previous occasions and chose this hotel because of its location.  It is a short (less than 5 minutes) walk to the beach.  Also a short walk to the port and its restaurants.  It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the main shopping street. We had booked a junior suite which was comfortable and the bathroom had a lovely spa bath with shower over and also a separate shower cubicle.  The shower was powerful and plenty of hot water (although the spa bath was faulty we did not bother to report it).  We asked for a room on a higher floor as suggested in other TA reviews and the city sounds were greatly reduced.  We cannot comment on the food as we did not eat here.  The roof terrace was small and even smaller on this visit as part of it was closed due to some…

title: lovely hotel at a great location
review: lovely hotel with a great location. view at either side is good, either overlooking the bullring and castle or part of the sea/bay. rooms are small but comfy, very well sound-proofed, even next to the lift there is no noise at all and can't hear the toilet/shower. the only noise would be from the traffic if you are on the street side but not really disturbingly noisy. restaurant was so-so but no problem as lots of eateries in the neighborhood and an excellent 'Galopain' café downstairs. definitely recommend to stay here, not too far for a lovely walk to the lovely ciudad.

title: Just what you want, (with a couple of SMALL snags)
review: We moved to this hotel after one night of somewhere else that was awful, so this place seemed A LOT better! It is dated, but functional, clean and has a safe. Very friendly staff, great location near beach and city centre. Only two downsides: the shower temp wasn't consistent, it fluctuated every now and then to cooler then hotter. Also the breakfast was very expensive for what it was, so we only went there once.

title: Small room good location
review: We stayed on the 9th floor and had a great view or La Plaza de Toros. Although it was Superior it was very small with the two twin beds pushed together occupying most of the space. The service was good as was the breakfast. Parking is e15+ per day. A solid 4 star hotel in a good location.

title: Great hotel,Great location with friendly staff
review: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night break at the hotel MS Maestranza and after reading previous reviews was not disappointed. For us when choosing a hotel one of the key factors is the location and this hotel was perfect. From Malaga airport get bus "A" and get off at the last stop where you will find the hotel just a couple of minutes away. From the hotel Malagueta beach, the marina and the old town are within a few minutes walk.   On arrival even though the fact that we was early the receptionist found us a room on the 12th floor. The room was really nice and clean with a mini bar, air conditioning and free Wi-Fi. ( and it works ) The view from the balcony was amazing with views of the Alcazaba and Gibralfaro castle. We also had a partial view of the marina and…

title: Good location
review: Stayed here last week, the hotel is in a nice location near the harbour and beach with a sun terrace on the roof overlooking the Gibralfaro Castle. Room was clean and functional with air conditioning and mini bar. Short walk to town centre through nice gardens

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review: We recently spent five nights at this hotel, the location is excellent, a very short walk to the harbour with it's restauarants, shops and the newly opened Pompidou Centre which has many interesting exhibits. It is also a pleasant (short) walk to the older part of Malaga with the Picasso Museum, Picasso Birthplace, beautiful Cathedral and main shopping area which is also teaming with Cafes and Restaurants all very reasonably priced.   The hotel itself is very clean, our room on the 7th floor had twin beds, a spa bath, a small separate seating area and a balcony which had views to the sea at one side and the old Castle and cathedral to the other. There are no tea or coffee maing facilities in the room but the hotel loaned us a kettle for a small deposit which was fully refunded…

title: Highly satisfactory
review: I come to Malaga for embarking a cruise and there is no better choice. The cruise terminal is of walking distance (small ship, even big ship it is walkable to the terminal) and the airport bus No A terminates just opposite the hotel. Historical sights and monuments, also night-life are all within walking distance. The port area is great for handicraft shopping and night-life dining. The hotel is adjacent to the bull ring and some rooms have balcony to have a bird's eye view of a bull fight if it is on, free. Other rooms may have incredible port and castle sight. If not on high floor there is a good roof top terrace adjacent to health centre. Rooms are of good size, nicely done with Picasso reproductions. House keeping is very good and reception service excellent. As price is…

title: Well Situated Excellent Hotel
review: Hotel is sited next to the bullring (more a museum) and close to the marina with its restaurants and shops. Also short walk to the seafront with its long promenade and sandy beach. It is a 10/15min. leisurely stroll to the Cathedral and the city centre. Stayed in Malaga last year for first time and found it a revelation. New marina, lots of restaurants and now some new museums e.g. Pomidou museum beside the marina.  As previously mentioned in reviews the outside of the hotel is being renovated, so approaching the front of the hotel the view is of balconies with temporary 'facings', steel cables supporting workmens cradles and a little scaffolding. However inside everything is unaffected. We certainly didn't experience any noise during our stay of 5 nights, although it coincided…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Excelent hotel in a fantastic location 2 minute from the new seafront and 10minutes flat walk to the old town. We stayed in a room overlooking the bullring....do go in there for tapas. Very friendly helpful staff and fantastic breakfast buffet.

title: Location,location,location + friendliness
review: Stayed here for a week from Mar 6th....our 50th Wedding Anniversary and a birthday....so hoping and expecting a good week. Staff were very pleasant,friendly and helpful...asked at Reception if possible to get a high floor....eureka...on the 10th overlooking the Bullring and looking up at Castle...really good...and quieter than front rooms & lower floors I believe.. We had breakfast first 2 days in Hotel...then dinner....but as we were very near walking distance to Marina and Old Town and also a wee gem of a place for breakfast " Galopain de Paris" immediately to right of Hotel entrance which is run by friendly French ( English speaking) couple...we enjoyed the busy 'local' atmosphere .. and the food prices were  lower than hotel ,although not the main reason.(.we just wanted to…

title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location
review: We have stayed at MS Maestranza a couple of times now.  It is a lovely hotel, incredibly clean and the staff are very warm and welcoming.  The rooms are a nice size, and the bathrooms well equipped.  Our rooms have had balconies, and you can either see up towards Malaga centre and the Alcazaba, or have a view over the beautiful bullring.  Location wise it is situated in La Malagueta, one of the nicest parts of Malaga.  Tere are loads of great restaurants to chose from, and the recently overhauled port area has restaurants and shops.  We will be back next year!

title: Walking city/harbour break
review: We stayed at the MS Maestranza for 4 nights and found the Hotel ideally situated within Malaga. Juan welcomed us at reception speaking very good English and when we requested an ‘alta habitacion’ (high floor) offered us a ‘front/back/side/high/low’ ??? room. Being out of season this would not be likely at any other time. At this time the Hotel is going through a major refurb so the front of the hotel was covered in dust limiting mesh. Noise and activity is kept to a minimum. And as the front faces a very busy street and intersection we decided on the rear of the hotel. To our delight we were offered the 10th. floor facing the 11th. Century Alcazaba (citadel) and the Castillo de Gilbralfaro. Throw in an aerial view of the Plaza de Toros (bullring) and you get the picture. The…

title: Would return
review: stayed with my husband end of February it was our first visit to Malaga and were very pleased with our choice of hotel.it was very well situated for walking into the historic centre and other sites. The hotel staff were all very warm and welcoming the hotel was very clean, we booked half board breakfast was buffet and plenty of choice, dinner was three course and you chose what you wanted from the menu for half board food very enjoyable.the wifi is not a brilliant connection. Also the hotel is having work done at the moment but this did not spoil our stay.

title: A good choice, but do you need WiFi?
review: This hotel is a favourite of mine, and the "A" bus route from the airport at 3 euros finishes its route within 2 minutes walk from the hotel, which lies very close to the seafront. The staff are excellent, and the buffet breakfast makes for a great start to the day. The only problem is the free WiFi, which requires the input of a 14 digit alphanumeric code which needs to be constantly re-entered every few minutes, or when one returns to one's device after pausing for a short period. I found while in the town that I could use a restaurant's WiFi simply by entering my name, so why is a long code needed at all? And why does it have to be entered over and over again? All in all, I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: 4 stars in their dreams
review: We stayed with a child and a baby, room size was ok but definitely not enough for 4 people. Hotel was old and not well kept at all both externally and internally including the rooms which haven't been refurbished for good 25-30years. No reason for this hotel to be awarded 4stars, and definitely does not justify the price they are charging for the staying. Position is ok, not central but it's about 15minute walk away, close by there's the new harbour with bars and super turistic restaurants to be avoided if you don't have kids and can walk into town.

title: Very Friendly
review: Stayed here in February for 4 nights read all of the reviews and totally agree that the hotel is spotlessly clean,the staff are really friendly and helpful.Our rooms were cleaned daily to a high standard.Manuel the bartender was very helpful and pleasant bringing little snacks to our table when he served our drinks which were very well priced.the hotel is situated in a very good location for the city, marina and the beach.A walk along the beach front brings you to some beautiful little villages and Malaga city has plenty of bars and restaurants with not one picture of English fish and chips or full English breakfast.Our room 705 was a bit noisy from the traffic outside but the hotel cannot be blamed for this as the room is double glazed.Will definitley go back!

title: Will definitely go back again.
review: Pros: Great location. Nice clean rooms. Upper floors have good views. Nice breakfast. Helpful staff.  Cons: Midst of renovation,  some disturbance caused which may be temporary. The sauna, jacuzzi and health club in bad shape.

title: great service, superclean and quiet rooms, perfect location for a citytrip
review: We had a room at the 10th floor heading to the backside viewing the arena and the castle. it was super quiet at night, so we could sleep with open windows till 9am :-) breakfast ist good (7h30 - 11h) and you get everything from fruits, eggs (omelette, sunny side up, hard boiled, scrambled), different kind of bread and cake. service is great - stuff is superfriendly and helpful, checkin befor 2pm was also not a problem. room is VERY clean, the floor was wet wiped every day! free WIFI is great, reception in every corner of the hotel with about 5Mb/s. all in all a great hotel to stay and explore Malaga, the harbour with restaurants is just a 5mins walk away, the center in about 10mins.

title: Great Location & Great Value
review: This hotel is ideally located between La Playa Malagueta/Marina and the Alcazaba/Cathedral de Malaga/Castle Gibralfaro, as well as numerous restaurants and shopping in the old city.  The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and at least one of the front desk receptionists spoke English.  Although the room decor was a little 'tired', the rooms were spotless and very comfortable.  The bathroom was very modern, clean and had a complete amenities kit that was better than some 5 Star hotels I've stayed in.  Breakfast was 14 euros, and had a wide selection of both traditional Spanish and British/American dishes.  The fresh fruit was delicious.  I really enjoyed my stay at the Maestranza and would definitely stay there on a return trip to beautiful Malaga.

title: Good modern Hotel
review: High rise hotel, yards from the Marina/Port complex. Car parking available in a public underground car park behind the hotel for a reduced price. The hotel overlooks the bullring and from the terrace on the top floor you would get a good view of the event if you're into that sort of thing. Alternatively, a walk to the top of the nearby hill gives good views of the city. Rooms are clean, and a good size, but the front lower floors suffer from traffic noise.

title: Good Location, Great View
review: We stayed in a room on the 11th floor, and had a balcony that faced the city, the beach, and the marina.  It was outstanding and we had no complaints about the room at all. The balcony is large but has no chairs on it, we just brought the ones from inside the room out. There is a free "hot (it was warm)" tub, sauna, and steam room on the 12th floor as well as a terrace that overlooks the city and the bullring.  The only downside was that we took a bottle of wine up to the hot tub, the lady told us we couldn't have it and she put it on the counter next to the desk. My wife and I went into the sauna and the lady went to give a massage.  While we were in there, we saw the reflection of a man walk in, look around, grab something and run.  I got up and went out to check, and our…

title: So Good for visiting Malaga
review: This hotel is ideal for a few days break visiting Malaga.  The staff are very helpful and friendly - the rooms modern and spotlessly clean. The bed felt a bit firm but I slept like a log !  Great location, we looked out over the Marina and the beautiful Gardens. It's a lovely 10 minute walk into the city centre where there are so many places to eat and drink it'd take you months to try them all ! Best tip I can give is get the A75 bus - airport express to and from the airport. It stops just 2 minutes from the hotel on the boulevard. They are every 20 mins - cost 3 euros each ! Takes about 30 mins.  Will definitely use this hotel again.

title: perfect location, if you make a bargain
review: First of all i have to say, i made a great bargain via expedia for this hotel. So i don't want want to complain about what was right and what was not right, because the main complaints are already written down here. And i knew before i've booked this hotel, that this hotel is undergoing some major renovation and for the price i've paid i probably i wouldn't get a renovated room. So here just the facts about my room: clean (daily), but dusty, the bathroomfitting loosing parts, the cans in the minibar were rusty because of some liquid (i guess it was a leaking juicebottle) was on the bottom of the minibar, the wifi was slow or to say not usable, the window wasn't closing tight, so you have to use earplugs to get some sleep and noise because of the renovationwork during the day.…

title: Lovely stay in malaga
review: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel staff are friendly and helpful ,nice rooms and more than adequate buffet breakfast.beautiful views of harbour and gardens towards Malaga centre.Easy walking distance through beautiful gardens to city centre wheregood restaurants locally.

title: malaga stay
review: just returned from an excellent six day half board stay at the Maestranza. The room on the eleventh floor could not have been better with outstanding views from our balcony, the room itself was well appointed with a good en-suit power shower and deep bath .Breakfast could not have been better with everything you could wish for available, dinner again was off an excellent standard, the waiter service was excellent and the young man obviously enjoys his job .The only downside to the hotel is the small gyms equipment which is old and needs replaced. The treadmill is dangerous in that the emergency wire falls off whilst you are running and the belt immediately stops, if you are running quickly you could give yourself a serious injury, I did report this twice but nothing was done,…

title: best hotel
review: we stayed 1 night at the Maestranza this January whilst visiting Malaga for a Birthday, stayed in a Superior room on the 11th floor with great views of the Port and City. The rooms are big and spacious with large king size beds and good quality bed linen. The bathroom sported a hydro massage bath and a large separate shower, his and hers washbasins and quality towels and bathrobes. The staff were friendly and helpful and parking for our car was 15€ per night incl valet parking. The situation is ideal for restaurants etc and if you need a taxi,. the taxi rank is just outside at the back of the hotel.We didn't eat in the hotel, lots of places nearby do breakfast, we went to Cafeteria Galopain underneath the hotel. Our only criticism's are very minor, the Spa bath and Sauna were…

title: Excellent location for tourism! Excellent Spa facilities
review: We decided to stay in the Ms Maestranza for a short holiday this January and we loved it. It is next to the bullring, the habour and the malagueta beach. It has habour views and views of the alcazaba. The spa facilties are excellent on the top floor, after a tiring day of site seeing its perfect to relax.  My only criticism is that we enjoyed half board but the food on the menu is very very spanish. One night we had a choice between, bull's tail, trout or mackrel and these aren't obvious choices for most travellers (particularly from the uk) I think they would really benefit from adding more choices that are universal, like a pasta option each night or perhaps a small buffet.   A tip would be to have a high floor as the traffic can be quite loud.  Other than this it was very…

title: Great location and perfect for the beach!
review: We Stayed here for 3 nights.... On the 9th floor. Whilst the balcony was a tad narrow, the views of the port, palace and beach were great! Staff very friendly and all in all a great alternative location to the town centre. We normally stay in the Palacio but for a different view...... Well worth the change! (Breakfasts vastly over priced so a walk into the town and to "Cheers" fixed that!)

title: Great Hotel and Great Location
review: We booked this hotel after a New Year in Benalmedena and fancied a few days in Malaga before flying home. As mentioned in previous reviews the location is second to none, right beside the harbour and a 5 minute walk into the City Centre. We found all the staff to be very friendly especially at reception. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice suit all tastes - cava included !  Our room was prefect for a few nights away but could have done with tea/coffee making facility. Malaga is a fantastic city and we ate in El Pimpi on our last night and would recommend it, very busy but staff are helpful and the choices of tapas and meals are good and prices reasonable.

title: Perfect location
review: Recently returned from our 2nd visit to this hotel  It's ideal for short trips to Malaga the location is perfect 2 mins walk to the marina and same to the beach where you will find some delightful fish Restraunts where you can chill in the winter sun eating fresh fish and sangria very cheaply  A ten minute walk from the hotel will take you into the plazas and the old town where there are over 200 places to eat from breakfast to midnight and entry of shops The hotel itself is well positioned for all of this including the historical parts of the city No swimming pool but a large jacuzzi on the top floor with sauna etc etc Bit expensive in the bar and Restraunt but no need to eat in when there is such plentiful choice on the doorstep Easy access to from the airport bus will take…

title: excellent hotel in a wonderful location
review: This hotel is strongly recommended not only because of its location but also its hospitality. As mentioned by other reviewes the furniture is dated, but the rooms are exceptionally clean and so are the bathrooms. The cleaners do an excellent job on a daily basis. The other stong point of the hotel is its location. All the major attractions - the castle of Gibralfaro, the Alcazaba, the port and the promenade - are all within a 5 minute walk from the hotel In fact the steep path to the castle starts just outside the hotel. And the views from the hotel are breathtaking. The town centre is a 8 minute walk along some beautifully paved roads with gardens and trees on either side. The beakfast is excellent with wnderful fresh fruits. The bus from the airport stops just outside the…

title: Very convenient for the port
review: Clean, comfortable, and very convenient for the cruise terminal. It's also an easy walk along the side of the port to various restaurants, and an easy walk in the other direction to get to the old fort (Alzabar) that stretches along the ridge of the hill, giving you superb views over Malaga. Was able to walk from the hotel with our luggage to our cruise boarding area.

title: Made our trip
review: We stayed here for 5 nights in December. The hotel is in the best location in Málaga, short walking distance to the port, the main monuments and the beach. Approximately 5 minutes walk from the airport bus route which was only 3€ per person.  Room 606 had great views of the Alcazaba and the Castillo de Gibralfaro, it was really clean and had all the facilities needed. The bathroom was well maintained and very spacious. The hotel in general was very clean and always smelled great.  Staff were helpful and friendly and gave us a tourist map with the main attractions on arrival. The wifi was free which was great although it dropped out a few times.  The bar/restaurant can be very quiet maybe because of the amount of restaurants around that area. We had breakfast in the cafeteria…

title: Great Location in  a very busy area
review: We stayed last weekend on 7 floor room 705  with a great view on the port ,sea view ,and good view of the castle or alcazaba and most of the city centre with corrida arenaJust Aside!Anyway Looking from balcony the view is great... The area is noisy  because the hotel is positioned right in one of the busiest roads in Malaga... But certainly we have slept very well and  a city break on a very modern city and full of life we have considered  very noisy late night ! Good standards of customer service and cleanliness.. Overall 8 out of 10... Well recommended good value for money and certainly we will go back if we are staying again in Malaga...

title: Very good
review: Great location near to the beach and the city center. Staff friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was good. Room on 6th floor;  noisy street. Bathroom could be cleaner. View on the harbour. Restaurant empty in the evening.

title: Great view of bullring, rooftop spa and helpful staff
review: Stayed for a long weekend in November enjoying the 22C warmth compared to wet UK! Reception staff were very courteous and helpful -  checked in slightly early into a room on 9th floor overlooking the bullring - which is quite stunning to see both during the day and lit up at night.  Contrary to previous reviews, the spa is open on Sundays - and views across the port and old town. Hotel well located for reaching the beach and mule uno, as well as the old town , exploring Alcazaba / Gibralfro  making for a nice nice of culture and chilling out.... Sampled breakfast at the Gallopain next door to the hotel entrance - best almond croissant I have had, fresh orange juice and coffee for around 5€ .. would stay at HS Maestranza again - purely for its location - although I think I could…

title: Excellent location and value for money
review: Ideal location. Close walk to city centre. Bullring around the corner. Beach around the other. Marina alongside. Hop on hop off tour bus stops close by.  Walk up to the castle from the hotel is close by. For the ablebodied, but suggest a bus for trip down.  Drinks in minibar not a rip off. Nice balcony. Bed comfortable. staff courteous and helpful. Gym and roof top terrace. Spa was closed when we were there.  Big bonus - Taxi rank right outside 24 hours which was excellent for the early flight. Three taxis there at 4.30AM!!  But not noisy at night so dont worry about that.  Small bar on other side of bullring which does lovely toasted bread with tomato and garlic sauce.  would definitely stay again.

title: Pleasant stay
review: Enjoyed our extended weekend stay at this hotel; rooms generally well appointed with balcony and great views, staff courteous and helpful. Great location - comfortable walking either to shopping district, harbour or the beach/promenade. Only downside: A/C noise quite high; opening doors was not really an option due to street noise.

title: Great location
review: Just stayed one night but would happily have done more! Great location, room 605 overlooks harbour, cruise liners and the bull ring. Very clean, excellent toiletries including a razor etc. breakfast was lovely and staff all courteous. Spa and bar look great but we were too busy exploring to use them. Only slight downside was road noise, it's on a busy junction but we put the air con and the hum distracted from it. If you thought it would bother you you could ask for a room at the back. Lovely balcony and very comfy bed. 5 minute walk to harbour and old town. Parking in multi storey at discounted rate of 18 euros overnight so not cheap but convenient.

title: Great location
review: Superb location for beach, marina area and old town and only a few minutes walk from the airport bus stop. Friendly staff, good breakfast selection and times (7:30-11), very nice room and bathroom. Great views from room and spa area. Nice to be able to borrow beach towels and to leave our bags on the last day. Only downside was that we got a lot of traffic noise all night from our front facing (double aspect) room on the 3rd floor - maybe better higher up.

title: Still excelent
review: This was our second visit to the Maestranza hotel in a year and it was just as good as before. The location is excellent, near the Malagueta beach, Muelle Uno shops and restaurants, and only five minutes walk to the Cathedral and old town through the Paseo del Parque. The room was very comfortable with breathtaking views of the Alcazaba, Gibralfaro castle, bullring and the marina (particulalry superb at night) from the balcony. There are also superb views from the roof terrace. Very helpful staff are on hand to deal with any request and are very eager to please. This time we did not have breakfast at the hotel but took it at the patisserie next door (Galopain) which has the best croissants, pains au chocolat, etc this side of Paris.  Altogether a lovely break in sunny Malaga and…

title: So So
review: The location is good, easy to find at the end of route A from the airport. A 5 minute walk through a pleasant park to the Cathedral area which is a rabbit warren of bars, restaurants and cafes. Decent mini bar in the room, not stupidly expensive and well stocked. There is a little cafe down stairs and a small supermarket opposite.  I picked this hotel because of all the good reviews it received, however when I arrived I was a little disappointed with it. It was a little tired and worn out, the pictures certainly make it look nicer than it actually is. The room was a little small and again a little worn and there was black mold around the bath. All in all a bit of a let down.

title: Anniversary Celebration
review: We travelled to Malaga to celebrate our 21st Wedding Annivesary and selected Hotel MS Maestranza for its location especially the proximity to the beach and the easy walk into the Old Town. We weren't disappointed - our room was very comfortable with superb views over the city, part of the new marina and the bull ring. A perfect base for exploring the delights that Malaga has to offer. All the staff were very friendly & we would certainly pick this hotel again on a future trip. Easy to get to from the airport - Bus A stops within 2 mins walk & is only €3 pp.

title: Fabulous
review: This hotel has a marvellous location by a park , by the  quay walk ( with excellent shops and restaurants ) , by the bull ring and with fabulous views of the Castillo del Gibralfaro and the Alcazaba . Its about a 10-15 minute walk into the old town but you walk past some stunning buildings and sights . There is a taxi rank right outside the hotel ( on the bull ring side ) . For some reason though if you travel from the airport or the railway station this hotel does not seem to be well known by taxi drivers so either make sure you write down the address before hand or take one of the hotel business cards with you .  The hotel has a very small entrance on the non bull ring side of the hotel just up from a pedestrian crossing . Inside is a small reception area with stairs and two…

title: A little pricey, but no complaints
review: My girlfriend and I visited this hotel for two days, one night at $160 per night; we arrived about 4pm driving from Granada, and the parking lot is about a block away and was about $20 if I remember correctly.  We checked in and were given a 10th floor room facing away from the beach (which was a good thing, more later...).  The view of the beach is mostly blocked by another building, and you can only really see the shipyard anyway.  The hotel is clean, the room is enormous for a European room, and the bathroom is also very big.  The TV had a few English channels on it.  When we wanted to get beach towels, we just had to put a small deposit down with the front desk with little hassle.  The bar seemed like a nice place; we sat there for a little but ended up deciding we wanted…

title: The hotel is ok
review: Close to the beach and local shopping. Friendly staff. The hotel is ok, but nothing spescial. I'm really not as excited as other reviews. Breakfast is good and so is the rooms. Location could be better

title: Back again!!!
review: My partner George and I have been going to the MS Maestranza for six years (started with long weekends, then extended to a week, now doing a fortnight at a time!) and always find it a fantastic experience. The hotel is located centrally, is next door to the bullring and a short walk away from the beach and the new harbour area. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and the rooms are modern and immaculately clean. There is an excellent choice of cereals,  pastries fruit etc at breakfast.  We will be back next year!!  Jane Ferguson

title: MS Maestranza
review: A very good hotel for visiting central Malaga. Excellent location close to port, beach and city centre. Room was spacious and immaculately clean, front desk staff efficient and helpful.  No on site parking but hotel staff always on hand to park the car and recovery it when needed.

title: Great Stay
review: We stayed in March 2014 when our agents changed our booking from The Barcello. We enjoyed our stay here and booked again for a week. The hotel provides good value clean accomodation. OK it remains a bit tired but thats surface deep. The service is excellent and the situation as good as any, close to the port, beaches and City centre. We visited the Barcello out of interest but it looked busy with delegates and a lot less intimate. When we come again to Malaga we will return here to stay

title: Wonderful experience
review: Beautiful, large and modern room with balcony.  Our room faced the bull ring where it is much quieter and has an amazing view of the Cathedral and Alcabaza.  Staff was beyond helpful with info on bus connections in the area and anything you might need.  Location is great, near the beach and the old town area with many beautiful sites and many cafes and restaurants.

title: God location and view , but...
review: The hotel is well located between old town , the port and Malagueta beach ( max 10 min walk) . The airport bus station is right in front . The view from the superior floors is great , the Malaga Cathedral, Alcazaba and the port especially at night looks great . Room was large enough , clean , but in clear need for some refurbishing (the furniture is worn out). I guess 10 years ago looked great.The is some noise from outside in the night because there is heavy traffic until late hours and the sound insulation is not the best.  Also the facade need some makeover because i saw some fallen pieces.Staff was ok, good english , helpful. For me the view worth the money. I will come again any time , but with the proper refurbishing this could be an amazing hotel.

title: Good location, good accomodation
review: The hotel is well situated near the bull ring and two minutes walk from the beach and one minute from the harbour. A nice hotel very nice reception staff and cleaners, one criticism would be the breakfast where the female staff seemed  slow and not responsive, tables slow to be cleared and an indifferent attitude. The breakfast selection was also a little disappointing with little choice. However all in all a good hotel and we must comment on the reception staff especially the girl with the teeth braces ( sorry have forgotten her name) who was a delight and very, very helpful

title: Great Hotel/Location
review: We stayed here for 2 days. The location is close to the airport, main sites, and the beach. The rooms closely resemble American style hotel rooms. Pretty specious and clean. I would come back here if I was to return to the city. The staff very accommodating.

title: Girly weekends!
review: We stay here every October for a girly weekend. The hotel is always clean, the staff are friendly, rooms are lovely! Location excellent 5 mins to the beach, 5 mins to brand new marina, 10-15 mins to town centre! Looking forward to going again on 3rd October!

title: great location
review: Awesome hotel!  The location is perfect,  right between the beach and historic center,  walking distance to everything.  Really great views from the top.  Jacuzzi, sauna and top floor deck are great ways to relax after walking around all day.  Great rooms,  clean and large.

title: Idea location, lovely food and room.
review: This hotel is in the heart of Malaga, it's a walking distance from all sights. The staff are polite and friendly. The balcony doors can be tricky if you have small kids but a travel safety latch can fix that. The views of the bullring, the casa and the beach are picturesque. We had memorable family vacation and we would love to visit again.

title: nice hotel
review: We had stayed here for 2 nights. The location is central and the room was very nice. The hotel staff was very professional. The view from the upper floors and terrace was great! The small spa pool was constantly occupied by older men.

title: Great hotel and location
review: Stayed here for 5 nights in July on a break with my mum.  Hotel located in a really good part of town. Close to the beach, harbour and shops. Had the most amazing view of the bullring from our balcony, great to watch the young matadors in action with their pretend bulls!  Only had breakfast at the hotel but couldn't fault it.  Had a fantastic holiday, will be back to malaga and this hotel.

title: Good location to Malaga central and beach
review: Malaga central area is actually 10 min away from Maria Zambron train and bus station. This hotel is close to Malguetta beach and right next to Gibralfaro so walking to Calle Larios which is the main street full of bars, restaurants and ice cream parlors is also under 10 mins. The Port of Malaga is also around 10 min walk. The front desk staff was also helpful. The room is not as small as others I have seen in Europe. The hotel has a turkish bath and hot water jacuzzi on the 13 the floor with ridiculous views of Alcazaba and Gibralfaro as well as the city.

title: Good location near to beach and old town
review: This is the place to stay if you are going to follow bull fights. The hotel is located just next to bull fight stadium and only few hundred meters from beaches. The old town is roughly 1 km away and nice marina is just cross the street.  The basic level hotel which is relatively clean but worn out.  Some trafic noises can disturbing.   Spa services are available only after 16.30 pm. and "pool" on the roof is even smaller than it looks in pictures.

title: Great Location
review: Situated accross the road from the main marina this hotel is in a great location.  The hotel itself was pleasant and the staff very helpful.  The decor is becoming a little tired and my shower temperature fluctuated between bboiling hot and very cold without touching the control.  This is my main reason for giving an average rating.

title: Central hotel
review: This hotel is close to the beach and the center of the city. Perfect location. Our room was facing the Plaza de Toros. We could see the Alcazaba. We were able to have a late check out, we left the room at 7 pm we had to pay  half the price for the late check out. Very usefull to rest before fliyng back home. The front desk people were very helpfull. The bell boy took care of our car when we arrived. The parking is 15€ per day. The room has a small fridge. Super easy to use the bus to get to the airport. Only 5 min away from the bus stop.

title: Magnificent hotel experience
review: Had a 4 night stay at the MS Maestranza and enjoyed every minute of it. The location of the hotel was perfect, between the beach and the city centre, with very easy access to both. A bus from the airport (route A) stops pretty much right outside the hotel and only cost €3. From my room on the 11th floor there were fantastic views of the city, harbour and sea. And from the roof terrace great views of the bullring too. Easy access to local supermarkets and restaurants/bars in the harbour area, oh and a very good ice cream shop(Conico). Considering the roads outside can get quite busy, it was never a problem, rooms are very well double glazed. The hotel is very well run by friendly helpful staff. They seemed to know what we needed before we had to ask, going out of their way to…

title: What a View!
review: Stayed 10 nights room only at this hotel.
