On arrival into our room on the 9th floor we were met by the most spectacular view of the bull ring and later on in our stay we attended a bull fight there which was free to everyone. Spanish families and their children seemed to be the bulk of the audience, truly an amazing, if somewhat gory, experience. The only downside of the hotel was the  service in the restaurant, only ate there once, but would have liked to have a little more attention when calling in for a snack and a drink on a separate occasion. Very clean and friendly hotel in a great location. There are so many bars, cafes and restaurants in Malaga to experience you only need a room only stay in my opinion.The traffic of the city is  a little noisy but a high room at the…

title: Malaga experience
review: Smooth check in, smiling reception crew. Clean rooms with balcony, AC was perfect. Toiletries provided, but did not include moisturizer and bedroom slippers - would have appreciated if they had provided the same, considering this is a 4* property.  Location is excellent, near the port & the Bull Ring. Parking "Cervante" is around the corner, costs about 18 Euros a day.  Easy check out early in the  morning. Really happy with the friendly staff.

title: Maybe not 4* But...
review: This hotel is maybe on the fringe of being a 4*, but is maybe not quite there, however do not let this put you off as the previous reviews are generally spot on. Great location, views, staff and cleanliness. We went for a week with Jet 2 on a bed a breakfast deal and got great value for our trip and had a thoroughly fantastic time. Only marked down as staff in the dinning area which is also the bar were hard pushed to keep both diners and drinkers promptly served. Breakfast was very good but would suggest that the hotel invests in another coffee/hot water machine as this definitely slow things down. No hesitation in recommending this hotel and will be our first choice if and when we return to Malaga.

title: Great location!
review: The hotel is in a great location, 2 minute walk to the beach and pier, and about 15 minute walk to the city centre. It is also right next to a bus station which costs 3 euros to take you to the airport. As for the beach, the sea was very cold at this time of year. We stayed half board but we would recommend breakfast only as the dinner did not appeal to our tastes. The restaurants nearby were very affordable and at a good standard. However the staff were always very friendly. The sauna and jacuzzi are very nice and roof top overlooks the surrounding area.

title: Great hotel and fantastic location
review: We spent 3 nights in this hotel.  It's very clean with a friendly staff and the location is wonderful. It's a couple of blocks to the beach, very close to great restaurants and the bull ring, a short walk to the port and not too far away from the old city.  (Or you can take a cab for about 3 euros)   It took us about 30 minutes to walk here from the train station.   There was a balcony in the room but the street was too loud to really enjoy it.  There is a nice Jacuzzi, sauna and gym on the roof with a large terrace.   The only complaint I have is that the hot water in the shower was a little unsteady -scalding hot to tepid and back to scalding.   I would definitely go back.

title: MS Maenstranza - perfect for Cityy/beach break
review: Just returned from Malaga after staying at the MS Maenstranza and can't speak highly enough of the hotel. It was spotlessly clean the staff were great particularly Maria on the front desk, she was welcoming, friendlay and helpful. The hotel was well positoned for the beach, marina and the city centre all within easy walking distance. Didn't eat at the Hotel for no other reason than we dined in the city however we did have cocktails there and they were amazing.... We will definately return to Malaga and will definately return to the MS Maenstranza...

title: Short Break in Malaga - June 2014
review: Booked via EasyJet with flights from our favourite Southend airport (Plane to car in twenty minutes).....  Somewhat chaotic EasyJet arranged transfer to Hotel. DO NOT USE THE TRANSFR OPTION..... Later realised public bus was by far best option and used that for return - 3 euro a head (compared to £17 for each transfer).....  This Hotel is perfectly sited for easy access to the town centre yet not in a noisy area. It once upon a time would have overlooked the whole harbour but another development has somewhat narrowed the view! Attached picture is what you get if facing the sea as opposed to overlooking the bull ring.  Our stay was totally trouble free. As mentioned in other reports it is on lower end of four star in image but was spotlessly clean, very friendly, room serviced…

title: A great base for sightseeing in Malaga
review: We stayed at the Maestranza in January earlier this year. We found it to be perfectly situated for our weekend break. We arrived by public transport/bus from the airport and alighted only metres from the hotel, which enjoys a commanding position overlooking the tree-lined Paseo Parque and Paseo Espana.   The receptionist was very friendly, spoke perfect English and was entirely helpful to us throughout our weekend stay.  Our room was nicely proportioned and well decorated and along with the bathroom, it was spotless and well equipped. The breakfast was very good indeed - hot and cold buffet style with plenty of choice.  The hotel is in a great spot. Just a pleasant stroll into the centre of Malaga and its many attractions, whilst Malaga's large beachfront can be accessed from…

title: Fantastic location!
review: We stayed here for one week from the end of May to the first week of June.  Initial impressions - the entrance to the hotel is a very small one.  I wouldn't describe it as a 4 star hotel from its decor.  The room was a standard double and very basic.  As other reviewers have pointed out, the shower and wifi are temperamental.  The water in the shower went from hot, lukewarm, cold and back on a loop.  The towels were standard rather than the thick, soft, fluffy towels you usually get in a 4 star hotel.  The wifi disconnected a lot.  The lifts were 'cosy' and slow moving to say the least!  We stayed in a 4 star hotel in Seville and the staff, decor and bedroom were of the standard that we would expect from a standard 4 star hotel.  However, if you can deal with it being more of a…

title: Good for a city break
review: Stayed here for a 3 night city break and found the location very good . A 5 minute walk to the town and 2 minutes to the marina one way and the beach the other. Our room was on the 6th floor at the corner and had part views of the marina  the beach and Cathedral in the distance. The room itself was not large but reasonably well- furnished--only draw back there were no balcony seats and we had to take chairs out from the room. It is at a busy road near a roundabout but when the balcony doors and curtains were closed at night it was reasonably quiet. Fridge and safe were provide without charge The sun terrace at the top of the hotel is an added bonus for relaxing --we did not sample the Jacuzzi or the gym. The breakfast were more than adequate  with good selection of fruits,…

title: great location lovely Hotel
review: We stayed here May 19th to 28th. First point to note how welcoming, helpful and informative the reception staff were especially Maria and Jose, but all on reception were very good.   Stayed at the front on the 7th floor. Good views of both sea, cathedral and castle. The balcony was over a quite busy road but once the door was closed we couldn't hear any noise in the room. Rooms were well decorated with separate sitting sofa and table, air conditioner x 2, Jacuzzi bath/shower all spotlessly cleaned everyday to a very high standard. Had breakfast at the hotel twice and one evening meal there and ordered room service once too (so many great restaurants at the marina 100metres away we mainly dined there or at the beach also about 100 metres away ).Breakfast prices were €14 each but…

title: Great option
review: Although I was in Malaga for a business trip, I enjoyed the Hotel Maestranza and their good client service. It is located just in front of the marina, and the back of the hotel gives out to the Maestranza bullfighting plaza, which is also an interesting view! i was nicely upgraded to a junior suite, nice and large. Breakfast is ok,and serviced in a nice room with views to the marina. Room service also quite good.

title: Great value hotel close to city centre
review: We have a holiday home near Malaga & stayed here at Christmas to enjoy the christmas lights. We were so pleased with the quality and location of the hotel we came back with friends to spend a night in Malaga. Didn't have hotel breakfast but lovely cafe on ground floor, which has home made bread etc. My friend advises that the croissants are the best she has tasted. Car park available nearby. The hotel valet park your car. Cost e15 per day. You park your car at the rear of the hotel, by the bull ring & check in & they will park your car. Voucher for glass of fizz on arrival. Lovely to relax in the bar. View from sun terrace on top floor spectacular.

title: Hotel MS Maestranza
review: Stayed at this Hotel end of april this year great little hotel with short walk to the Marina, rooms are really nice with art deco furniture .all the staff are very friendly  we were half board and the food was very good .waiter service for the evening meal ,will definitely use this Hotel again.

title: Perfect
review: A really beautiful hotel with perfect location! 5 minute walk to the beach and a short walk to plenty of restaurants, the city and Alcazaba.  The hotelroom was perfectly cleaned every day and the staff was friendly. The room was quiet and with a view over the arena and a small ocean view. (room 1003)  The only negative that I have to say is about the breakfast. The breakfast itself is ok, but the price is way to high. I had to pay 14 euro a day for 3 slices of bacon and scrambled eggs. So my tip is not to eat breakfast at the hotel, but to go to the bakery that is next to the hotel. Adorable staff with excellent food for maximum 2euro.

title: Very good indeed
review: Great location close to beach, marina and old town and rooms are comfy , all staff very friendly in particular Maria at reception, always smiling and welcoming.  We stayed here 4 nights in April and wished done for longer, loads to see make sure you spend time wandering the old town amazing tapas bars down twisted cobbled streets, had great time and plan to go back, thank you

title: Perfect hotel, perfect  location
review: Stayed here for a four day break to Malaga. The hotel is in a fantastic position.  We asked for a higher floor, as recommended in some other reviews, and were not disappointed. The room was on the 12th floor with a fantastic view of the castle, Kasbah and the cathedral. Breakfast was really good with a very good selection of cold cuts, cheese, cereals etc.  The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful in all contact we had with them. The room was a very good size and the beds were a dream (literally!) to sleep in. If I could have got it out of the balcony, down the side of the hotel and onto my flight home I would've done!! Shower was a bit hit and miss. Very hot one moment and very cold the next, just couldn't find a happy medium, if there was one.   Location is…

title: Great Location, but not a superior experience
review: The Hotel MS Maestranza is a nice hotel, but when it states it is a four star rated hotel, just keep in mind that 4 stars in Europe does not typically equate to a 4 star hotel in America. The front desk personnel are very friendly and if you need anything from pillows to restaurant suggestions they are there to help. The rooms are reasonably sized, however we had a terrible shower. If you like your showers boiling hot or frigidly cold, then you probably wouldn't mind, but in the three nights we stayed there, the water temperature was never fine.   The location of the hotel was wonderful. It is approximately two blocks from the seafront and only a few blocks to the old city center. If you are more interested in staying near the restaurants and shops, this one is alittle further…

title: Great location, front desk not so great
review: Just returned from 4 nites at the Maestranza.  The location is great with many restaurants and sights withing easy walking distance.  The beds were very good  and the room had a good-sized balcony with views of the fortress, the harbor and the sea.  The room decor was much more interesting than the norm because of the paint and the artwork.  However--the breakfast was boring though it did include the standard eggs, bacon,cold cuts, and fruit.  Room service was prompt and reasonably priced and the minibar prices were awesome.  The one really big problem was the wake-up call than never came on the day of departure in spite of stopping at the front desk to make sure it was scheduled.  Fortunately we awoke in time to make our connection but there is no excuse to completely fail in…

title: Good hotel overall with excellent location
review: Compared to other hotels on our trip, this one seemed pretty basic, probably good for business trips, a bit lacking in atmosphere or style. As others mentioned, the lobby smelled strongly of smoke which worried us but our room was fine. The bed and sheets, while adequate for our needs, were not of top quality. Water in our shower was hard to adjust as it was initially either cold or scalding hot! But the location is convenient for walking to most places, through the tunnel. Taxis line up around the corner which was also a nice convenience. Front desk staff when we checked in was very cheerful and spoke English impressively well. We had great views from our balcony but there is a rooftop deck with excellent views of the city. The staff was very helpful and even offered to let us…

title: Easter Experience
review: Excellent hotel, ideally located for access to the town, marina and beach. Staff friendly and welcoming. Breakfasts had good choice. Rooms had air con and were quiet despite being near a main thoroughfare. Made us feel most welcome and everything worked well. Particularly liked the Jacuzzi bath and separate shower.

title: Nice hotel, good location, great staff
review: Stayed here overnight with our teenage daughters. Originally only one of our daughters could travel to Spain with us so we booked a triple room. The room was very spacious (junior suite), spotlessly clean and with all comforts provided in the large bathroom with spa bath. Good privacy for our teenage daughter to change etc if she had shared with us but our other daughter found that she could come with us after all so we booked an additional twin room which the girls shared. Both rooms had excellent views from the balconies. We decided to use the spa facilities in the hotel, the girls used the sauna, Turkish baths and jacuzzi whilst I had a full body massage and my oldest daughter had the hot stone massage. The masseuse was a lovely young Spanish woman and both massages were…

title: Not Good Value
review: Overall the hotel is nice enough, but for something claiming to be four star, they really nickel and dime you. Not only is there is no water provided (almost a given for even the most basic accommodations these days), but ice was a euro per glass. I have never experienced this before, especially not at 100 euro/night. Frankly, after that, I found it hard to take the place seriously and I definitely would not return.

title: Not 4 star
review: Booked this hotel for a long weekend in Malaga. On arrival I had to use the ladies toilet before I checked in, thank goodness I did. It wasnt very clean with toilet paper all over the floor. In the reception area there was a very strong smell of cigarette smoke, like strong Spanish cigs. On check in I waited for 10 mins before I was approached by anyone, even though they were standing talking to each other behind the desk. I decided this was not the place I wanted to spend my well earned weekend. We walked 10 mins into the town which was actually much better and luckily we managed to get a room in the Marriot Hotel. This was amazing, angry with myself that I hadn't booked this in the first place. The MS Maestranza would be more suited to the Spanish client not so much for the…

title: First Impressions Can Deceive
review: At first sight the hotel is a little disappointing. As you approach the facade seems a lot scruffier than the brochure picture. When we visited recently some of the balconies had brickwork damage and we noticed old furniture left outside on one or two balconies which were presumably never occupied. Inside we felt some of the fittings and furniture were tired and old fashioned.  However the service is excellent and the hotel was spotlessly clean. We only ate breakfast but the standard was excellent and comparable with anything we have experienced in Spain.  We actually booked for the Barcelo but were moved without explanation. The Barcelo is a much newer and modern hotel over the other side of the City but we feel The Maestranza is a better location for an all round break.  True…

title: Very Pleasant
review: We arrived by airport bus, stop just across the road.  Good location. We were allowed to check in at 11.30 am which was very useful and were given a voucher for a welcome cava!  We mentioned that we would prefer a room on a high floor due to reading earlier room tips.  Regina (on the desk) was very kind and found us a room on the 11th floor, overlooking the bullring, the view was great from the balcony, we even watched young matadors in training in the early evening.  The room was very clean, bed was comfortable, a small fridge, hairdryer etc, NB no kettle but that didn't worry us. We booked through Travelrepublic, cheaper than other sites including breakfast.  Breakfast was fresh and plentiful, hot and cold choices available. There was space available at all times.  NB the spa…

title: Marvellous if you want to explore Malaga!
review: I was searching for the perfect hotel to see the beauty Of this city. And I found one. We are located on a top floor. We see Alcazaba and Cathedral of Malaga when we wake up. They have wonderful view from terrace to the sea and Malaga castles. Everything worth seeing is within 15-40 minutes walk. Jacuzzi located on top floor so you can see the whole town. Love it! I love Malaga.  And this hotel has everything what we needed. On the other side is Marina and Malagueta beach. Just happy I could come here. Can write hundreds words Of praise more but trust me this is value worth the money. I will post reviews Of some restaurants as well but note this - in Malaga level Of food and service quality in general is way above other tourist places.

title: Service with a big S
review: We arrived with a hired car and if you are, like me, hoping to find a parking space in the streets next to the hotel, think again. There are no available parking spaces ! There are two public parkings near the hotel, but at the reception we were told that they have a parking space and that you can hand over your car keys and that they would park your car for 15,000 euro per day, which is a great solution. I realised too late that I left my GPS in the car, and they even brought it up to the room. We stayed in room 708 on the 7th floor, with a view on the sea and the marina. The first night we ate in the restaurant of the hotel, but there are a lot of better restaurants in the city. Location wise the hotel is located near the beach, the harbour and near the city. Breakfast has a…

title: If your going to Malaga - this is the place to stay!
review: This hotel is well situated, the beach is less than 5 minutes away, the marina is about 5 minutes in the other direction. The old town is about 10 minutes away. The Hop on Hop off bus stop is very close by and the public service bus stop is very near also. We paid for a superior room and it was well worth it, king size bed, large room, large bathroom with a walk in shower and a spa bath. The room was on the 11th floor and faced south, we had the sun on the balcony all afternoon, we had a sea view and a city view. Since it was off season a lot of the surrounding restaurants were closed but the hotel restaurant had a good choice and the food was of a good quality.

title: Excellent hotel for visiting Malaga and beach
review: Not the best looking Hotel from the outside but deceptive! We had the quickest checkin ever which was a relief as we arrived let at night and tired Room great - requested a room with evening sun on the balcony which we were given. Big bathroom - great shower - excellent housekeeping. Breakfast was really good with a lovely outlook over the park and the Castle. It's a busy area traffic wise but this didn't affect our stay. Whether you are coming for a visit to historic malaga, this hotel is so central for the beach, park, castle and shopping.  We will definitely come back here again. Staff are very friendly and the jacuzzi a bonus after a long day

title: Good hotel near centrum and sea
review: A little dated hotel. At least our room was quite small, interior was quite dark and "heavy", the breakfast room quite busy. On the roof terrace there is nice place to take sun bath and also a small gym and jaguzzi. We spent in November couple hours there and enjoyed.The location was excellent between the sea, modern passenger harbour, chateau and centrum. There are lot of nice restaurants near the hotel. Everything is in walking distance. The breakfast was ok. We had dinner one evening there and were a little disappointred. We recommend to eat outside.

title: Another happy visit
review: Great location, friendly staff and good sized rooms. We have stayed here lots of times and look forward to our next visit. Breakfast is also good. No complaints what so ever. You must try the refectorium bar / restaurant who always look after us, it is 2 minutes away.

title: Nice clean hotel but limited facilites
review: Hotel is great for a short break; the rooms were clean and fresh, and the hotel staff were very accommodating.  Nice restaurant, although we stayed out of season so it was a little limited, and was missing a little atmosphere but the food was good.  Our room was located at the front of the hotel and despite being on the highest floor it was very noisy; the hotel overlooks a main road and roundabout where traffic is quite heavy - rear of the hotel looks out over the bullring and old town but is still overlooking a road.   However location was good for a short city break; very close to a couple of pretty parks, and an easy walk to the town, and both the marina and beach were close-by. Spa unfortunately only opens in the evening which was a disappointment; and the facilities there…

title: Good restaurant with friendly staff
review: We went with our toddler and they provided a cot bed, which was good.  Views of the bullring and the kazaba were fantastic. The city centre is a short walk away and so is the beach. Great location. Wifi was patchy and rooms could be a tad bigger. Otherwise pretty good! Recommended!!

title: Great location and value
review: We stayed at the MS Maestranza  for one night. It is a pleasant hotel in a great location for Malaga city centre and a short walk to all the major sights such as the bull ring, Castillo de Gibralfaro, the cathedral, port and old town. We found it to be excellent value. It is easy to reach from the airport by bus or car. If you are driving  to the MS Maestranza the best thing to do is drive to the rear of the hotel where the bull ring and the taxi rank is, as there is nowhere to park at the front of the hotel as it faces a busy main road. The reception staff are excellent and will send a porter out to valet park your car in the bull ring car park, and will do the same for when you want your car. Be careful not to overshoot the turn off for the road behind the hotel though or you…

title: Perfect location to explore Malaga
review: This hotel could not be in a better location for the beach, marina, city, heritage, shops and restaurants. Staff are very helpful and friendly with excellent customer service. Rooms are good and very clean. Spa also good with stunning views from the hot tub. Will definitely go again

title: Nice hotel with good location
review: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was very, very helpfull and friendly. We stayed on the 10th floor in a very nice and clean room with a large and comfy bed. From the room we were overlooking the arena and the old castle. The location was very good. We walked to the beach and to the old part of the city every day. If we go back to Malaga we will stay at the Maestranza again.

title: Positive experiences!
review: We booked this hotel because of the positive reviews on TA and were not disappointed!  The location is fantastic, hotel itself is by no means posh, but clean and beautifully situated.  The staff were fantastic and really friendly and helpful at all times.  We didn't have breakfast as we were on a room only rate, but there was a fab little bakery/cafe downstairs where we had the most amazing freshly squeezed orange juice, coffees and fresh choc croissants for a princely sum of €4.80!  Would definitely recommend as it is right beside the bullring, the marina and the beach and a leisurely 10 minute stroll will get you into the heart of the town.  Can't fault it - thanks for a great city break!

title: Fantastic location
review: We stayed here for 3 nights this week. Having seen very mixed reviews since booking we were a little concerned but we need not have worried. Location is excellent and views from our room were fab, especially at night. Having read comments on here we did not include breakfast and found cafe bars to be ideal and much cheaper. Definitely hope to return and use this as a base once again as it is close to all we needed.

title: Comfortable hotel. Good location.
review: We chose this hotel for a long weekend. Our room on the 10th floor had a great view of the bull ring and of the Alcazaba. The hotel staff was very accomdating and friendly. Our room was spacious with an easy chair and a desk chair and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom had all the usual amenities and a non-slip tub. Water temperature in the shower was a bit erratic, but not enough to complain about. The room was very clean and ready for us every day when we returned after lunch. We did not choose to have breakfast since we usually prefer a continental breakfast. There's a French bakery just around the corner from the hotel where we ate every morning. The hotel is a short distance from the beach and very accessible by bus to the center of town. We purchased an EMT pass at a…

title: Lovely Hotel in a Great Location
review: We stayed in the MS Maestranza in November last year.   We found it to be very central for bus transport, the beach and the historic part of town.   The Hotel itself was lovely and clean and the Staff were very friendly and helpful.   We only had dinner once in the Hotel (which was delicious) and  had breakfast at the cafe downstairs adjoining the Hotel.   I can highly recommend the Cafe  -  the food was delicious and the staff were very helpful.  Unfortunately, our trip to Malaga was cut short due to some health problems, but we hope to return to Malaga and to this Hotel in the future.

title: Give it a miss
review: Stayed 2 nights and the moved to the AC Malaga Marriott . It was the difference between day and night for around an extra £ 10 per night . I thought Maestranza was cramped and a bit smelly . Unfriendly , abrupt guy in front of house . Wi Fi kept knocking off . 15 min walk into Center . One of those hotels you go to and wish you were back at home . Spend a few quid extra .

title: Great spot right next to the Bull Ring
review: I have read mixed reviews for this hotel and, having just returned from a 3 night stay, I recommend it fully. It is in a great position with the top, rear floors overlooking the bull ring. We stay on the 2nd and 3rd floors and they were very nice, having been recently renovated. The sauna area was been done during our stay so it was out of commission. The buffet breatfast is over priced at euro 15. You can get better value by walking down to the front (down some steps opposite the front door there are 2 or 3 places to eat). if you take the train you can get off at the end of the line (Malaga Central) which is slightly closer than Maria Zambrano. with either station then make your way to the seafront and follow the road around - the hotel is behind the big white building near the…

title: Lovely hotel - Great Location
review: Booked this hotel after reading positive reviews from others who had stayed here. We were not disappointed! Easy to get to from Malaga airport – the A bus stops just outside arrivals (friendly and helpful drivers!!) and took us to the last stop all for E3.00 – Very easy to do. Hotel staff were truly lovely and always happy. We asked for a low floor room, which we got. The hotel was always spotlessly clean and our room smelt amazing after it had been cleaned. The hotel is great for exploring the Alcazabar and the Castle Gibralfaro,(very tiring to do both in a day!) a stone’s throw from the beach and a 10 minute stroll into town where there are so many bars and eateries to suit every taste. There is a supermarket just round the corner for groceries which was very cheap! There is a…

title: great location lovely staff comfy bed spotlessly clean
review: Could not fault this hotel at all. Would certainly not hesitate to recommend. great location too! highly recommended. Staff were very friendly and gave all the information we asked for. Hope to return one day soon.

title: Loved this hotel
review: We have just returned from this wonderful hotel, we stayed from January 20 to 24th. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and our room 1010 was very nice, the bathroom was large with a jacuzzi style bath, great decor huge bed and coffee making facilities. We had a balcony with a sea view to the left and a magnificent view of the Alcazaba and Cathedral to the right Very good selection of food at the buffet breakfast. Great location opposite the port which has lots of shops and bars yet a five minute walk to the beautiful old town.

title: excellent location
review: Excellent location.The hotel was very clean. The room was very comfortable .brilliant views of the sea,marina and city from our room 1009 on the 10th floor. Staff friendly   Did not like the food in hotel but in general we didn't like any of the food in Spain. Only one English speaking station on tv .sky news. On holidays we didn't want to be watching 24 hours a day! A few more English speaking stations would be good and tea / coffee facilities should be in room

title: Room with a view
review: Stayed 3 nights here in November 2013. Convenient location near the port and Muelle Uno shops and restaurants and only a 10 minute or so walk into the old town.  Also very convenient for the end stop for the airport bus. As many on Tripadvisor have helpfully advised, we requested a room on a high floor and the hotel very nicely put us in on eof the end rooms on the 8th floor with fab view of the port, cathedral and the Gibralfaro. Lovely sight in the day and night. Room was spacious enough and bathroom big enough - only minus was that water from the shower seemed to get on the floor easily as the screen was inadequate.  Another minus was that the room had no tea making facilities which we like to use in many hotels. Had to go to the restaurant and ask for a jug of hot water…

title: Good location
review: My husband and me paid £90 for one night room only, which I thought was a bit expensive. The reception staff were helpful. We initially loved the accommodation, consisting of a good sized bedroom and bathroom which was nicely decorated. However we were disappointed that there was no hot drink maker, clock or tissues and could find no english speaking channel on the old TV. Coffee machines are placed in superior rooms only apparently! There was a generous supply of toilletries and shaving equipment etc, and a bidet but we had problems with the shower. There was a rooftop spa and small sunbathing area and a bar which we did not have time to visit. We had a small balcony which overlooked the street. We didn't receive a complimentary drink! We liked Malaga and the hotel is very…

title: Great Location & View
review: This hotel is very well located. There are a number of restaurants, banks, and convenience stores just a few steps from the hotel and the beach is a 4-5 minute walk if that. The main attractions of Malaga are a quick 10 minute walk across the beautiful park. Many of the rooms have excellent views of the Alcazaba, Castillo, and Bull Ring.  The hotel rooms are a bit small by American standards and the bed was too firm for my taste. Wi-Fi worked well with a few glitches and TV stations include Spanish, German, and one English (BBC News) station.  The restaurant in house was quite good and reasonably priced with superb service. The roof top deck provides stunning views of the city.  Parking is available around the corner, under the bull ring but I would check with the hotel about…

title: Very well situated
review: At first glance we though we chose the worst hotel- no parking, hard to find place to leave the car and get to the reception with luggage. The hotel itself average a bit old fashioned. Next day morning however we realised it was a perfect place for sightseeing in Malaga, with very good breakfast.

title: Still the best in Malaga
review: Hotel is disapointing the the first sight - no parking space; very, very small lobby, reception service poor, rooms require refurbishing. But after one day and city tour You can see that hotel is not such bad: close to the beach and shopping area, pleaced at trhe most beautiful park in Malaga, closest hotel to castle hill, nice restaurant (Los Delphinos) in the neihghbourhood. I think that it is really good choice in Malaga.

title: Nice Hotel,  great location
review: Very friendly and helpful staff,  nice room,  good bathroom.  Parking is an issue but the hotel arranged for a discount at a local underground car park (€18 p.d).  Lots of cafés and bars in the area.  Good breakfast.    Thanks again to the staff for all your help!

title: Malaga near the harbour
review: Stayed one night early November.   Quick and friendly at reception.     Had asked for a quiet room and were allocated one overlooking the bullring which was indeed quiet.   Very adequate size and excellent bed and bathroom, nicely clean.   Arrived quite late, very good vegetarian salad in the restaurant.   Pleasant walk round the port area after meal and before bed.    After an excellent breakfast walked round the castle and alcazaba just up from the hotel next morning , lunch at the hotel then taxi to car hire.   Nothing to fault it for a short stay apart from lack of tea-making facility in the room, but this seems quite typical in this area.

title: A great time was had
review: Great hotel with lovely colleagues we were well looked after       The hotel was in a great location for all the local shops and resturants  only 10 mins to the port and five minutes to the beach would use this hotel again

title: Food great . Rooms old fashioned but clean.
review: We had good view of bull ring as we were on the quiet side of the hotel.  Nice staff. Clean but needs a revamp and more sight seeing information as we were unsure where to go first. However we soon realised we were pretty near Picasso Museum, Alcazarbar, port, etc

title: Break in Malaga
review: Great location, higher rooms have a fab view of the port, castle and cathedral.  Easy walking distance to many of the main sites and beach.  If you have a car, go to the back of the hotel by the bull ring where the taxi's rank is and pull up, pop into the hotel and they will get someone to come out and take your car away to the car park.    Breakfast was average - I would suggest maybe book a room only and use the café next door to the hotel instead.  Our room was very nice, with a good bathroom.  Tea and coffee making facilities would be a welcome addition though.  The staff were very helpful and I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Malaga.  So much so that I have booked again for this week to see the Christmas lights.

title: Good stay
review: Good location, you can easily  walk to the city center. Also it is close to the beach.  The hotel has a spa and a roof-terrace. We didn`t use it because of the wheather- but it seemed nice. Also the hotel is close to the hop-on-hop-off buses. The breafast was good and had enough to choose among unless you are  very spoiled...lots of good fruit! The room had a nice view from the balcony.  We asked for a room high up before we arrived (e-mailed the hotel). The bed gave us a very good nights sleep. We can recommend the hotel.

title: Base for a long weekend city break
review: We used the hotel as a base for a long weekend during which we visited Granada and Ronda and pottered around Malaga. It is fairly centrally located for bars and restaurants in Malaga. The room was well appointed, the bar convivial and breakfast pretty comprehensive. Staff were friendly and helpful. They take your car away to park it but you have to watch out when you first arrive because satnav will bring you to a busy road where you can't stop. You actually need to go to Calle Marstranza and initially park up by the bull rink. We enjoyed our stay. The only downside was 24 hour traffic noise but that would probably apply to any city centre hotel.

title: Grown up weekend
review: We spent a grown up weekend at this smart city hotel. It's location is a good one, you can walk easily to the sights and shops. The views of the marina from the restaurant in the morning are wonderful, breakfast is done well too. Our room suited us, views nice furnishings and the spa and gym are nicely done. This was our first visit to Malaga and we found it a great city. Still warm and sunny in November, just bring a cardi for the chill air at night. A good choice for city sun.

title: Large hotel in good location
review: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon. The room was large and clean and the staff friendly enough. We had a nice view of Malaga from our balcony. There is a jacuzzi, steam room, sauna and small gym on the roof which is nice and there are really great views from up there. The location was great, very close to the beach and lots of nice restaurants right outside. Just a short walk along to the old town where there are lots of things to see and do.   My only issue with the hotel is that it lacks personality and I found it a little boring. There were no personal touches added even although we had mentioned it was our honeymoon, which I guess is the down side of booking in a large hotel. The other hotel we stayed in made us feel special and went out of their way to…

title: Great view
review: This is a city hotel which can offer you also a balcony with a splendid view in the middle of Malaga. We asked for a sunny top floor room and got one! The room is spacious and decorated with a good taste. Bright bathroom with a window. Good  breakfast in the restaurant which also offers you a view. All the staff very friendly and polite. Many thanks to the nice porter who took care of our luggage from the taxi to the room and from the hotel to the taxi again. On the hotel roof you can enjoy even a better view and sunshine on sunbeds and relax in the jacuzzi or do some excercises in the fitness room.  The reception area and the hotel corridors are not large and wide but nice and practical.

title: Very good value
review: Stayed at this hotel as a weekend break my wife during November just as the weather was turning. Days were sunny and nice whilst nights were a little chilly but lovely.  All this is offset by this very nice hotel just by the harbour within walking distance of the old town the shops and restaurants.  Nice rooms with a few minor rough edges polite staff and a gym and jacuzzi on the roof. Good value overall I would say and we'll be back again.

title: Very good hotel in an excellent location
review: Stayed in this hotel for three nights, with friends, for the second time in October 2013. The hotel is in an excellent location; a short walk into the town with many shops, restaurants and bars and the marina is just a stones throw away. The rooms are of a good quality with fantastic views of the marina and although it is on a main road you cannot hear any noise from your room at night. The breakfast is adequate but could be better for a 4 star hotel, minimal hot food and fruit. The bar prices are reasonable for a hotel. Travel from the airport is so easy; the A bus takes approx 30 minutes and you get off at the last stop. The hotel is just across the street and the cost is only 3 Euros. I have already booked to go back to this hotel next year and would recommend it to anybody…

title: Top class hotel
review: Great position, we have now stayed there on six occasions. You have the city and the beach on your door step. Good quality rooms with amazing views. The new port has now been finished  with plenty of bars and restaurants. Next time we visit I think we deserve a free drink, haha.

title: Comfortable with good location
review: Spent a weekend in November in this nice , clean hotel. The personel was friendly,  recommending us restaurants and shopping areas. The A bus from the airport has its last stop across the street and is only 3 EUR. We could walk everywhere easily. The bullring is behind the hotel, the fortress of Alcabraz is lit wonderfully at night and is always visible on the hill, reachable in 15 min walk from the hotel door. We loved the park along the sea we strolled to and from the old city. No need to eat breakfast at the hotel, you have a very wide choice downtown, in much more picturesque settings. would stay here again. might say as well that the hotel offered decent free wi-fi, but the tv set was dated. It didn't matter for us anyways, we did not come to Malaga to watch TV.  At night,…

title: Super hotel in ideal location
review: We have just returned from a four day trip to Malaga and really enjoyed our stay at the Ms Maestranza. The hotel is in an ideal location, close to beach,,marina and old town. The views from the roof are stunning. Also very handy is the airport bus that stops across the road and only costs 3euro. We had a room on a higher level floor and could see both the marina and beach.It was only a ten minute pleasant stroll to the old town, but there were lovely restaurants and bars in the marina area. Would definitely reccomend this hotel for value for money in lovely sunny Malaga!

title: Ideal location
review: Very good value. Brilliant location to port, beach, bullfighting, very pleasant walk to shopping area. Roof top jacuzzi and loungers small but very pleasant. Good view up top. Typical city small lobby,lifts but rooms very good, air cond. staff all friendly and helpful. We spent three days in Malaga for birthday. Public Bus to hotel from airport.

title: A great time in sunny Malaga
review: Just returned after 5 days in MS Maestranza.The view from the room 906 was fantastic. We only had Sky News to watched as an English Channel  Too bad the TV did not have a USB port as we could have watched films from our pendrive. (I would have given 5 stars if it had.) The cafe down below was brilliant We had tea ,coffee 2 crossiants and freshly squeezed orange juice for 8 euros. The marina is great with many shops and restaurants. Would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

title: Review of Hotel MS Maestranza
review: We stayed at hotel MS Maestranza Malaga for 3 nights / 4 days. We caught the train from the airport to Malaga Central station (which is €1.70) and then we caught a taxi to the hotel which was €5.00 (as we were unsure how far the hotel was) however it’s actually only about a 15min walk away. There was a large queue to check-in (which was about 12:30pm) and it appeared the two staff on reception at the time were quite disorganised, We had booked a deluxe Superior room however after checking-in and opening the door to our room (on the 11th floor) we knew this wasn’t what we’d paid for, it was small and pokey, the man in reception was clearly farming rooms off regardless as to peoples reservations, we did complain and was given the correct room on the 3rd floor, however this really…

title: Great location
review: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in September for 5 days .After reading the reviews we emailed asking for a room on a top floor. We were given a room on the 11 th floor . I loved the location ,it was very close to town and the marina was opposite, with lots of shops and restaurants .We liked the Mexican and Indian restaurant  you could swap around ,Indian starter  Mexican main or whatever ,food was great . The beach was minutes away also  The breakfast in the hotel was very good ,hot food included fried eggs ,and if you wanted ,you could even have a glass of bubbly . We were happy with room .great views ,could still here the traffic below ,but it didn't bother us . The staff were very helpful when we were asking directions to bus station .we took a bus to Marbella for the…

title: Tired on the outskirts of Malaga
review: The hotel is of 70s vintage, on a noisy road at the front and a bullring at the back. Rooms are good, but I asked for a quiet room and the receptionist obliged by giving us a room on the10th floor facing the bullring. It was quiet - but these rooms are all smoking rooms, and if you don't like stale cigarette smoke, it's not great.  The hotel is only a 10 minutewalk from the historical centre of town and has the comforts expected of a 4 star property (though I found the pillows uncomfortable), but next time around I would rather stay in the centre of town - it's quieter and has classier hotels.  Service was very good.

title: Holiday October 2013
review: Just returned from a 4 night holiday at this hotel. The location is excellent for the old town , the beach and all the restaurants at the Marina. The last stop on the airport bus is within a 100 yards of the hotel and costs 3 euros. The hotel and the staff are first class and the breakfast choice is excellent with a choice of hot food  and cold meats. There are 2 small supermarkets nearby. The bus for Torremolinos and Benalmadena is only a 10 minute walk along the Harbour side and only costs 1.60 euros. The castle and alcazarba are nearby and the old town is a 10-15 minute walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to return in the future.

title: Superb hotel and location
review: We have just returned from a five nights' stay at the Maestranza hotel in Malaga and found it exceptional. The hotel location could not be more perfect: five minutes walk to the Malagueta beach, five minutes to the port marina with its myriad restaurants, cafes and shops, ten minutes to the old town, opposite the airport bus terminus. As advised we had emailed the hotel in advance to request a room on a high floor and got one of the best rooms front facing on the 10th floor (room 1005) with a large balcony and breathtaking views over the Moorish Alcazaba, the Castillo de Gibralfara, Malaga's Cathedral, bullring and the marina ). The view was particularly spectacular at night with all the monuments lit up.  The only negative point was the constant  traffic noise which you could…

title: Short Stay Malaga October 2013
review: Stayed for two nights at this hotel with 5 friends. Easy journey by bus from the airport with regular services in both directions. Hotel is ideally located for first visit to Malaga with beach walks on one side, port on the other and only a very short walk to the centre for bars, shops and food. Hotel has great facilities and roof top sun deck with decent views of the City, training room and jacuzzi too!

title: Holiday September 2013
review: Very pleased with location and amenities.  Only 5 minitues to the beach. marina and local buses. Airport bus just across the road. Rooms were very clean. View from room excellent. Staff were very helpful.

title: 4 star quality hotel at 3 star price
review: Everything about this hotel was great. It's rare to find the comfort and amenities of an American chain hotel in a European hotel. I confirm that the hotel staff are all friendly and helpful. We got our room when we arrived at 11am even though check in is not till afternoon. The room on the 6th floor was clean, air conditioned, well-lit, trimmed with marble and mirrors. Big balcony, 2  windows (very soundproof and with light blocking curtains) with view on  bull ring and Gibralfaro castle. The bed was two twins stuck together, but very comfortable. There was a SAFE (very important and not so common), minibar with reasonable prices. The bathroom was spacious and pretty spotless, with a bidet which gives a touch of old school luxury. It had blow dryer and even a magnifying mirror.…

title: A short walk from old town Malaga
review: Just spent three nights at the Ms and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location of the hotel is perfect for the beach and old town Malaga, which is beautiful! It is however situated on a busy road and roundabout junction, but to be honest it's quite fun watching the comings and goings.   The hotel itself is clean and comfortable and the staff are very welcoming and friendly. The only downside was the room appointed for breakfast, I thought it was too small, especially as it's a buffet concept and coffee served out of only one coffee machine, so it got a bit overcrowded around the machine, which meant you couldn't get at the food!    Only a little niggle but it's worth a mention, they do however serve breakfast from 7:30-11:00, so maybe it would be worthwhile waiting for a later…

title: Perfect location
review: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights, it is a perfect base for seeing Malaga.  The beach (Malagueta Plaza) is just a few minutes along the road, the new port with shops and fantastic restaurants is just over the road and then it takes just 10 minutes maximum to walk into the main town.....perfect!  There is a taxi rank on the corner and there are normal buses and the open top bus stops nearby.  From the roof terrace of the hotel you can see right into the Bull Ring and you also get stunning views of the castle, the port and surrounding area. I stayed room only at the hotel but did go for breakfast one morning which cost 14 Euros - really nice food but not worth the price, there are plenty of tapas bars and restaurants/bars doing food all day for far less money.   The rooms in the…

title: Great location, charm, accommodating staff
review: I spent five days here as part of an extended tour and could not be more pleased. The location is great near the center of town and the harbor. The views from the hotel roof were an added bonus. Our tour included breakfast in the hotel which was the best of the five hotels on our tour with a variety of fresh fruit that was not available at our four previous hotels. This was also the first time we were asked if our room was okay or if we wanted to change floors. The staff at breakfast replenished all of the choices immediately so that you never were left with the, oh, I wish I had gotten one of those peaches or sweet rolls. The rooms are charming as they, as well as the entire hotel are decorated tastefully with Picasso prints. You really feel the Malaga ambiance here. The bath…

title: Great Hotel in great location in Malaga
review: The MS Maestranza is a great hotel in a fantastic location - very close to the beach, the marina and the old town.  The airport bus stops very close to the hotel (it is the last stop).  Except on a Sunday afternoon, when we arrived and all the local shops/bars were closed, there are some handy supermarkets within minutes of the hotel, and cafes and bars.   The hotel is next to the bullring, which is an amazing looking building, and the "hop on / hop off" tourist bus stop is just at the other side of the bullring.  The old town, with its amazing cobbled streets, tapas bars and very reasonable shops, is just a 5 - 10 minute walk, on the other side of the main Avenida Cervantes.  The marina / port is a short walk.  Some lovely cafe bars at the port.  We totally recommend the…

title: Decent Location Close to Beach, Awesome Breakfast Buffet
review: I stayed at this hotel for a couple nights. It is about two blocks from the beach making it an easy walk.  Right behind the hotel is the big bull fighting arena.  A close walk towards the beach is the port and the boardwalk with a bunch of restaurants.  The best part of the hotel for me was the breakfast buffet.  They have an outstanding selection including eggs and bacon.  The rooms are just ok. The decor in the rooms is outdated.  If you check in I would recommend that you request a room on a high floor. They put me in a third floor room  with the bull fighting arena right behind me which was  fine but  I think a room higher up with view of towards the ocean would be better.  It was very easy to reach to the hotel from the airport. I took a bus from the airport to the final…

title: Good holiday
review: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor,and was not disappoint, couldn't fault hotel,great location near the marina and five minutes walk to the main shopping center.hotel was very clean,and reception staff very helpful, complementary drinks also given,bags taken upto your room.bus stops very near also taxi rank,breakfast was very good,did not eat evening meal,but ate at the marina every night,would reconmend Amigos which is an Indian and Mexican place in one,will I go back most definitely. Would I recommend YES.

title: A week off
review: A week off in Spain sounded nice, and finding a hotel near the beach was very easy. Nice hotel, clean rooms, pleasant staff and a wonderful roof floor with sauna, Turkish bath, jaccuchi, sunbeds and a smiling hostess made uss very comfortable. To stay at a hotel in a city, at the same time situated near the beach, shopping centre, restaurants, parks and recreations, that's good enough for me :D

title: still good
review: my last review of this hotel was in 2011 and is a bit out of date.  We returned in 2013 in February. The staff were even nicer, room still good, not lovely, but good, clean, comfy, food choice bit better. Cant complain at all. Standrards maintained. will use again. If you want to buy fresh food, turn in opposite direction from town and walk for about ten minutes along either coast or main street, you will come to really good supermarket, also street behind hotel just past bullring has lovely fruit shop. feel free to contact me.

title: Good location,  good value if you get a deal.
review: Nice hotel,  close to the beach and port.  10 min stroll from the centre via the park.  Rubs shoulders with the bull ring and n La Malagueta.    Lots of restaurants to choose from of all price ranges. Later there is a incredible Irish bar, Irish Times,  just down from the bull ring..  Better than any i have seen in dublin! Well worth a visit,  to take you back ti Irish days.   On the whole good if you get a reasonable price.  If there is an event on or something in the bull ring,  can outprice itself eith other options more economical.

title: Great Hotel in Malaga
review: If you are looking for a good hotel in Malaga,look no further than the MS_MAESTRANZA ,We stayed here before a cruise and really liked it.As advised,we requested an upper story room and had a little balcony with a great view of the town and the bull ring.The staff was very nice and even encouraged the use of my high school Spanish.      The restaurant was quite good for a meal and the buffet breakfast. It 's location is quite central and we found ourselves at the dock in a very short time.Would certainly stay here again.

title: Location, Location, Location
review: We stayed at Maestranza last week for 4 days and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location very close to all ammenieties. The staff were very helpful and we even got a free glass of champagne. Our room was very clean and had a balcony which was great. We went up to the roof and there is a marvelous view of the city from there. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Don't miss this gem! great location for beach and town
review: Hotel was clean, all staff were helpful and friendly, buffet breakfast perfect hot or cold or both!! Amazing panoramic view from the roof terrace you can seen into Bull ring, port and beach.  Girlie few days 5mins from beach and port boulevard lots of restaurants, 10mins into town perfect

title: Great location
review: We stayed at the Maestranza for 8 nights in July. The hotel is ideally located for most things, being a 5 minute walk from the beach and 15-20 min walk into the centre of town. Slight disappointment at there being no pool was more than made up by its proximity to everything we could need! We asked for a room high up as we had read some reviews about the traffic noise lower down - I can see this would be an issue as it is on a fairly busy road, but we were accommodated as requested and had a lovely room overlooking the bullring. We didn't eat in the evening at the hotel but the breakfast was great, although some of the breads and pastries got gradually more and more dry as the week went on, so not sure how fresh it was.

title: Location, location
review: This hotel has an ideal location, just a five minute walk from Malaguete Beach and ten minutes along the lovely promenade to the center of the city. The north-side rooms have a pleasant view. The room had been recently renovated. On the negative side, the water temperature in the shower varies dramatically, making for an unpleasant experience. The hotel needs to install thermostatic shower/bath controls.

title: Second visit to MS Maestranza
review: The hotel is perfectly situated, close to the Malagueta beach, the port, the historic centre and the shops. Our room was comfortable and well appointed. The hotel staff were particularly helpful, assisting us good-humouredly with a number of small practical things - printing boarding passes, photocopying, posting an urgent letter, ... We especially enjoyed the sun terrace on the hotel roof and the jacuzzi. The buffet breakfast was extensive and reasonable value if you have a big appetite in the morning, though rather expensive if you only want a coffee and toast.  It was our second visit to the hotel and we will certainly stay there again on our next trip to Malaga!

title: Second time
review: We went back to the Ms Maestranza in Malaga and stayed 4 great nights.  The service was excellent and we love the location. We eat at the hotels restaurant this time and it did not disappoint  the prices are n line with every other hotel but the service and the quality of food was excellent Weill once aging return next year excellent value

title: Excelent
review: Almost everything is excelente in this hotel. The atenders are very polide. The coffebreak is amazing. They serve dellicious dinner for only 17 EUR. The hotel is near Malagueta Beach and close to bus and taxi stops. They are a little expensive, but the price is fair. The only problem is the wireless internet that does not work in the rooms. I do not have time to enjoy the pool and the spa...

title: couple from south wales
review: We booked the MS Maestranza from reading good reviews on Trip Advisor. This is a good hotel close to all the main attractions.We caught the bus from outside the airport to the hotel (6 euros for the two of us) and walked across the road to the hotel.  The room was great clean ,spacious and a lovely balcony (although it would have been nice to have 2 chairs to sit and enjoy the views) The only downside for us is there were no tea/ coffee making facilities, We did have a coffee machine but the coffee was very strong and  we had to ask for milk (we are not used to strong coffee) Also they seemed a bit on the mean side when it came to shower gel/shampoo, we were only given 2 of each and they were not replaced. The breakfasts were good,with a good selection (even wine/cava)  If you…

title: Great hotel in super location
review: As previous reviews, this hotel is close to the beach, the lovely modern marina 'muelleuno' and the lush gardens of the Paseo which leads to the town centre about 5-10minutes walk away. Rooms, including the bathroom, are modern, spacious and well equipped. Rooms are cleaned every day. Rooftop terrace is a bonus with a fabulous view. The spa is spacious and well maintained. Breakfast is plentiful with lots of choice. Stayed with daughter who is coeliac and staff were very helpful in providing alternative food for her. Our room was on the 6th floor with views down to the beach and across to the port. I would recommend a high floor room.  Staff were friendly and helpful at all times.

title: Good location
review: We spent a long week-end in Malaga on our way back home and stayed at this hotel. Rooms are clean and comfy, close to the beach and port area where to relax and very close to the centre. Not the cheapest option but still worth it. Staff professional.

title: Good accomodation, excellent situation
review: We stayed for 7 nights on a double room on the 11th floor, with a nice view over the city and the Alcazaba and Gibralfaro castle.  The room was large enough for 2 persons, well furnished, and clean.  The rooftop terrace with sunbeds is very nice, the jacuzzi is quite small but ok. We particuraly appreciated the location, next to the Malagueta beach at the end of the street, a taxi station just around the corner, a bus stop on Plaza del General Torrijos, and an access to the port and its nice restaurants 5 min by walk.

title: Great Hotel - Central to transport links
review: Excellent hotel friendly staff and helpful. Helped book trips for us and even printed directions for an attraction we wanted to visit.  Spa was very good and gym on the 12th floor. The hotel is in a central location near the beach and centre within walking distance. Many restaurants and bus stops to get everywhere within the city and further. A supermarket is just opposite the hotel and is open late everyday till 2am.

title: All you could want at the right price.
review: Stayed for one night. We had a corner room ,which gave wonderful views of the city and port, and the bullring. The room and bathroom were comfortable and unostentatious, the bed firm and generous. The wi-fi was good. The spa was fine, open from 4.30 to 9.30, no-frills, good jacuzzi with excellent views. Very good location for the city and airport bus.Our stay cost E86. Highly recommended.

title: Good hotel in excellent location
review: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as part of a 9-day visit to the area, having picked this hotel as a result of the mainly good TA reviews, and we weren't disappointed.   The hotel is situated adjacent to the port and to the bullring, and overlooks the roundabout of the Plaza del General Torrijos at the end of the Paseo Del Parque, an area within the beautiful Parque de Malaga. In all a great location, only around 10 minutes walk to the main shopping area of Calle Molina Lario, and a couple of minutes to the port and its bars and restaurants.  We arrived by car and initially found it difficult to stop by the hotel, but eventually found the Calle Maestranza where we left the car briefly for it to be parked nearby by a bellboy from the hotel (charge 15€ per day). Each day when…

title: Good location
review: Located near the beach, and in walking distance from the old town. Perfect for our needs. Can't speak for the food, we ate breakfast in the cafe in the same builing, who has reasonably priced food, and excellent orange juice. There are som good resutrants near by as El Refrectorium, and as mentioned, the old town where resutrants are abundant is just a walk away. We were on the 11th floor, and were not bothered with noise, allthough our room was facing the intersection.  The top floor has a jacuzzi with excellent view. The rooms are ok sized. The bathrooms were impecably cleaned. Some signs of wear and thear overall at the hotel, but as clean. I recommend Maestranza.

title: Great location, staff really friendly, lovely room
review: Location couldn't be better, a few minutes walk to the centre, a few minutes to the harbour or a few to the beach. We were upgraded to a junior suite on arrival which was nice, room was very clean and modern. Breakfast was ok, nothing special, but quite ok. Only downside was we had a rental car and there is no parking, so hotel suggested car park close by, the tariffs were almost impossible to work out, and we were shocked that it worked out as approx 25E per night. Malaga was a beautiful city that seems to be looked after, amazing gardens and architecture, and new harbour front restaurants are great. Will go back

title: Greetings from Finland
review: The hotel was nice and clean and the service was very friendly. Moreover, it has a great location. The only negative side was the noice coming from the street below, which is understandable because of the location.

title: Weekend break
review: Just enjoyed a lovely sunny weekend in Malaga, a city that has a lot more to offer than you would expect. The hotel is set in a good location within a few minutes walk of the beach, the new shopping and restaurants at the marina, the old town and the Alcazar, an old Moorish castle.

title: Malaga is not a typical place to say on this coast but this hotel great place to stay if you want a city/beach experience
review: There are some givens in life.  One of them is not to judge a hotel when you arrive late at night. I was not that impressed even though my wife and I had reviewed TA comments.  Well I am always happy to be proven wrong when the experience is positive and this the case with this hotel and it's wonderful location. We stayed in room 506 and we have a partial view of the Med and docks but much more impressively we directly face Gibralfaro Castle and it is amazing.  Most of the rooms seem to have balconies and even though it is a relatively busy road the palm trees obscure part of the road and it is lovely to sit out in. This part of Malaga is near the Old Town and is a predominantly residential area. Great bakery next door and a supermarket opposite.  Rooms very clean but slightly…

title: Excellent location if you decide to stay in Malaga itself
review: The Hotel is easy to find and is very close to the terminus for the bus from the Airport. Hotel is very comfortable and is just what you would expect for a four star hotel. I would suggest when you book a room either get one facing the bullring or one thats on one of the higher floors on the other side. The road outside is pretty busy on the non bullring side so if you are a light sleeper dont go for a lower floor room. We thought it was a better location for seeing Malaga than staying in the centre of town. The centre is only ten mins walk away through the gardens which are extremely pleasant. You are close to the beach which has some nice bars on the sand to have a seat, snack and coffee or drink. You are close to the port which has really nice areas to sit in with loads of…

title: Family Trip to Malaga
review: We are a family of with two boys (ages 4 and 6) so this review is aimed for families.  Our holiday in Malaga (Apr 13 to Apr 18, 2013) was excellent.  As others have said, express line A costs 3 euros a person (the 4 year old was charged as well) and is easy to get outside the airport.  When you get off the bus at the last stop look behind you (a little to the right) and up  – you will see at the top of a building the letters “MS”- that’s the hotel.   The entrance is to the right of the café and a bit hard to find.  The MS Maestranza hotel  was clean and breakfasts had healthy foods (lots of fruit – pineapple, grapes, kiwi, orange, grapefruit – all cut up in advance) , sweet things (cocco puffs, doughnuts, chocolate croissants) ,hot stuff (eggs, bacon)   and a machine which made…

title: Best hotel of our European Trip!
review: We booked a suite here for our second stop of our Europe tour in Malaga, Spain!  We absolutely LOVED our hotel!  The room was modern, spacious and comfortable.  We had a comfortable king bed, luxurious bathroom with a separate jetted tub and a balcony overlooking the bull ring.  The hotel was a short 5-minute walk from the beach and only a 15-minute stroll from downtown Malaga filled with shops and restaurants!

title: fantastic location...best in Malaga
review: We just came back after 4 days in Malaga.in The Hotelwe found very friendly reception stuff,exelent breakfast,room not so big but clean with well equiped mini bar.Fantasic location ,2 min to the beach and port ,8-10 min walk to old town!Higly recomend !

title: Hotel Maestranza
review: We stayed here for 9 nights . The hotel is well situated , about 200 metres from the beach and a 15 minute walk ( through a  very nice park ) to the centre of town . The staff were very friendly , room was good value , though we didn't have breakfast as it was expensive. The hotel had free internet which was very handy . There is also a nice cafe next door . There is a bus direct to/from the airport 100 metres from the hotel . On the whole a very enjoyable stay.

title: Location & Service
review: Fantastic rooms, Excellent service, Great location. The hotel is located near the beach, near the marina, alongside the Bull fighting stadium. above a great little cafe bar. next to the taxi rank. The rooms (ours was room 1201 on the top floor) are very clean spacious with all the facilities you would expect including separate shower and bath and toiletries are provided. The view from the room would be overlooking the Bull fighting stadium or the marina depending on the side of the hotel the room is. Ours over looked the Bull fighting stadium. There are 2 lifts which were very quiet and meant you were never waiting long for one. On the roof is a basic gym, spa pool, steam room & sauna all of which over look the marina or castle. The facilities were clean and well maintained. The…

title: City Break
review: Really good location - easy to reach from the airport as the last stop on Express Line A stops right at the hotel and takes 30 mins, and hotel is close to the sea front, restaurants, and shops.  10 minute walk through pleasant tree lined avenue into the city centre.  Facilities in hotel of a good standard, although decor a little dated - everything clean and tidy though. Free in-room safe useful to keep valuables.  Staff really helpful and friendly.  Breakfast buffet was limited in range, particularly of hot food, but overall the breakfast was OK.  Only downside of our stay was the windows in our room on the 6th floor didn't keep out the noise of the traffic below, so light sleepers might find this a problem.  Given 4 star status, the hotel windows should be improved to resolve…

title: Malaga City 4 day break
review: This is an excellent hotel, beautifully positioned in Malaga near the Port. It is absolutely spotless and well decorated throughout. All the staff were excellent, reception, cleaners, breakfast restaurant staff, did not have any complaint whatsoever. The rooms were cleaned perfectly every day. The breakfast was a very relaxed and enjoyable experience -  bacon, eggs, toast, breads, cereals, yoghurts, juices, tea and coffee, plus lots more, in a beautiful room on the first floor with large windows overlooking the Port. The hotel is also next to the oldest bull ring in Spain,  a magnificent building. Also just below the Alcazabar and the Castillo Gibalfaro.  We have flown into Malaga on many occasions and decided this time on a City break there with Jet2 Holidays. It is a really…

title: Good Hotel
review: Stayed here recently and really enjoyed the location, food, accomodation, facilities.  It was close to the beach, port area (great restaurants) and bull ring.  The hotel and rooms are clean and the breakfast was substantial and good quality the hotel staff were very helpful especially opening the top deck to take photos and giving us an explanation of what we could see.   Did not make use of the free spa and gym on the top floor but hope to on my return.

title: Location Location
review: Going to a town for the first time is always a bit of a lottery as regards hotels. We rely a lot on Trip Advisor and this led us to the Maestranza. It hasn’t had rave reviews but few complaints either and that was our experience during our 4 night stay. Firstly, the location is superb for a few days sightseeing as it is close to the port, beach, old town and the Moorish Alcazaba (palace) and Gibralfaro ( fort). All can be walked. The express bus( Route A ) from just outside arrivals at the airport goes to the Hotel for 3 € for a 30 minute ride. It goes around the roundabout in front of the hotel then stops and this is the last stop on the route.  Don’t know what a taxi would cost but this has got to be miles cheaper As recommended in Trip Advisor, we asked for a high floor and…

title: Location and staff are a plus, quality is a strong minus
review: If you are looking for an hotel in the heart of Malaga within walking distance from the shops, the bars, the monuments and the beach, Maestranza is perfect. If you are also looking for 4-stars quality, you'd better look for a newer hotel, we noticed some signs of the time around the room. Biggest one was a missing piece of the hydromassage tub. The accessories were more suitable for a 3-stars than a 4, and breakfast does not offer many possibilities. But you are in the center of Malaga, nearly 20degrees Celsius in February and the price was not too high for the Carnival season, so the 4 is a deserved rating, With a bit more effort the 5 should be standard: some renewal and a longer period of opening of the spa service.

title: Girls Trip
review: Perfect hotel for girls trip to Malaga. 5 minutes walk from beach, directly opposite supermarket which was great for picnic stuff !  Buffet breakfast was great and plenty of it , staff very attentive, friendly bar ! The hotel was just across the road from the marina and all its restaurants , shops and boats and perfect for an early morning jog ! About 15-20 minutes leisurely walk to the centre of Malaga , and on the way back, taxis were easily available.  All in all, great venue for our trip and will definately return !

title: good hotel with a very helpfull staf
review: We stayed in the Maestranza Malaga for 5 days (end january 2013). The hotel is very wel located betweed towncenter and the beach. The hotel has a very nice roof terras was a nice vieuw over the city.  The breakfast was good and fair.  Rooms were clean. We received a cava as welcome drink, with was a nice gesture.  We also booked in the hotel a one day trip to Granada. Other day trips were availble as well. I believe it were the same trips as provided by Viatior.  You can also book a car at the reception for very competitive prices. The car was brought to the hotel on the agried time. We made a visit to El torcal and Ronda, 2 places we recommend to visit if you enjoy nature and fantastic panoramic vieuws.  We can recommend this hotel as you receive a good value for your price. …

title: An evening in Malaga to see the Christmas Lights
review: This was a last minute booking seeing friends before they went home for New Year, so booked on my iphone the day before and turned up at the hotel with no documentation or directions, just a Sat Nav.   The hotel is a 10 story hotel on the corner of a block, just a short 5 minute walk to the sea front and is near the Bullring.  Actually driving to the hotel if you are travelling through Malaga from Marbella is difficult - you can see the hotel on the left hand side of the road but you can't cross the one way system to get to the hotel side of the road without driving along the seafront for half a mile to find an island.  When you eventually get to the hotel, there is no hotel car park so follow the P signs for normal parking, turn left at the entrance to the hotel, and immediate…

title: Nice hotel
review: Stayed at the hotel for three nights at the end of the November, the location of the hotel is very good, only ten minutes of walk from the city center. The airport bus terminates right cross the road of the hotel. (2€ single way, takes 30 minutes). You won’t miss the hotel as it right next to the Bullring. However, it took me a while to find the hotel entry as the door was not very noticeable for a 4 star hotel.  The gentleman at the reception was polite but wasn’t very informative, so I had to go back asking a few question about hotel facilities such as the health club and check out time (which was printed on the key card holder though but I didn’t read)    The room 206 was clean and nicely decorated, I love the Picasso’s paintings in the room and on the hallway despite is not…

title: Excellent hotel in good location
review: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning of December for 5 nights.  It is in an excellent location close to the Old Town, The Alcazabar and the newly built Marina with a choice of excellent restaurants.  The hotel is extremely clean and the staff are very friendly.  If you go for a higher floor, you will have the most amazing views across Malaga and the habour.  A good choice of food at breakfast, both hot and cold buffet in a lovely dining room.

title: Good 4 stars hotel in the center not far from the beach.
review: We've stayed for one night at this hotel after 10 hights in Marbella & before flying home.  Very decent hotel. Really 4 stars. Located at the very beginning of the central park of Malaga, which runs the entire length of the city parallel to the waterfront. If you go down just short of the hotel you will take  to the beach Malaguetta. Opposite the hotel there is a supermarket & many cafes and restaurants are nearby. Small cozy room. The bathroom has everything, even if you forgot your toothbrush, toothpaste, comb. All this can be found here.  Breakfast is good, not too many options, but you wouldn't be left hungry. Nice and cozy restaurant. Directly behind the hotel is the old Bullring.  Be sure to visit the Picasso museum and take a sightseeing bus tour.  By the way, the bus…

title: Let down by food
review: I hope this review is balanced. I too was one of the Iglu-ites awaiting the delayed Azamara cruise which finally departed on Nov 17. The hotel is great. good clean rooms and friendly ( mostly ) obliging staff. The location is also great and the traffic noise was worth mild discomfort for the location. The only issue was the food. breakfast was good, lunch Ok and dinner terrible. I had paid a lot of money forntheb2 day stay and Iglu had paid for the other 2 with a handsome payout from Azamara.  What we ended up with was a cut down menu which consisted of warm meat and chips (unlike the city-breakers who faired much better). For the  second 2 days we had an evening buffet which had limited choice and questionable quality. I liked the "a la carte" lamb casserole but after I had it…

title: 1 day MS Maestranza - Malaga
