review: Good hotel for 1 to 4 nights. Location is super. Breakfast is good as well. Spa is not big and do not expect a 4* spa but it's nice to use the small sauna and/or jacuzzi and steamroom. Open from 5 till 10 pm. It's free of charge.

title: Ok but overrated
review: We are awaiting a delayed Azamara cruise departure and iglu made a full board booking for 4 days. Good location, clean,modern friendly and efficiently run.The BIG letdown is the food. For 2 days it was the same limited menu with chips with everything. When I asked for a soup as well as salad I was firmly told this was not allowed. The evening buffet was not much cop either. The hot tub is closed which is just as we'll because I might have ben inclined to poach a bit of salmon in it This is a great shame given the otherwise flawless service..

title: Great Hotel-Nice Dock, Beach, Old Town and City Views
review: I thought the hotel was excellent with excellent staff and views. They have several types of rooms depending on price level, and the room I had on a high floor was wonderfuly huge and extremely confortable with a very large balcony with views of the dock, their stores, beach, old town and the city. The only thing I missed was balcony furniture. They had none, so you have to bring out the room chairs. The weather was very cool, definetely not beach weather, and the beach was nothing to talk about. The breakfast, which was included in my rate, was excellent with a tremendous choice of fruits and cold /hot dishes and champaine. Great way to start the day. The bull ring is directly behind the hotel, closed for the season unfortunely.The front desk staff, Jose Luis was extremely…

title: couple 50s drogheda
review: lovely hotel near port and old town friendly helpful staff on third floor facing busy corner but did not have problem with traffic noise enjoyed rooftop jacuzzi good massage would stay again good value

title: The perfect place for a city break
review: When I start to look for a hotel I always start with the location; but working out the right location in a new town isn't always easy. This one worked out brilliantly; right next to the bullring and very close to the old city sights; indeed - ask for a higher room and you  may well be lucky and get a really great view of the cathedral and Alcazabar (old fortress) on one side and a peek view on the other side. Tall buildings sadly block a perfect view of the sea, but the harbour front can be seen depending what room you have. The hotel is a modern triangular block, but as such is very comfortable.  The hotel lobby is quite small and the tiny lifts are adequate. The reception staff are warm and welcoming and we found people who spoke good English despite our efforts to try and…

title: CHEAP AND CENTRAL HOTEL IN MALAGA
review: Found this hotel in the central area of Malaga which is also very convenient for the airport.  The hotel is comfortable with very friendly, courteous and helpful staff at Reception and in the bar/restaurant.  The price is relatively cheap and the hotel is very close to the port area and the cathedral with a good range of bars and eating places.

title: Perfect location
review: Nice hotel with a small balcony. 5 min walk to the beach, 10 min walk to the old centre with a lot of good restaurants and nice bars. If you get a room overlooking the port, you also got a busy road below. The rooms at the back of the hotel got a wiew to the castle and also the bullring. The rooms are nice, also the bathroom. (with shampoo etc) Staff is friendly, good speaking english. There was no problem for us to check out late - for free. A quiet hotel, with massage, fitnessroom, sauna etc at the top floor, also a sun terrace. Good value for money - will love to stay here again. Taxi station at the backside

title: Gr8 location
review: This hotel is really well located - literally 5 mins to port, beach and the old part of the city.  Many, many good restaurants in the old part of the city.   We loved watching the the liners and ferries/ships around the harbour.  We have stayed in many 4 star hotels in Europe and USA and fail to see how this qualified as 4 star.  The breakfasts is less than mediocre - although the waiter we have had every morning is friendly. The rest of the staff have not been so.  However, because of the good location, and quiet area, we would stay again.

title: No where near a 4 star but ok
review: The location of this hotel is great for sightseeing but not so good for sleeping as its on a very busy road and I have never heard so many sirens in all my life!!  Good points: location, staff, being allowed to check out late (for a small fee), clean Bad points : horrible flimsy small towels, breakfast was limited and repetitive, no tea/coffee making facilities in the room Overall good but never 4 star

title: Location, Location
review: I would not say that this hotel deserves it's four star rating for instance I don't think I have ever before stayed in a hotel where the bar was converted into a breakfast room using patio furniture. That said the breakfast was fine and the coffee was the best from a machine I have tasted. Our room was on the tenth floor and had a great view of the bullring and the castle, the room like the rest of the property was clean and well kept. As others have said the outstanding bonus that this hotel has to offer is its location sitting practically on top off the newly opened port and its shops, bars a and restaurants and only a couple of hundred metres from the beach. An easy 10 minute walk takes you into the old centre off Malaga I can recommend it without hesitation.

title: Honeymoon
review: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon. We booked a junior suite which was large, clean and had plenty of storage. The room had air conditioning which was welcome as the average temperature outside was 30 degrees!! The bathroom was large with his & hers basins and desperate shower and bath. The bed was a king size and was really comfortable, the room was very quiet a night with no noise from other rooms or  from the road.  Breakfast is a buffet affair, you can choose from fried eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, churros, ham's, cheeses, pastry's, yoghurt's and more. The staff were excellent but we had to queue on our last day!! Malaya city centre is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel doesn't have a swimming pool but does have 10 sunbeds on the roof and…

title: Great view, good location, good service, reccomended
review: The Hotel is a few minutes walking from the harbour and the beach of the Malagueta. The service is excellent and the sight amazing if u are on one of the top floors. We were on the 9th floor and could see the "Plaza de Toros" inside, The old city ("Alcazaba"), the sea and a big part of the city centre of Malaga. Absolutely reccomended. Furthermore, as we found an offer (around 65 Euros one night), it was definitely value for money. Unfortunately we did not have the time to try the Spa and the breakfast from the Terrace. Would definitely come back again.

title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Driving Nightmare
review: Hotel itself is very nice, good sized rooms, modern bathroom, nice little balcony with a slight view of the ocean and the harbor. Easy walking distance to beach, variety of restaurants and city center. Trying to access the hotel by car and parking is very challenging and its not helpful when the front desk tells you to pull the car around the corner which turns out to be a one way street going the opposite direction. Would stay at the hotel again but would find another way of getting there.

title: will use it again
review: Very good location (a stone's throw from Malagueta beach, ten minutes walk to the cathedral), and very large room. At the right price this can be an excellent choice.   On the minus side, if you are driving the arrival can be nightmarish, as the hotel sits on a main road where you cannot stop, let alone park, and with one way systems you have to cirlce around to find a spot where to leave it until you can alert the valet parking that you have arrived.  Breakfast is not great if you are health conscious, so next time I'll probably go without breakfast with a better room rate.  On the plus side, rooms are very spacious, the free internet actually works quite well, and even if your room gives on teh main road it is quite.

title: Spacious rooms and ugly breakfast
review: The location of this hotel (where we spent just one night) is excellent, at walking distance both from the city centre and (even closer) from the beach.   The rooms, even the basic ones, while not the newest are extremely spacious and comfortable. Some have views over the bull ring.   There is a lack of parking space, but you can get your car valeted to a parking for a 15 euro fee. The problem is that the entrance of the hotel is right on a main road, with no space where to leave the car while unloading, and if you have the municpal police van right behind you (as we did) it's not fun.  The worst aspect for us was the breakfast, in particular the undrinkable coffee and the below par fruit and juices (particularly galling given the quality of fruit you can find at the Malaga…

title: Nice hotel with great location
review: Nice hotel with perfect location - 5 min. to the beach and 10 min. through a lovely garden/park to the city center. Great view from the terrace on the top floor, where you also find a jacuzzi and a few sunbeds. The breakfast restaurant is a bit small, so you might have to wait a few min. for a table, but there's sofas to wait in and newspapers available. The food variaty is good and the restaurant staff is very friendly. All in all a good choice and I would stay there again.

title: Close to beach and town
review: We stayed here for 5 nights during La Feria the town festival in Malaga. Nice room at the 9th floor with direct view to the bull fight arena. Quite spectacular view. In walking distance to everything: the harbour front, the beach, the city and the museums. Breakfast tradtionelle broad and I would add outstanding. Malaga is not a beach city so in order to go to the beach you a 10 min walk away and you have the ocean and beach in front of you.

title: It's OK, but not a 4 Star.
review: Good bits and bad bits:-  It's situated in the Spanish holiday quarter, so no British chavs to worry about.  The only other Brits were like us, doing a couple or three days of beach after a cruise.  Good rooms, with good air con, although we had twin beds that didn't fasten together, so if you want that "cuddle factor" during the night you will find yourself on the floor!  The Malequeta beach is literally 200 metres from the hotel. (turn left out of the door), and there are plenty of bars/restaurants around the hotel or down by the port. (turn right out of the door, then left at the roundabout)  There is also a great little coffee bar attached to the hotel.  The breakfast in the hotel was average-good, nothing wrong with it at all.  I was at first surprised that the hotel…

title: Lovely hotel in great location
review: We stayed in this hotel in mid May 2012 prior to departing from Malaga on a Royal Caribbean cruise ship.  We stayed two nights and booked a superior room.  The hotel is pretty central without being right in the middle and near all the noise.  One down side though is the rooms which face that back of the hotel directly overlook the bullring - to some that may be an advantage but as an animal lover and one with an abhorence of barbarism and cruelty if there had a been a bull fight on whilst we were there I would probably be writing a very different review!!  (bullfights are, I think on some Sundays).  The taxi from the airport had to drop us on the pavement which wasnt too easy as the traffice was very busy, but it wasnt a problem for us.  The reception staff were friendly and…

title: Will stay there again...
review: Me and my friends stayed at MS Hotel Maestranza for one week, booking three rooms. This hotel is located near Malagueta Beach in Malaga, just 300-400 m away from the beach, and walking distance from city center and very beautiful Paseo del Parque. Staff is very helpful, rooms were clean, good breakfast. Beautiful view from the Hotel`s roof terrace, where you can rest and use sauna and Jacuzzi.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Key Location
review: Spent four nights in this hotel. Room very spacious and clean with large double bed. Located in the middle of some main roads. My previous visits to Spain have taught me that the red lights and pedestrian crossings are optional to traffic so extra caution is required when crossing the roads.  However this hotel is well located for what the city has to offer. The beach is 5 minutes away as is the restaurants and marina and shops. At night at the marina there is also a craft market selling jewelry and paintings.  A fifteen minute walk through the gardens or along the marina takes you to the main town. Top tip from me is don't go out to eat until about 22.00hrs as that is when the atmosphere in the town gets going.  The staff at reception are very helpful if you need to ask…

title: Good location for beach bullring and new port bars and shops
review: Business style hotel with good location to see malaga over looking bullring and very close to beach and port bars hotel bar limited and good for a bed, hotel has a small gym and sun terrace facilities limited parking nearby prob closer to 3 than 4 stars

title: Great location and very smart hotel
review: This is a good hotel and it's location means the old centre, the two castles, the beach and the marina are all walkable. It is on a busy roundabout so there is traffic noise, but it is not too intrusive. A roof-top sun lounge gives great views of most of Malag. The rooms are large and smartly decorated. The staff were always very helpful. I would go back here.

title: Centrally located, high end hotel
review: I would give it a 4.5 stars if possible. Location, amenities, access and service were great.  The views of the Alcazar from the balcony were a plus, since one of our rooms looked out to that side. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. We did not eat any other meals here, so not sure how good the restaurant was or if there was one.  The food places nearby were pricey and not good value.  I would have liked if the hotel had a list of recommended eating places by price category.  Not a beach resort, but 2 blocks from the beach. One of the reasons I did not give them a five star rating is that they do not have a restroom/bathroom/clean up area on the reception floor although they are so close to a beach.  All the sand and water could be dealt with much better if they had…

title: Good stopping off point
review: After some 15 hours on a succession of planes we were glad to find the hotel although it is not easy to stop outside to unload. However the staff were ready to assist very promptly. The rooms are well equipped, WiFi included and are of a reasonable size. The hotel buffet breakfast was excellent .The hotel is very well located close to the Alcazar,the Bull Ring and the harbourside promenade. There are several restaurants nearby and the concierge will readily make recommendations. Perhaps not ideal for a long term stay The Maestranza is perfect for a short stopover in Malaga.

title: Maestranza hotel great find
review: My husband and I just came back from spending three weeks in Europe, one of these week we spent at Malaga at them Maestranza Hotel. We had a great experience the hotel rooms were large for European standards and very clean the bathroom toiletry package included :disposable tooth bruch and toothpaste sheaving kit and great soap, shampoos and lotions. We had a room on the eight floor with a partial view of the Mediterranean ocean and a great city view. The location of the hotel is phenomenal it is a block from the beach and the pier 1 where a number of shops and restaurants are located. If you are taking a cruise out of Malaga this is the closest hotel to the pier you may want to walk to the pier or if you want a taxi the fare is  5 Euros. The personnel is multilingual and very…

title: Hotel Ms Maestranza
review: Very much enjoyed this hotel.This hotel is situated just outside the city centre approximately a ten minute walk.In the opposite direction it is a five minute walk to the beach. In my opinion this hotel is perfectly situated for tourists and the airport bus stop is just across the road.The rooms are very well furnished with plenty of room and cleaned very well daily. We had great views over the harbour and also over the old bull ring and the castle and dome in the background.The staff are friendly and helpful.I can not comment on the restaurant because I wanted to try a few restaurants in the old city that were recommended to us which I found to be excellent.Over all we were very happy that we chose this hotel for our three night visit to Malaga and would fully recommend this…

title: Malaga weekend
review: The hotel is in a good location about 5-10mins walking from the main shopping areas. It's also about 5 mins from the beach and across the road from the airport bus drop off point. We had bed only, breakfast is usually cheaper in a cafe of which there were several around the hotel. We did not have dinner preferring to sample the local restaurants. There is a sun deck on the roof of the hotel. Staff were helpful. This is a good hotel to use as a base for exploring malaga and its surrounds.

title: good location, value for money with easy access to everything
review: especially good if you are getting on/off a cruise. has great views and is v comfortable.

title: wonderful!!!
review: we just returned from a three night stay at this wonderful hotel! when we checked in we requested a room on a higher floor, which had amazing views over looking the bullring, the hotel staff were so friendly especially salvador who spoke perfect english! the beach is a five minute walk, the old town 10 mins through the park, lots of bars and tapas restuarants, we thought the hotel was fantastic and will be visiting again next year!!!

title: Location, Location, Location
review: Stayed here for 3 nights and was very impressed. From the airport just hop on the express bus "A" (2 euros with plenty of space inside for luggage), get of at last stop and you are there. Within a couple of minutes walk you have the trendy vibrant new port area with a good selection of bars, shops, and restaurants. and In the other direction within a few minutes walk theres a good selection of the more traditional type of tapas bars and restraurants. Here we had good meals at La Mensula and Gastroteca de Redding. We were suprised how good the nearby long  beach was.  Breakfast was good especially the chilled cava. We enjoyed the rooftop jacuzzi and sun terrace. We had good views from our 10th floor balcony (ask for a high room if you want views). Its a shame they dont supply…

title: Good hotel in excellent position
review: Just spent very comfortable 3 night stay here.  Loved the location at the end of the central park and overlooking the bullring and castle.  Ten minute and very lovely stroll through the park, palm and rose gardens to old town centre. 2 minutes from beach and some very good bars and restaurants close to hand.  Rooms are very comfortable, intelligently laid out and well designed even if the colour/decor is  a little past its prime.  Great bathroom with powerful shower.  Staff are very efficient and helpful.  Yes there is quite a bit of traffic and there may be noise (joyful tooting on car horns and fire works in May).  Triple glazing to rooms however and that's the spanish for you - love a fiesta.   Good and varied breakfast choice included in our deal (although others are right,…

title: Beautiful Hotel!!!
review: I really loved this hotel, right in the Center of Malaga city!  The staff was OK, I thought to work in the hotel industry you would need to speak English, very hard to communicate with them, the girl that worked there was friendly but she could speak pretty good, too bad she wasn't there too much! The price was right at $99 a night & so close to the Centro Area, right in front of the Castle & fort & cathedral, beautiful City & 5 minutes from our cruise ship! I would recommend this hotel & would stay again & be aware of the communication, I know now! Very comfy beds & very clean!!

title: Clean, modern hotel in good position
review: We stayed at the Maestranza for 1 night on our way from Granada to Malaga airport and have no complaints at all. The hotel is in a good position near the beach and the Moorish fort and has good sound proofing so there was no traffic noise. A big advantage was the fact that the airport express bus stopped close by. We didn't take the breakfast (14 euro) but used the excellent cafe next door.

title: Doherty - Ireland
review: We were on hols in Spain for 1 week and spent first 2 nights in this hotel.  Reception staff and Breakfast staff were v friendly and helpful.  The hotel is situation v well and is only a 10 min wal from the centre of the old town.  We hired bicycles while we were there and found it v easy to negotiate the city - the spanish are v tolerant of cyclists and have v good cycle ways. The room and bathroom were v clean, breakfast plentiful and good.  We were so pleased with this hotel we arranged to spend our last there also.

title: Very Nice Location In Malaga
review: Just got back from one night in Malaga. The hotel is in a great location, close to the beach but also a 15 minute walk to the Cathedral. As luck would have it, we were there on Easter Sunday, so we were able to see the processions. We also had a room with a view of the bullring and were able to watch the bullfights from the balcony.  We paid 108 EUR for a roomy junior suite. The room and bathroom were modern. We found it to be a great value. They even valet parked our car for us! I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking to be close to the beach and the tourist area.

title: 50th Birthday Celebration
review: Visited this hotel in mid Feb for my sister's 50th Birthday celebration. First impressions were good as the reception staff were very friendly and very efficient.  Rooms were spacious and clean.   Bathrooms also.   We had rooms with a balcony overlooking the bullring.   The location of the hotel is perfect. It is right beside the port with its many restaurants and it is only a 10 minute walk from the centre of Malaga through the park to the old town.  I think some of the taxi drivers thought we were mad looking for a taxi to take us just around the corner but they eventually humoured us and earned money for driving round a very short block!!!!  My sister's birthday fell on the Saturday.  Her friends had arranged for a "special Breakfast"   The staff had put up the balloons and…

title: Superb value for money
review: My girlfriend and I went to Malaga for our one year anniversaray and we stayed at this hotel. From the moment we went in we were happy with the very helpful staff at reception. The first night we arrived it was raining and we didn't know where to go and the staff member kindly pointed us to some very nice restaurants. This made me feel comfortable about going to reception for any other questions we had. We went to them numerous of times and each time they were very helpful showing us on maps locations we could go to meet our requirements.  The rooms have a balcony they are very clean. There was a little dirt in the bath when we arrived but it was not something we were going to kick up fuss over.  Location wise the hotel is perfect. It's right beside the port which boasts some…

title: Great Location
review: My wife and I had a three night break at this hotel,we found the location ideal for both the city, beach and marina.The hotel was modern and clean and the staff friendly and helpful. I took the advice given on here and booked a room overlooking the bull ring and we were not dissapointed.If returning to Malaga we would definately book again.

title: Brilliant Holiday
review: Stayed here for a week in September last year. Staff very friendly and rooms modern and clean. Taking our cue from Trip Advisor we requested a room overlooking the Bull Ring and were not disappointed. The location was fabulous and we really enjoyed the walk through the park to the old town. We loved the old town with its marble pavements, lively tapas bars and interesting , well- designed museums. Malaga was a revelation easily as good a destination as the more famous Barcelona.

title: Great view
review: Enjoyed our stay on 10 th floor  in february with views of the bullring ,fortress and the ocean. Whilst it is a 10 min walk from the old city it is a convenient location. We ate breakfast at the bakery next door. The bar in the hotel is excellent yet you could miss it as it is hidden away. From the airport bus A was so simple to get from outside the baggage terminal and it drops you at the roundabout  50 meters from the hotel make sure you stay on the bus until  the last stop, don't get out at the bus terminal . The other buses have been easy to get around on for  1.20 euros. Bus 35 at the back of the bull ring takes you up the top of Gibralfaro if you don't want to do the steep walk.  Unfortunately we were not able to use the rooftop spa especially after all the walking that we…

title: Great location
review: Stayed here over New Year and choose this one mainly because of the good reviews and the location.It is perfectly positioned mid way between the beach and the old town. The weather was great so it was nice to have a mornings stroll down the promenade. As others have said, there are some really good restaurants on the street behind the hotel by the bull ring. Places you wouldn't have found staying in the centre. Apart from the bakery we also used a really nice cafe bar on Paseo de Reding on the corner at the opposite side of the bull ring. We turned up one night halfway through a football match between Real Madrid and Malaga and despite it being really busy the bar staff moved tables and chairs so we could have a drink and see the game. We had breakfast there too occasionally.…

title: First class hotel
review: This was a top notch place to stay in Malaga.  It is in a great location for sight seeing and is near the beach if that is your interest.  The view from the back side rooms overlooks the Bullring and the Castillo de Gibralfaro dating to the 10th century.  (worth a steep walk up to watch the sunset and get great views).  The staff spoke perfect English and the WiFi worked great/  The rooms are large and modern and tastefully appointed.  We only stayed one night but if this city gets on my radar again I'll certainly come back here.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Had a good weekend in November staying at this hotel.  Since we were not familiar with Malaga we just picked a hotel on a whim.  Great choice!  Very clean, good location, friendly staff.  Only negative was that we were not able to utilize the roof terrace and spa during our stay.  Another reason to have to go back to this gorgeous city!

title: Wonderful Stopover
review: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Maestranza Hotel in Malaga for 4 days this past November (2011). The Hotel was in a perfect location for a stopover while waiting to board our 13 day transatlantic cruise from Malaga to San Juan.  The front desk staff were excellent and could not have been more helpful. Even with a bit of a language barrier ( they were better at english than I was at Spanish ) they went out of their way to make our stay in their beautiful hotel memorable. The bar staff in the small lounge were equally friendly and entertaining.  The hotel itself is wiithin walking distance of many of the city's attractions, and with the bullfight ring ( I am not a fan and there were no fights during our stay ) beside the hotel the ambience was amazing.   Will most…

title: Enjoyable stay
review: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights before our cruise and I thought it was a really nice hotel. When we first arrived I did think that it was quite small but once we got to our room I changed my opinion as the room was really spacious.  We had a lovely room on the top floor which I had asked for.  It had a huge balcony plus a window on the side overlooking the bullring. Check in was quick with very friendly reception staff. Breakfast was ok, Nice to have a glass of Cava in the morning. There was quite a good selection, both hot and cold, not sure about the chocolate fountain!   We had lovely walks along the seafront and in to the city center and to the cathedral which was only about 15 minutes away.   As previous reviewer said there is a really lovely cafe next to the…

title: could be better
review: the small gloomy entrance to this big hotel summed it up,as everywhere was small and gloomy!!!! stylish and clean with friendly staff and a good breakfast good location on the map but opposite a noisy building site and even on the twelfth floor the noise from the traffic was very bad just the same on the roof where you were also plagued with flies and there were just a few token loungers no chairs on your balcony either we got there on sunday and the jacuzzi was closed on other days only open five hours and then you had to as all the corridors in darkness unless you kept moving to keep them on felt oppressive and mean in a four star hotel  just all felt like it was in an out of season resort witheverything being run on a bare minimum except for the breakfast and the lovely staff

title: Four Days In Spain
review: My sister and I took a side trip to Spain while visiting family in Paris.  Short airpland trip to Malaga, we were pleasantly surprised with the efficient transportation in the city, we were very pleased with the accomodations at MS Maestranza.  We were very comfortable in the room, it was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the shower was superb.  There were alot of amenities in the basket on the sink vanity. It was very convenient to travel from this location.  The front desk was always attended and they spoke perfect English when assisting us. I would stay there again if visiting Malaga.  There was a grocery store across the street to pick up water and soda.  We went to the restaurant one night and it was excellent. They also have a bar in the restaurant where you can relax…

title: Great location and breakfast!
review: Great hotel - location was perfect for us.  Bus stop opposite for airport bus (it's the last stop on the line and right by a roundabout so easy to know when to get off) and it's a lovely 5-10 min stroll through the botanic gardens right into the heart of Malaga old town.  We had a great room with a balcony overlooking the sea, the castillo and the bull ring! Breakfast was wonderful and very fresh and a great selection. There's also a wonderful coffee shop underneath the hotel at pavement level - it does the best cakes and pastries ever - plus is open until about 9pm ish for coffees etc.

title: Five night break
review: My wife and I have just returned form a five day break at the Maestranza.  We originally decided to stay at the Monte which is No 1 on tripadvisor.  However, we were glad we didn't having popped into the Monte whilst visiting Malaga we found the walk into town is anything but picturesque, where the walk into town from the Maestranza is through the most beautiful park/boulevard.  We found the beds very comfortable if a little hard.  We stayed on the eight floor, but could still smell the occasional waft of car fumes drifting into the room but, as the hotel is right next to a very busy main road this was to be expected.  Breakfast was excellent particularly the fresh fruit orange juice which unlike most hotels of this class now seem to opt for the cheapest alternative.   If you…

title: A smelly place to stay
review: We stayed at the hotel MS Maestranza for one night, our last night in Spain and thank God! This place had its heyday and the management haven't bothered to renovate or modernise. That'd be forgiven if it had character but it doesn't. The rooms and bedding smelt bad and looked old.  On the plus side, the hotel is well located; it's close to Alcazaba, the beachfront and overlooks the bullring. There's also a supermarket just opposite for any essentials. The hotel has free wireless internet access too.

title: "Well located hotel"
review: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased with the hotel.  It is well located, within easy walking distance to the centre of Malaga and also the beach. We stayed on the sixth floor and had a stunning view across the city and the Alcazaba. The room was clean and toiletries were replenished daily. Breakfast was very good and consisted of a continental buffet and a hot breakfast. The staff were friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Well located hotel near the bull ring
review: We stayed at the hotel in October. It is well located near the plaza de toros, though it is a bit of a step to the city centre. Parking costs €14 a night but is straightforward enough. You park the car at the from of the hotel, hand the keys over at reception and the staff do the rest.  Our room was on the eight floor, but there was never much of a delay accessing it as there were two lifts in operation.   Our room had a balcony overlooking the bull ring. It was well furnished and wifi acess was useful and available at no extra charge. The limited number of plug sockets available might though be a negative for the business rap traveller.  The bathroom was well appointed with plentiful supplies of toiletries, though, in the morning, presumably because of high demand the water…

title: excellent location
review: stayed here for 4 nights and really liked it. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was modern had a good bath in to wind down in at the end of the day. The view was lovely and it had a nice little balcony to sit on and view the castle. Free wifi in the room was a big bonus for me. The staff were very polite and friendly and even when the restaurant was not open they cooked a meal of our choice for us which was very kind and it was excellent. the only downside was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room which I thought was very unusual. great value for money though and in an excellent location for getting anywhere but walkable to most places of interest. i would stay there again when i visit malaga

title: Good value
review: It really nice hotel... great location... my room was facing the Arena.. clean and quite room i highly recommend this hotel

title: Lovely Hotel
review: We stayed 4 nights and were pleased with the hotel. Well located - easy walking distance to centre of Malaga or the beach. Nice, well appointed rooms, with free wi-fi only let down by no tea and coffee facilities. Views from the room fantastic.

title: Outstanding Hotel
review: We have just returned from a six night stay at the MS Maestranza.  From the moment we checked in, everything was perfect.  It started with a free glass of cava each on check in, and the check in itself was effortless.  We requested a room high up and with a view of the bullring, which we got. The view across the city and of Azcabillia was outstanding.  We didn't have breakfast here, but as others have said, there is a wonderful bakery next to the hotel which we visited each morning for coffee and croissant.  There were some great tapas bars nearby, but make sure you brush up on your Spanish first, as a lot of locals don't speak English.  Location was perfect for the beach and the city, and we didn't need to take a taxi at all once we got in from the airport.  We would definitely…

title: Nice well placed hotel
review: We stayed 3 nights in the end of July in a room on the 8th floor with a great city view. The room was small, but clean and with sufficient equipment so as free internet, safe, aircondition and a nice bathroom with many toilet articles. Our stay included a very good breakfast buffet. The hotel is well located near the beach and easy to reach from the airport. Take the Express Bus line A to the end station – Plaza de General Torrijos. From the bus stop the hotel is just on the other side of the roundabout. Overall the hotel gives you good value for the money.

title: great location!
review: The Hotel MS Maestranza is located just 5 minutes from the city beach (La Malagueta). This is a very nice beach, with rental sunbeds (cheap!) and a few nice beach restaurants where you can eat fish fresh from the grill. To the city center it's just a leisurely 10 minutes walk through a nice little park. We had just the room, no breakfast, which is a good choice because on the corner of the block there's a bakery which serves excellent cafe con leche and fresh baked croissants and baguettes. So if you're not into a big breakfast buffet just walk to the corner and have a nice little breakfast with the locals. The hotelroom was very nice, with a balcony overlooking the harbour. The rooms have double glazed windows which is very nice as traffic in Spain goes on through the night.…

title: Good view
review: Comfortable room with a balcony from which it was possible to admire the bullfighting ring and Gibralfaro. Close to the airport buses and the beach. City centre within walking distance. Good service with complimentary cava on arrival. Excellent breakfast buffet. Very friendly staff. Rooftop spa and sundeck. I would gladly stay here again. I really liked the hotel and the city of Málaga.

title: Comfortable and homely
review: Booked here for a night before flight home after a holiday in Andulacia. Close to the beach it would suit those seeking a beach holiday. Reception staff were friendly and helpful.   The room was a little on the small side and the decor somewhat "tired". The hotel spa was not available.  Overall an average stay in an average hotel.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
review: Stayed here for a week's family holiday. Two rooms on 9th floor which were far enough away from traffic noise.  It really is a 3 minute walk to the beach and a 5 minute walk to the old town.  The staff were friendly and helpful and despite other comments here we found the level of english at Reception was good. We had a hire car. There was no parking at the hotel and no where to park on the street at the front of the hotel. The hotel arranged parking for Eur 14 a day. I parked at the back of the hotel outside the Bull ring then gave the key to Reception who drove it away to a nearby Carpark. When I wanted to use the car I told reception and they brought the car again to the Bull ring. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes all times of day and evening, although I never tried…

title: Overall a somewhat disappointing stay
review: This is a nice hotel and the location is not bad.  Friendly and helpful staff. Within walking distance of the main shopping street, the cathedral, the castle and the Picasso museum (don't expect much breathtaking there!).  The rooms are clean and comfortable and well appointed but compared to other hotels we stayed in during our trip to Spain I find it a bit overpriced.  Service is good, breakfast not so for the price.  However there is a restaurant that serves breakfast just down the street called The Bilmore which is excellent. The hotel is not far from the beach, but it is not a very nice one to look at and, if you expect a choice of outdoor restaurants or cafes nearby, you will be very disappointed as there are few if any and I am sure that the 2 or 3 we found are not known…

title: GREAT LOCATION SOLID HOTEL
review: A very nice experience, friendly and efficient staff, very good views. Good clean and very functional rooms - not luxurious but a very solid feeling. Great value for money. Gym and Spa not that good. Location excellent.

title: Fit for purpose
review: We stayed with a couple of guys in Malaga for three nights.  The hotel fit the purpose, close to the old town, a nice cafe at the corner and a supermarket on the other end of the street and walking distance to the beach (although you find the nicer beaches further along up the coast near calle Bolivia). Taxis cost next to nothing.  The rooms were quite ok, although the air-conditioning made a smell at the beginning. The hotel could improve the layout of the bathroom though, as the toilet is placed almost against the wall, making it uncomfortable. Beds were a bit tough though. Personnel was very friendly.  Annoying incident occured at night though, when one of the neighbours decided to watch the telly with at volume 100 in the middle of the night. Some banging back at the wall…

title: Perfect location for beach and city
review: Stayed in the Hotel for six nights for bed and breakfast at a reasonable price for the quality of the room and breakfast. I am not surprised it so highly ranked here on trip advisor. I am delighted that i stayed at this hotel.   The hotel is situated in the Old part of town a two minute walk from the beach. Their is also a terrace roof with sun beds, jacuzzi and steam rooms. The jacuzzi and steam rooms are open from 4.30pm to 9.30pm every day.   The breakfast is a buffet continental and hot breakfast. You have a very good variety of food on offer, cheeses, salamis, proschutio di parma etc. They have a choice of a number of cereals as well. Their is a huge selection of pastries and fresh fruit. With a chocolate fountain with skewers of fresh fruit for any chocolate lovers. The…

title: Beautiful hotel in great location!
review: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for four nights and we truly enjoyed it! The room was very clean, spacious, and had all the amenities you could want.  We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was very good, but a little on the expensive side.  We really loved being so close to both the beach and the historic area, the best of both! No alarm clock in the room, so set your watch or travel clock carefully when you arrive (we were on the wrong time for 3 days before we figured it out hahahaha).  All in all, a lovely hotel in a convenient, safe area.

title: Strange Problem
review: We spent 3 days at the Hotel Maestranza and, overall, we have to agree with other reviewers. It is a lovely place and our room, per our request, overlooked the bull ring and the Alcazaba. It was clean and the staff, for the most part, seemed quite interested in our satisfaction.  We did have one strange thing occur. We booked a tour to Granada on Friday and left the hotel around 7:10 in the morning. We returned at 6:15 that night to a room that hadn't been touched - bed not made, no fresh towels, soap, etc. We called the front desk and did receive fresh towels and soap within 45 minutes.  Upon checking out on Saturday, I mentioned to the lady at the front desk that our room hadn't been cleaned on Friday. She spent a minute at the computer and told me that room service personnel…

title: Great location
review: Simple, clean, modern hotel. Within 10min of the beach. Parisian-style cafe next door. Taxi rank outside the door. Alongside the Bullring. Rooms beautiful and clean. Super air-conditioning. A little noisy as it is situated near a busy roundabout but we had no difficulty sleeping. Drinks in the bar a little expensive but plenty choice nearby for food and drink. We didn't eat in the hotel. No swimming pool if you're into that sort of thing - didn't bother us. Just a leisurely 15min stroll to Old Town. Taxi to airport €20-22, takes 15min. We will definately go back

title: A great hotel in a great location.
review: If you are going to Malaga for a few days or as we did for a week, choose The Maestranza Hotel as your base to enjoy this fabulous city. The hotel has excellent accommodation in a great location. Ten minutes walk through a lovely park to get to the centre of the city and great shopping, sight seeing and restaurants. Two minutes walk to the beach. We were in a junior suite which was very spacious. on the eleventh floor with no noise from the street below. We had a small balcony which overlooked the front of the hotel and gave fabulous views over the city. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious, modern and clean. It had two wash hand basins a large bath and a large shower. The room was serviced each day. The hotel has a restaurant, although we only had…

title: Fabulous hotel, great location, amazing City
review: We managed to 'dump' the kids and nip away for a short City break in Malaga, where we were fortunate enough to stay at the Hotel Maestranza. Well, what a fabulous find this place was!! Superbly located, being just 100m from the beach and a ten minute stroll (or seven minutes through the smelly tunnel) to the wonders of the Old Town, it had everything we were looking for - a lovely roof-top terrace for late-afternoon sunbathing, a nice jacuzzi, a handy little gym, superb views of the Bull Ring, both castles and a glimpse of the beach too! It also had a bar and a restaurant though we confess we didn't go to these - but we did go to the cafe just outside each morning for some delicious coffee and bakery. One day, we even ordered some take away rolls filled with cheese, ham, etc,…

title: Excellent location, friendly service, good all around hotel.
review: The title says it all. Good clean hotel situated in a fantastic location to explore this friendly city. The down side is if you drive. Parking is difficult to find without paying, the hotel charged us 14 euros with valet service which we tought was good value considering we paid 21 euros by ourselves at the same car park. One little note: try the little coffee/bakery shop under the hotel, lovely pastries and coffee.

title: Average
review: Rooms are decent size, loads of toiletries are complimentary. Little balcony in, I think, every room.  The gym is completely overrated and unusable, disappointing as this is always one of the things I look for when booking a hotel. The rooftop has nice views and several deck chairs.  There is no pool. My bed linen was very torn but I forgot to take a photo for proof.

title: Great base for city exploration
review: We booked a no-smoking room for 3 adults 8 months prior to trip and the hotel had the correct paperwork ready for us when we arrived.  The hotel building is a little difficult to find due to one-way roads, but follow the hotel signs on the street.  The staff was courteous and knowledgable.  The room was divided in two with a partial wall; the bathroom had a jacuzi tub.  The room was comfortable for 3 adults.  The hotel is next to the bullring.  The Alcazaba is a 10 minute walk from the hotel.   There is a public parking underground garage within a 5 minute walk of the hotel, an ATM and mini-market across the street, and an awesome bakery next to the hotel.  We woke up to the smell of fresh baked bread!  The hotel is about a 25 minute drive from the airport.  We would stay here…

title: Checked All My Boxes for Perfect Hotel - Location+Price+Service
review: -- Catch "A" Bus right outside Baggage Claim. 2 Euro to Plaza de Torrijos (last stop) 25 minutes. -- Staff really friendly and knowledgable, Choose high floor for less street noise (Floors 10-12) -- Rooms decent size with nice fixtures in bath, plenty of hot water and high quality toiletries and great balconies -- 3 Blocks from beach - free glass of Cava on arrival -- Fridge and minibar in room but no coffee/tea facilities -- Excellent air conditioning - easy to control -- Great French cafe next door with breakfast breads/pastries to die for and great coffee -- Really clean -- Value for money. -- Wireless internet good signal and fast in Room 1106 -- I left computer charger in room and they mailed it immediately - I was impressed. -- I will stay here again for sure

title: Overall, very good hotel.
review: This hotel is a less-than-4euro taxi ride from the main shopping area of Malaga, and close to the beach. It has a very small entrance and I wasn't expecting the 4 steps up to the reception. It is the (internally) quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. I was on the 11th floor. There was no noise from slamming doors, no voices, no lift noise, no sounds from cleaners, from rooms next door, above or below. There were always plenty of people around at breakfast. I was beginning to think they'd put me there in isolation! There was traffic noise from outside, but closing the balcony door stopped it, if necessary.  The room was OK, but not as nicely decorated as the photos on the website. The pillow was a bit hard and I couldn't get my neck comfortable, but that may say more about my neck…

title: Great stay in Malaga, great hotel
review: Stayed here in May 2011 for 2 nts after a repositioning cruise.  The staff was very helpful.  I've travelled extensively in different parts of the world, and was pleasantly surprised with the room.  The bathroom was exceptional, the room spacious enough, and the view from the balcony was a million dollar view.  The best part of this hotel, though, is its location.  Literally a 5-min walk to the beach, and a very easy 15-min walk into the central district.  When I come back to Malaga, I will definitely stay in this hotel.

title: great location, stunning views
review: Very nice, clean hotel.  Small rooms, but updated and cute.  We had a view right over the bull ring, with the castle to the left and the ocean to the right of it, amazing!! and we didn't even have an upgraded room, just the lowest price I could find on hotels.com.   The only problem was the rooms were a bit noisy, we could hear people walking in the halls and the elevator and one night the front desk called to tell us to be quiet when we were up late watching t.v.!  Anyway, great location, beautiful views.  A long but beautiful walk to the city center, but doable and very close to the beach.   Amazing views from the rooftop "spa" area.  The spa was tiny, indoors and luke warm.

title: A gem in Malagas crown!
review: The initial purpose for our trip was a mini hen party for me and my best friend who is getting married next month.  The plan was to catch some sun and enjoy cocktails in the evening.  However, by the time the trip came round I was 5 months pregnant and having a wild time involved staying up past 10.30pm!   The hotel was perfect for our relaxing short break.  3 minutes walk to the beach and 10 minutes into the city centre the hotel was well placed.  It is on a busy road which can be a bit noisey but it is to be expected in the city.  The staff were excellent and couldnt be more helpful.  We used the spa facilities daily and found it to be a relaxing break.  A taxi rank is right by the hotel and to the airport is only 20euros.   The city centre has a wide selection of shops and…

title: Comfortable hotel in good location for beach and city attractions
review: Excellent location for a city break in Malaga.  Very helpful staff at check in - room was ready from 11:30am.  Modern very clean room (junior suite) with jacuzzi bath and separate shower.  Comfortable king bed, good double glazing eliminates 90% of busy street noise below.  Roof top terrance with great views of city and also down into the adjacent bull fighting ring.  Sun beds were very welcome to relax on after walking to city attractions.  Good breakfast.  Bar good for pre/post dinner drinks.  Also try La Mensula restaurant (less than 5 mins walk away) - see separate review.

title: nice hotel very clean, 5mins from coast fifteen mins walk to old town.
review: hotel was clean, very pleasant, and although five or six floors high,at this time of year seemed small and cosy. Staff friendly.  Menu not very big, but may be better later  in the year. However couple of nice restaurants nearby, if you leave hotel and turn left towards coast. Rooms well tended, very clean. We sunbathed on the roof terrace beside fitness suite. Small supermarket across the road.  although it seems far away from everything it is not.  very short walk along beautiful gardens to old town. good shopping area. Go to tourist office at end of these gardens, as there are interesting things to see. Downside -Main road will be noisy if you are on low floor.  Restaurant soundproofed but rooms not.

title: loved malaga - excellent and excellent location!!
review: great hotel in a great location - next to the bullring, 2mins walk from the beach and close to the castle entrance - although it is a long walk up!! you will need good shoes for that!  and water.  the town with great shops such as zara and mango is only about a 10 mins walk from the hotel and it has enough restaurants and little tapas bars for any occasion! there are hundreds! the cathedral is amazing and the picasso museum is worth a look. hotel is lovely and our room was great - i would say request a room on a high floor though as the traffic is non stop and so could affect your sleep. not the hotel's faulty - just alot of traffic.  you can get the A bus straight from the airport to the town - get off at the last stop and you are 2 mins from the hotel. you will see the hotel…

title: Quality Hotel with friendly staff
review: Enjoyed our stay. Good surroundings and very friendly staff. Nice breakfast but pricey if not included on your tarrif. Nice bar/lounge with reasonable prices and welcoming staff. It's a 10 minute walk to the centre of Malaga through pleasant gardens. There are a couple of excellent Italian restaurants close to the hotel. Trastavere and La Romantica. La Romantica in particular was enjoyable - very lively and full of locals(always a good sign) Excellent food and friendly staff. The airport bus (A) terminates just outside the hotel and runs every 1/2 hour. Takes about 30 minutes and costs 2 euros.  There is a Taxi rank just outside the hotel. Taxis are plentiful and inexpensive. The taxi to the bus or train station costs about 5euros. There were 4 of us so it was virtually the same…

title: Nice hotel with friendly staff
review: We stayed the last week of October 2010. After our arrival we could immediate have a small lunch. No problem to serve allthough it was a strange time (for Dutch) to eat, 3.30 pm. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Not everybody speaks English very well, but enough to help you out. {My Spanish sucks :-)} Our room was very clean. Also during our stay no complaints about it. Actually, i would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Malaga. Just outside the centre, 300 mtr of Malagueta beach and with a nice view on the Alcazaba and Gibalfaro fortress.

title: A gem of a city in Southern Spain
review: The MS Maestranza is well located, close to the Malagueta Beach, the harbor and about 10 minutes to the Old Town area and Cathedral along Paseo Parque. It is a very pretty walk along a  large beautiful semi tropical park.  Be sure to request a room on the side of the Plaza de Toros. it is very quiet and you will also have a view of the castle Gibralfaro and  the park leading to the old town. Just down the street from the hotel is a fantastic Indian restaurant , named Taj Palace. Also in the same area, a little closer to the beach is Pizza Pino. Ask the hotel desk for directions.  The staff there are very helpful in every way!!  Be sure to eat some of the Andulusian Bread called " Mollete".

title: Business class comforts with the personal touch
review: Excellently equipped hotel with all the facilities but managing to retain a personal touch - the friendly Reception staff were only too pleased to let us check in early. The location may seem like it's a bit out of the centre but it's only a (very pleasant) 10 minute walk to the Cathedral and the Airport Express bus starts from the Plaze De General Torrijos roundabout right outside. Some great value advance rates can be found - we paid 70 euro for a double.

title: Excellent Value and Quality
review: Selected on reviews for a long weekend with friends in Malaga. Not disappointed! Friendly staff, well appointed rooms and good facilities. Very convenient to see the City and for the beach!

title: Pleasant enough but nothing special
review: Stayed here bookending a cruise recently. This hotel was chosen because on a map it looks close to the cruise ships. There's a lot of reconstruction going on though, so it wasn't as convenient as we thought.  The hotel staff are great, very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. There's a rooftop spa with small gym (didn't use) and sun lounging area with views over the city and part of the port. Rooms - you need to be careful as lower floors are subject to traffic noise which goes on 24/7 as the hotel entrance opens on to a busy main road. We enjoyed the use of two rooms on different dates. We can recommend floors 10 and up facing the hills, very peaceful. Generally well equipped and clean, there's nothing to complain about here. Don't go for floor 2 facing the bullring and…

title: Very good value
review: Arrived there at 9.30 am after leaving a cruise expecting to leave our luggage and check in later that day, the very friendly receptionist told us our room was ready and we could check in right away, and have a rest as we had been up for hours. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Breakfast was a little pricy at €14 pp but a buffet style, edible but basic. Bus to airport just across the street for €2 each compared to €30 in a taxi, bus runs every 30 mins, and a timer tells u when next bus is due, bus takes 45 mins to get to airport. Lots of little tapas bars and pizza restaurants within walking distance, shopping streets also within walking distance. Definitely will return to this hotel again and will recommend it to my friends.

title: Good hotel, central location
review: The MS Maestranza is a good hotel in a central location for central Malaga and the attractions of the old town. The room we had was excellent, clean, tidy and well maintained. Neither my wife or I made use of any of the spa facilities so we cannot comment on these. We did however use the bar, where the service was sporadic at best. Prices were however pretty reasonable for a hotel. Reception staff were friendly and helpful and provided a tourist map of Malaga on request (which was very useful). Breakfast is overpriced at 14 euros per head. Go into town, you'll get much better value and quality. Our only slight critisism of the hotel (which we were aware of before we left) is that there are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. We would definately stay at the…

title: Great location - Try the rooftop patio!
review: GETTING THERE At the Malaga airport, there is a $2 airport bus (BUS A) which stops at Plaza del General Torrijos (which is across the street from the hotel).  The bus is frequent (every 20 minutes for the most part) and runs close to midnight.  Click here for more information: http://www.malagaairport.eu/buses.php  CHECK-IN Check-in was painless and most of the staff have a basic understanding of English.  The front desk also sells Bus Touristic tickets, which was very handy.  ROOMS The room was large and comfy, containing all standard amenities and more plus a Mini-bar.  RESTAURANT The restaurant is pricey, but we were sickly and ended up eating there quite a bit.  Buffet Breakfast for $14 was overpriced and under-stocked.   BUT I will say that they made a special soup for us…

title: Good choice of hotel for before and after cruise from Malaga.
review: Stayed at Maestranza for 2 nights (Thurs & Fri) before going on 6 night cruise on Sat. Room was good and clean. Lovely bathroom. Location great for beach, port and city centre. Taxi rank at back of hotel so no problems getting into centre for evening meals. Breakfast had good choices especially fresh fruit. Before leaving for cruise on Sat. morning,  asked at reception if there was any chance of leaving our luggage there after cruise because we had to be off ship approx 8.30a.m. the following Friday morning and flight home not until 8.30 p.m that evening. They said yes there was no problem with this since we had been guests of the hotel already. Best of all NO CHARGE for doing this! So we had another day in Malaga without bags which were locked in secure room at hotel until our…

title: A great choice
review: Arrived late evening, efficient and very friendly receptionist recommended a tapas bar just around the corner for a late supper. The photos on the web site do not do the hotel justice. Its Picasso theme gave you a gallery of some very interesting prints of the artist's work, complemented by the 'Art Deco' furniture very tastefully furnished and decorated. The en-suite is very well equipped with toiletries, towels etc and plenty of power points for your hair straightners, razors etc. Hair dryer in ensuite is like a normal travel one, so wouldnt take mine if visiting again. Useful safe to use. The rooftop terrace is great for views of the city and castles and it looks directly over the BULLRING! There is a lot of traffic noise but you have to remember this is a working city. It is…

title: Good base for Malaga
review: We've stayed in Malaga on a number of occasions and thought we would give this hotel a try. It's in a good position if you want both a beach and city break, being a 5 minute walk from the beach and a 10 minute walk from the old city. The downside is that the immediate locality is a little scruffy. Everything was absolutely fine but nothing stands out as being especially good.   Just one point, do not take the bus no.19 from the airport. You should take the A bus which you can find immediately outside Arrivals. Both buses leave from the same place but the A bus stops much closer to the hotel.

title: Perfect location!Good hotel!
review: Very good location,just 5min walk to Malagueta beach,10-15min walk to historic city centre.We took bus A from airport whitch is just 2Euro and took aprox.45min while roads was busy(runs every 30min-get off on last stop and hotel is just across the street)OpenCor supermarket just adj. hotel (open 8am-2am)other one SuperSol is round bull ring(till10pm)We did't have breakfast at the hotel but is few cafes round bullring and historic centre offering set breakfast from 3,5o euro (cafe,orange juice with pastry or jamon sandwich)Room's big enough,clean but as someone mention before-strong smell of detergent in whole building.When air conditioner was on we notice kind of  chlorine smell-not pleasant.Cleaners a bit noise in the morning-they try to get to your room as soon is possible to…

title: Location,location..one of the best in Malaga
review: Stayed here for 8 days,went also to Granada,which is a lovely place. There was a smell of smoke in the room,although in the corridor there was a non-smoking sign. Maybe was allowed to smoke there earlier on.Didn't bother us that much. Also long black hair was left after the chambermaids had cleaned the room,espacially on the bathroom floor,not very nice...Otherwise very good hotel,good view towards Alcazaba,port and Gibralfaro. Excellent breakfast,they had it all,starting from churros to chocolate fondue. Also all kinds of cold meats,cheese,fresh fruit,cakes, bacon,eggs. You name it. Even cava if you fancied it in the morning.All staff very friendly,especially reception staff and the "doormen". Some people mentioned about the strong smell of detergent they use to clean, I think…

title: Fantastic Value and Location
review: I booked through booking.com and got rates from 70-90 Euro per night (we were here over a weekend). The room was fantastic, I asked for a high floor since past reviews mentioned traffic noise on low floors. Room 906 great corner room with views Alcazaba and Gibralfaro monuments, the Cathedral tower(s), the port, the beach around the corner (5 minute walk). Not from our room, but the bull ring can be seen from many rooms. We took advantage of the view from the roof-top gym. The jacuzzi and gym are small but clean, only open from 4pm-9:30pm, but squeezed in a couple of workouts during my stay instead of roughing it in the heat outdoors. From the jacuzzi, you can see the monuments and enjoy the sunset. We did not get the breakfast, since it is about 14 Euro a person. There are…

title: Great Location, Great Price
review: Enjoyed a lovely stay at this hotel during my summer vacation. Its a 3 minute walk from the beach and right behind the bullring. We could also see the fort (castillo de gibralfaro) from our room. We enjoyed the quick and efficient service of staff.  There were restaurants nearby and  we had a pleasant stay in Malaga.

title: Just Barely Average
review: This hotel was fine, albeit quiet expensive.  It would be a stretch to say it was worth the money.   I had expected a swimming pool & instead there is a sun deck & temporary jacuzzi and steam/sauna room on top.  What is described as a  "Spa" is one massage table in a room.  The fitness room was a collection of machines that desperately needed service.  It was truly laughable.  It was difficult to find and expensive to park.   The staff was very nice & that was really the only saving grace.   We did not eat any meals there.  I would not stay at this hotel again.

title: GREAT lOCATION
review: Stayed with my husband for three nights. It is my third visit to this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. 3 mins from the beach and 5 to the town. Big rooms all with balcony. Great breakfast plenty of choice. The staff are so friendly and the hotel is spotless.

title: Amazing view makes this hotel very special
review: This is a brilliant hotel mainly due to its amazing view from the balcony - we had an end room and could see high dramatic mountains with the fortress on one side, port and botanical gardens in front and sea to the left. This meant that you got a nice breeze coming in through the room in the evenings.  Near to the hotel there were a number of useful shops including a couple of grocery shops which sold water, drinks and other essentials, pharmacy, bank and take away for late snacks.  The hotel also  good toiletries, excellent customer service and unbeatable location (2 mins from beach and 10 mins to main centre via a shaded beautiful garden walk). The only of improvement was a couple of worn out bits in the room - edge of blind broken and wall slightly chipped but not a big deal…

title: A comfortable hotel in a good location with huge rooms!
review: I stayed here in March for three nights when visiting friends and cannot rate it highly enough. The staff were attentive, the rooms are huge for the price and decorated to a high standard with excellent Bathroom suites (I had two sinks, a shower cubicle as well as a Jacuzzi with additional shower in my room) with good balconies. On the roof of the hotel you will find a fitness centre with hot tub and sauna all with views overlooking the port and Bullring. Wifi is free and all amenities are within easy walking distance. I will stay here again.

title: A very pleasant 5 night stay .. .. ..
review: We very much enjoyed our short stay at the Hotel MS Maestranza (Sun 02/05/2010 to Fri 07/05/2010).  The staff were excellent and very polite. Our room was cleaned perfectly each day. The rooms were well presented but knowing from previous reviews that they didn't supply tea/coffee making facilities we simply brought our own. All manner of toiletry goodies were provided in the room including a shaving kit, toothbrush, toothpaste, hair shampoo, shower gel, tablets of soap, shoe polish, dental floss, tissues etc.    Didn't use their dining facilities as we much prefer mooching around to a local cafe for a morning coffee and croissant and hitting the Tapas bars lunch time and evenings. However, on one occasion on return from a shopping trip we did imbibe at the bar and found it to…

title: Sunny and friendly
review: We stayed here for three days at the end of March and had a very pleasant stay.  We took two rooms -- my wife and I in one room and our daughter and my sister-in-law in another. As noted by other reviewers, one side of the hotel is preferable -- the back, overlooking the bullring and facing the fort.  It's quieter too. My wife and I were in the front, which is directly across from other buildings (but you can see the sea from the balcony) and our daughter and her aunt were in a back room. My wife and I discussed asking the desk to change us, we didn't care enough -- and our doors faced each other for easy back and forth.  Our experience matched that of other reviewers -- the front desk people were very friendly and welcoming (we had no booking problems through Expedia) and gave…

title: Fantastic location & value for money, & bubbles for breakfast as well!
review: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of February. We chose this hotel because of the positive reports on Tripadvisor & an excellent deal on Airmiles. We weren't disappointed in any way.  We got the no.19 bus at the airport terminal as others have reported. Don't be put off by the mass of people waiting to board as everyone gets off here so there's room for everyone. We were slightly alarmed as the bus pulled into the bus terminal part way thru the journey but it only stops for folks to get on & off.  We were warmly greeted by a smiling & efficient receptionist who quickly dealt with the paperwork. We asked for a higher floor & were offered the top floor (12) so that was great.   As we opened the door to our room it ceratinly had the 'wow' factor as the view was stunning. It…

title: Excellent value for money.
review: A very easy journey into Malaga from the airport on a number 19 bus, costing 1.10 euro each, to the bus stop, 5 minutes walk from the hotel which was easily found. Hotel staff friendly and efficient. The bedroom and bathroom were immaculate. Bathroom with shower and bath. The hotel even provided spare toothbrushes and a shaving pack along with the usual shower gels and hair shampoo. The only criticism that I would make about the bedroom was that there was no kettle to make a brew! The hotel is very well located to the the port and the old city. We had beautiful views from our balcony over the port and the gardens and castle. A 24 hour supermarket is just across the road from the hotel. Recommended restaurants 'El Jardine' and 'Laboratorie'. We had  a very relaxing time here and…

title: Great location for a city break.
review: I know this area of Malaga really well, as I grew up here. So I knew what to expect with regards to the location. When me and my boyfriend arrived to a lovely reception we were very impressed. The room was a good size, perfect for a short break. Balcony looked out onto the bull ring and if you looked to the left could see the lovely view of the castle. Old style TV in the room with the usual spanish channels, and one english channel - sky news. The bed was massive! and the pillows were very comfy. Good sized bathroom with lots of goodies (shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush, ect..... even shoe polish) and it also had a hairdryer. The shower was great, so warm I could stand in it for ages.  The room all in all, was perfect. Decorated to a high standard and very clean. Maids came…

title: So close, yet so far away!
review: Hotel Maestranza was chosen due to both the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and pot luck that both my wife and I chose the Hotel at exactly the same time on two different PC's, something so spooky it had to be right or was it?  The Hotel from the outside is very plain and either the recession or the winter had taken its toll on the shops below as all were boarded up and closed down, this gave a poor first impression of the Hotel and the reception area did little to impress for a four star hotel either. Check in was swift and pleasant and we were given a room on the eigth floor overlooking the hillside directly infront, the Plaza de Toros below our window, The Alcazba to the left, the castle on top of the hill in front and the sea to the right, so absolutely no complaints here.…

title: Excellent Hotel with perfect location and nice top roof jacuzzi
review: We stayed for 5 days end December. We had 2 rooms (one for 3 teenagers and one for their parents).The strong points are it's ideal location - close to bus stops , the beach and the town centre only a 5-10 minute walk away. One has nice views as well.  We enjoyed the jacuzzi, steam bath and sauna (all free) after our long days of walkign and visiting.  It is on the 13th floor. Outside is a terrace for sunbathing  Breakfast is on the first floor and offers all you need. The hotel was not too busy so we could enjoy breakfast the way we usually like it. There are a couple of good restaurants in the neighbourhood, but also a few pizzeria's.  It is very good quality for what you pay and especially the fact it is not located in the busy own centre gives it sa certain distinct feature. …

title: Very Nice
review: First off if you are connecting through France there is a 25% your luggage won't make it - so pack accordingly.  Luckily the hotel provides a basket of soaps, toothbrushes & a razor so we were able to handle a 1 day delay of the luggage.  My room had a wonderful view of the castle & Alcazaba & the bull ring.  Also there is a taxi stand at the corner which was great because the tour buses don't pick up in the city - you have to go to a bus stop and when you get done you have to walk 5 blocks to an obscure taxi stand (1 time no taxis were there).  Also one day I forgot to lock the safe and everything was there.  The rooms are nicely decorated, beds a little hard (European way) but I loved the balcony and beach nearby.

title: Helpful front desk with nice rooms.
review: Nice rooms, very helpful front desk, breakfast definitly worth the extra money. Since we had a very early flight on our last day, they let us check out the night before and prepared a picnic box of breakfast items for us the next morning. The wi-fi in the rooms rarely worked and they only had one computer for guests to use.

title: Great value, nonsmokers take note!
review: Overall an excellent experience. VERY friendly and helpful staff, excellent location, very good breakfast with sufficient variety. We didn't realize that some rooms are for smokers so if you want to avoid that deep smelly smokey aroma in your room/matress, make sure you request this!

title: Ideal location
review: Hotel has an excellent location near the Bullring and from the rooftop spa and sun-lounge you can see all the main sights of Malaga. Ask for a room with a view over the mountains and bullring, because although the other side of the hotel faces the port, few rooms have a view of it and you will probably end up facing the buildings across the busy street.  The rooms are beautifully decorated on a Picasso theme. The soundproofing is very good and you could hardly tell you were in the centre of Malaga. Most of the main tourist attractions are within walking distance and the Malaga City Tour bus stops just behind the hotel. There are a number of restaurants around the hotel area and a 10- minute stroll through the park takes you to the main pedestrianised area of quality shopping and…

title: Friendly staff, good location, clean and well-run hotel
review: Hotel is perfectly located 10 minutes walk both from the city centre and the beach. Spacious clean rooms.  Staff has a "can do" attitude, all problems are resolved quickly.  There seems to be some issue with the wi-fi, which is available in the rooms and free, but the signal is so weak we could rarely enjoy uninterrupted connection. The staff was unable to identify the reason.  Great view over the port and the old castle from the rooms facing the road. These however tend to be noiser.

title: missing out on small details that make a difference
review: Very adequate hotel with nice staff.  There were many small problems that negatively impacted our stay.  The ventilation system was crude and the client's choice is to bake in the heat or freeze with the AC.  None of our group had any luck with the thermostat.  The internet was a joke.  While it is true they have wireless, it is poorly designed, poorly managed and not usable.  The staff denies a problem exists despite a dozen people standing around complaining about it.  ALso, their gym is open from 9 am until 6 pm.  Not sure who could use it during those hours but they are certainly more fit that we are given that it had no early morning hours.  On a positive note, the food was very good and the location is convenient.

title: Perfect location ...
review: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions (and work colleagues now stay here too) and it has always been of the same high standard.  Super-clean, rooms modern and a good size.  Free safe in room and TV with a number of channels.  The staff are efficient, friendly and welcoming.  The bar/restaurant area has beautiful views over the Cathedral and castle and those are stunning at night and the staff are great and always smiling.   The location is perfect for walking in and around Malaga city as well as the beach area, the Castle is across the road and the Bullring right next door.  Hotel downside: no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms.  My tip: if you are driving pre-book your parking with the hotel (a small discount) and they will park your car and return it to you when…

title: A very friendly hotel close to the beach and minutes from the city centre
review: We wanted a few days away in the sun in a city enviroment but with a beach. The hotel Maestranza is very well located as the beach is just a short stroll and the city centre with its good shopping, museums, etc is about a 10 minute walk through a park. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and nothing was to much trouble. Our room was a good size and it had a large balcony with superb views over the port and city centre. The breakfast in the hotel was good with an excellent variety of hot and cold food. If you are looking for a city centre break with a beach I would highly recommend this hotel and Malaga.

title: Made me feel at home
review: I wasn't going to bother with a review seeing as it would only re-iterate what others here have written about the Maestranza.And I booked my stay here on the strength of said reviews. Just to point out really that the staff are very, very nice.The rooms are gorgeous and clean.My balcony looked down on the corrida at the back of the hotel.Beautiful! The food in the restaurant was tasty and fresh and the service was friendly, prompt and relaxed. The roof-top spa is a lovely place to relax for an afternoon if you're not in the mood for town or the beach.I had a rotten journey getting here so I had a body massage and my body thanked me for it! The immediate vicinity is a pleasant suburb of small shops and businesses and many good bars, restaurants and nightclubs.In fact after a day…

title: Great Location
review: Staff provided very friendly service, which was really relaxing given that service in Spain can at times be shockingly rude.  Room was very good.  Housekeeping was excellent.  Our view was excellent.  The location was amazing: very short walk to the beach, close to main attractions, and the walk to the main shopping centre is through a gorgeous park adjacent to the hotel.  The only big downside was the Internet connection - it was terrible.  A slight downside was the lack of a pool.

title: Great views, great location, excellent service
review: The service at this hotel was fantastic.  The staff were polite, helpful, and friendly.  We arrived after a long bus ride and a pretty long hike across town from the station on a very hot day.  In summary, we didn't look or smell very good at that point.
