We got there before check-in time.  They were very polite, held our bags for us while we headed down to the beach.  When we returned, they checked us in, walked us to our room, and were very friendly throughout.  The manager spoke very good english, which made things easier for me, since my spanish is pretty bad.  The hotel itself is very classy.  It's located right next to the plaza del toros, near the castillo and palace grounds.  The beach is only 2 blocks away, and there are places to eat nearby too.  I recommend pizza…

title: Good new hotel with central location
review: I couldn't fault this hotel but we were careful to get a room at the back (the front overlooks a busy street and a roundabout). The rooms are good, very well tidied and cleaned every day. The room safe is great and our bedroom looked out at the bullring and old Malaga, great.   Malaga itself is no great shakes but v good as a hub to visit other Andulacian locations like Granada, Cordoba, and the Costa del Sol resorts. In fairness though, the old city is worth a day and our walks were hindered by a cold wind in our visiting month of Feb. I liked the promonade for jogging but really a beach that is situated beside a busy dual-carraigeway is not the place you want to be in Spain. Be sure to visit the Botanical Garden if you like trees and flowers; you could easily pass a few hours…

title: Great city break
review: We have just returned from city break at the Maestranza hotel. The hotel is in perfect location. Not too close and not too far away from city centre. Just few minutes from beach and in walk distance from all interesting buildings in Malaga. The staff there was very friendly and helpful and professional.  We enjoyed an evening in jacuzzi, watching night live in the city from the window on top floor. During warm days you can sunbath on the roof. Bar/Restaurant/Breakfast room was nice, staff friendly. We had very relaxed stay there, and we only can recommend this place.

title: Terrific Location!
review: This hotel was in the absolute best location for us- close to the beach for me, close to the historic part of town for my husband. Our room was nice, and we were ecstatic when we pulled open the drapes and realized we were looking straight across at the Alcazaba. We spent our days sleeping in, grabbing a quick bite at the hotel restaurant (very nice buffet), poking around the old town, exploring everything it had to offer, then eating a late lunch at one of the beach cafes and lolling the afternoon away in the sun and in the Med. Being slow season, we enjoyed the lack of craziness that Malaga is famous for. I will say, the wind picked up the last afternoon we on the beach, and the water got decidedly icky (bird feathers, trash, who knows what else).

title: Bad impression
review: We stayed in this hotel in July 2006 for 12 nights. The hotel seemed nice when we arrived, but had a bad incident there. We accidentally left 400 euros in cash in the pocket of jeans and went to the beach. After we came back (an hour later) the money were gone. Of course I could put the money into safebox and nothing would have happened but you know when you are in spain, you get relaxed impressed by a good hotel and so on.. never before has happened something like that.. when we came to the reception and told about this problem (before leaving the room to the beach we saw a maintanance guy who was doing I do not know what in the corridor and waiting for smth, obviously for the moment we leave the room... so when we came to the reception the staff could not do anything…

title: Malagan base
review: This hotel is exceptionally clean and well maintained - with a modern theme. It's a bit characterless-more a business person's hotel in design, although there were plenty of holidaymakers there. We had a junior suite -which meant a larger room & bed (the bed was enormous!) The bathroom was great with a powerful separate walk in shower & jacuzzi bath. Toiletries provided were very generous - we also got bathrobes & slippers. As others have remarked before, it's a shame there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. The room safe was free, which was a nice touch. Our room was on the 9th floor & faced the street. Traffic noise was loud with the window open, but could only just be heard when it was closed - and the air conditioning was quiet & good.However, I'd recommend…

title: Perfect location great hotel
review: We stayed at Hotel Maestranza for our honeymoon from April 30 to May 5.  The hotel upgraded us to a junior suite at no charge.  The room was beautiful, marble, hardwood, very modern look.  Jacuzzi, waterfall shower, and the balcony had the mediterranian sea to the left and the gibraltafour wall and cathedral to the right.  The staff were incredibly helpful, the location of the hotel is perfect, right next to the beach and minutes to walk to all of the beautiful sights in malaga.  Across the street from a grocery store, and surrounded by incredible restaurants, gorki, oriental gong, el rey del rodizio, and right next to the malaga bull fighting arena.  i highly recommend this hotel!!!  only warning, stay away from the room service, we were delivered a couple of hamburgers that…

title: Nice Clean Hotel But!!Music
review: I stayed there for one week and found the hotel was spotless and staff very friendly,even booking us a taxi to the airport without asking them. We stayed on the second floor and our only complaint was there was a club underneath the front of the hotel that went on till 6 am some nights,and you could hear the bass from the music,it was a little annoying tryning to get some sleep!but we aint that fussy so didnt really mind but just letting you know incase you get a room at the front facing the roundabout! We would stay again just a different side of hotel!! :)

title: Good location shame about the noise!
review: I have just returned from a 3 day break alone to Malaga. Nice city - lots of art and history to absorb if you so desire. This is really a very authentic working and bustling city, not your infamous lager lout territory. Form the hotel to the city centre is a good 10 mins walk [leisurely pace] along a palm tree lined boulevard.  For all you shoppers take note -  if you are looking for the El Cortes Ingles walk right through the city, its on the right and all the lovely little boutiques and jewellery store are in the larios square [ you won't miss it!]  The hotel has an internet connection that you can use for free - its on the 1st floor, next to bar/restaurant.  For the sake of 12 euros I would order breakfast from Hotel - buffet style hot and cold and plentiful. I tried to order…

title: better than we thought
review: I went with my husband in mid April and we booked trhough airmiles as it looked like the best deal for what was available. In fact we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful, and most spoke english. The breakfast buffet was very good value, although the coffee was awful (we ended up using the sachets of de-caf in preference!). The rooms aren't enormous but good enough with king size bed, very  nice bathroom and a balcony. We had fantastic views of the Alcazabar and city. However being situated on a major traffic junction it is very noisy - try and get a room overlooking the bullring rather than the other side. It is also within walking distance of everything. The beach is just down the road, the cathedral is about 10 minutes. We would stay there…

title: Good location near seafront and bullring
review: We stayed here for a week in March. Room very comfortable with balcony. It is probably better to be higher up than we were (4th floor) becaues of the relentless traffic. View from the terrace at top of building is amazing (bullring, Alcazaba). Other good points are lots of restaurants in the area around bullring.   Good also for getting to El Palo or Pedralejo for lunch of seafood etc. (taxi there only costs about 6 euro) and there is a taxi rank outside the hotel.    Would stay there again for sure.

title: booking policy
review: I booked this hotel through Winter Sunshine holidays and while they gladly took my money on the day of booking it took them 16 days to advise that they were overbooked.  This left me in the difficult position of having to arrange new accommodation at very short notice.  I would not use this hotel or Winter Sunshine Holidays again.  I wrote to complain and received no satisfaction.

title: Excellent value
review: We stayed here for 2 nights in early January and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel given our very cheap rate of 85 euro a night plus tax.  The location was good, less than 10 minutes' walk to the main shopping area.  The lobby was not madly impressive but how often do you see a nice lobby and disappointing rooms?  This was the opposite.  The room, while not huge, was an adequate size with lots of light and small balcony overlooking the bullring.  You could also see the Alcazba from our room.  There was an interior lobby so despite the fact that our room was alongside the lift it was very quiet and peaceful.  There was some kind of building going on outside from time to time but not too bothersome.  There were great blackout curtains so we had a good sleep-in.  Great…

title: Lovely Weekend
review: Went to visit Malaga for a weekend, stayed in the MS Maestranza for 3 nights. I would say that it is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in, had very nice room which over looked the castle and the harbour. The room could not be faulted, was a great size and was cleaned every day. The staff were very pleasant and happy to help. It is literally 5 minute walk from beach and a 10 minute walk from centre, therefore ideal location.  The pictures on the website where I booked, did not do it justice. If you are driving yourself, it maybe harder to find, we got a taxi from airport which took approx 20 mins. I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Well situated....stressfull to find!!
review: Only stayed one night in Malaga although to do city justice it deserves more. Very dificult find enterance to the hotel although could see the hotel sign on the roof, spent over an hour driving around a complicated road system in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Eventually porter took car from the side of the road and parked it for us. Lovely views from top of hotel, where sun loungers, jacuzzi and steam room. 5 min walk to beech, port, shopping, old city and castle. Room on 12th floor clean and modern and buffet breakfast was full of variety. I would love to stay again and for longer

title: Stunning location, Great staff
review: Can not be beaten for location, the roof top sun lounge looks directly into bullring. We were there during Feria and watched bullfights from the roof. City centre 10min walk away and the beach less than 5. Staff were amazing from reception to the chambermaids every one was polite and smiling. Only two small complaints, the ac was smelly and the breakfast poor. The cafe under the hotel was quite good though and opens at 8am unusualy early for the area.

title: Good hotel if you can find it
review: Oh my God, we had a heck of a time finding this hotel! It's smack in the middle of downtown and there's no driveway or parking, the street signs are microscopic and most of the streets are one-way. By taxi much easier than driving on your own, as we were.  However, as with everywhere we went in Andalucia, the staff was wonderful, helped us with our luggage, taxis, airline reservations, rental car snafus, etc. On our last day in Spain, when most everything else went wrong, they were great.

title: Somewhat over rated
review: I booked 3 nights from Sat to Mon based on the reviews on this site, and was slightly disappointed. Sure, the rooms are modern and clean, but a bit on the small side. No waste bin in the bedroom, the one in the bathroom was tiny, and tea/coffee making facilities would have been nice (especially for a 4 star at this price!). The bathroom was lacking in shelf space - and my wife only takes a modest amount of cosmetics etc. No toillet cleaning brush either.... The spa room is closed on Sundays, shame, as we were looking forward to a nice soak in the jacuzzi after exploring Malaga on foot.  However, the hotel is located within walking distance of Alcazaba and the surrounding areas and only a few minutes walk from the beach. The reception staff are very helpful, they sorted out our…

title: Great Location
review: We have just returned from our Easter vacation in Malaga and stayed at the MS Maestranza. The location of this hotel is ideal. The castle, cathedral and night life of the old town is within walking distance (10 minutes). The beach is a 5 minute walk. In addition the airport bus terminates across the road.  Our room was spacious and had a balcony. However when checking in ask for a room at the back of the hotel. Unfortunately our balcony was at the front over looking the main road and the cars could constantly be heard.  Breakfast was not included and we decided to sample some of the local cafes. These were overly priced and service took forever. On the 3rd morning we decided to opt for breakfast at the hotel. This was definitely the most cost effective choice as it there was a…

title: Super city hotel
review: Ideal location for a city break in Malaga. Hotel spotless, staff efficient and friendly. Worth asking for a quiet room (ours overlooked the Bullring and had good views also of the Castillo de Gibralfaro). Good value for money. Highly recommend.

title: Hotel Spot On
review: The choice of this hotel was pretty much "hoping for the best". As a party of ten, booking on the last minute, we had to take what we could get. We need not have worried, it turned out to be a great choice. Bedrooms tastefully furnished, spotlessly clean, as are the bath rooms. I would reccomend asking for a room on the higher floors, as there is a disco nearby, and you may hear noise from that on Saturday night. The staff were friendly and helpful. It is situated on the edge of the old town, which is very pretty. Beach close by, and alongside the bull ring.
